verses.ar_en: Who fed you mon in the wilderness that your forefathers had not known, in order to oppress you and in order to test you, to ultimately benefit you—

verses.ar_he: וְתֵימַר בְּלִבָּךְ חֵילִי וּתְקֵף יְדִי קְנוֹ לִי יָת נִכְסַיָא הָאִלֵין
verses.ar_en: And you think, ‘‘My strength and the power of my hand have acquired this wealth for me.’’

verses.ar_he: וְתִדְכַּר יָת יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ אֲרֵי הוּא יָהֵב לָךְ עֵצָה לְמִקְנֵי נִכְסִין בְּדִיל לְקַיָמָא יָת קְיָמֵהּ דִי קַיִים לְאֲבָהָתָךְ כְּיוֹמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: Recall Adonoy, your God, for it is He Who gives you counsel to acquire wealth, in order to establish His covenant that He swore to your forefathers this day.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אִם מִנְשָׁאָה תִנְשֵׁי יָת דַחַלְתָּא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וּתְהַךְ בָּתַר טַעְוַת עַמְמַיָא וְתִפְלְחִנוּן וְתִסְגוּד לְהוֹן אַסְהֵדִית בְּכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין אֲרֵי מֵיבַד תֵּיבְדוּן
verses.ar_en: When and if you forget [the fear of] Adonoy, your God, and follow other gods, and serve them and bow to them, I testify about you today that you will surely be destroyed.

verses.ar_he: כְּעַמְמַיָא דִי יְיָ מֹאבִיד מִקֳדָמֵיכוֹן כֵּן תֵּיבְדוּן חֳלַף דְלָא קַבֶּלְתּוּן בְּמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Like the nations that Adonoy is destroying before you, so will you be destroyed, as a consequence of your not heeding [the word of] Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל אַתְּ עָבֵר יוֹמָא דֵין יָת יַרְדְנָא לְמֵיעַל לְמֵירַת עַמְמִין רַבְרְבִין וְתַקִיפִין מִנָךְ קִרְוִין רַבְרְבָן וּכְרִיכָן עַד צֵית שְׁמַיָא
verses.ar_en: Listen, Yisroel! You are today crossing the Yardein to come inherit nations greater and more powerful than you; cities great and fortified to the [height of the] sky.

verses.ar_he: עַם רַב וְתַקִיף בְּנֵי גִבָּרַיָא דִי אַתְּ יְדַעַתְּ וְאַתְּ שְׁמַעְתְּ מָן יִכּוּל לְמֵיקַם קֳדָם בְּנֵי גִבָּרַיָא
verses.ar_en: A great and powerful people, descendants of the Anokim [giants], about whom you know and heard, ‘‘who can stand up to the descendants of Anok?’’

verses.ar_he: וְתִדַע יוֹמָא דֵין אֲרֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ הוּא דְעֲבַר קֳדָמָךְ מֵימְרֵהּ אֶשָׁא אָכְלָא הוּא יְשֵׁצִנוּן וְהוּא יְתָרֵכִנוּן קֳדָמָךְ וּתְתָרֵכִנוּן וְתוֹבְדִנוּן בִּפְרִיעַ כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל יְיָ לָךְ
verses.ar_en: You know today that Adonoy, your God, is the One crossing before you, [His word is] a consuming fire, He will destroy them and He will subdue them before you; you will expel them and destroy them quickly, as Adonoy promised for you.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵימַר בְּלִבָּךְ בִּדְיִתְּבַר יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָתְהוֹן מִקֳדָמָךְ לְמֵימַר בְּזָכוּתִי אַעֲלַנִי יְיָ לְמֵירַת יָת אַרְעָא הָדָא וּבְחוֹבֵי עַמְמַיָא הָאִלֵין יְיָ מְתָרֶכְהוֹן מֵקֳדָמָךְ
verses.ar_en: Do not think, when Adonoy, your God, smashes them before you, saying: ‘‘Because of my righteousness [merit] has Adonoy brought me to inherit this land,’’ and because of the wickedness [sins] of these nations is Adonoy expelling them before you.

verses.ar_he: לָא בְזָכוּתָךְ וּבְקַשִׁיטּוּת לִבָּךְ אַתְּ עָלֵל לְמֵירַת יָת אַרְעֲהוֹן אֲרֵי בְּחוֹבֵי עַמְמַיָא הָאִלֵין יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מתָרֶכְהוֹן מִקָדָמָךְ וּבְדִיל לַאֲקָמָא יָת פִּתְגָמָא דִי קַיִים יְיָ לַאֲבָהָתָךְ לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיַעֲקֹב
verses.ar_en: Not because of your righteousness [merit] and the uprightness of your heart are you coming to inherit their land. Rather, because of the wickedness [sins] of these nations is Adonoy, your God, expelling them before you, and in order to fulfill the matter that Adonoy swore to your forefathers—to Avrohom, to Yitzchok, and to Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וְתִדַע אֲרֵי לָא בְזָכוּתָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ יָת אַרְעָא טַבְתָא הָדָא לְמֵירְתַהּ אֲרֵי עַם קְשֵׁי קְדַל אַתְּ
verses.ar_en: Know that not because of your righteousness is Adonoy, your God, giving you this good land to inherit, for you are a stubborn people.

verses.ar_he: הֱוֵי דְכִיר לָא תִנְשֵׁי יָת דִי אַרְגֶזְתָּא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּמַדְבְּרָא לְמִן יוֹמָא דִי נְפַקְתָּא מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם עַד מֵיתֵיכוֹן עַד אַתְרָא הָדֵין מְסָרְבִין הֲוֵיתוּן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Recall, do not forget, how you angered Adonoy, your God, in the wilderness; from the day you left the land of Egypt until you arrived at this place you have been defiers with Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּבְחוֹרֵב אַרְגֶזְתּוּן קֳדָם יְיָ וַהֲוָה רְגַז מִן קֳדָם יְיָ בְּכוֹן לְשֵׁיצָאָה יַתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: And in Choreiv you angered Adonoy, and [from before] Adonoy was infuriated with you to destroy you.

verses.ar_he: בְּמִסְקִי לְטוּרָא לְמִסַב לוּחֵי אַבְנַיָא לוּחֵי קְיָמָא דִי גְזַר יְיָ עִמְכוֹן וִיתֵבִית בְּטוּרָא אַרְבְּעִין יְמָמִין וְאַרְבְּעִין לֵילָוָן לַחֲמָא לָא אֲכָלִית וּמַיָא לָא אִשְׁתֵּיתִי
verses.ar_en: When I went up the mountain to take the stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant that Adonoy made with you, I remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights; I ate no bread and drank no water.

verses.ar_he: וִיהַב יְיָ לִי יָת תְּרֵין לוּחֵי אַבְנַיָא כְּתִיבִין בְּאֶצְבְּעָא דַיְיָ וַעֲלֵיהוֹן כְּכָל פִּתְגָמַיָא דִי מַלִיל יְיָ עִמְכוֹן בְּטוּרָא מִגוֹ אֶשָׁתָא בְּיוֹמָא דִקְהָלָא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy gave me the two stone tablets written with God’s finger and upon them all the statements that Adonoy addressed to you on the mountain from within the fire, on the day of assembly.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה מִסוֹף אַרְבְּעִין יְמָמִין וְאַרְבְּעִין לֵילָוָן יְהַב יְיָ לִי יָת תְּרֵין לוּחֵי אַבְנַיָא לוּחֵי קְיָמָא
verses.ar_en: When, at the end of forty days and forty nights, Adonoy gave me the two stone tablets, the covenant tablets,

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לִי קוּם חוּת בִּפְרִיעַ מִכָּא אֲרֵי חַבִּיל עַמָךְ דִי אַפֶּקְתָּא מִמִצְרָיִם סָטוּ בִּפְרִיעַ מִן אָרְחָא דִי פַקֶדְתִּנוּן עֲבָדוּ לְהוֹן מַתְּכָא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to me, ‘‘Get ready! Go down quickly from here, because your people has corrupted—whom you took out of Egypt; they have veered swiftly from the way that I commanded them; they made them a molten image.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לִי לְמֵימָר גְלֵי קֳדָמַי יָת עַמָא הָדֵין וְהָא עַם קְשֵׁי קְדַל הוּא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to me, to say, ‘‘I have seen this people [have been revealed berore Me], and look, it is a stubborn people!

verses.ar_he: אַנַח בָּעוּתָךְ מִקֳדָמַי וֶאֱשֵׁצִנוּן וְאֶמְחֵי יָת שִׁמְהוֹן מִתְּחוֹת שְׁמַיָא וְאֶעְבֵּד יָתָךְ לְעַם תַּקִיף וְסַגִי מִנְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Leave Me alone and let Me destroy them and eliminate their name from beneath the sky, and let Me make you into a nation more powerful and numerous than they.’’

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְפְּנֵיתִי וּנְחָתִית מִן טוּרָא וְטּוּרָא בָּעֵר בְּאֶשָׁתָא וּתְרֵין לוּחֵי קְיָמָא עַל תַּרְתֵּין יְדָי
verses.ar_en: I turned and descended the mountain, and the mountain was burning with fire; and the two covenant tablets were on my two hands.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזֵיתִי וְהָא חַבְתּוּן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן עֲבַדְתּוּן לְכוֹן עֵגֶל מַתְּכָא סְטֵיתוּן בִּפְרִיעַ מִן אָרְחָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I beheld that you had just sinned to Adonoy, your God, you had made yourselves a molten calf; you had veered swiftly from the way that Adonoy had commanded you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲחָדִית בִּתְרֵין לוּחַיָא וּרְמִיתִנוּן מֵעַל תַּרְתֵּין יְדָי וּתְבַרְתִּנוּן לְעֵינֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I grasped the two tablets and threw them from (upon) my two hands, and smashed them before your eyes.

verses.ar_he: וְאִשְׁתַּטָחִית קֳדָם יְיָ כְּקַדְמֵיתָא אַרְבְּעִין יְמָמִין וְאַרְבְּעִין לֵילָוָן לַחְמָא לָא אֲכָלִית וּמַיָא לָא אִשְׁתֵּיתִי עַל כָּל חוֹבֵיכוֹן דִי חַבְתּוּן לְמֶעְבַּד דְבִישׁ קֳדָם יְיָ לְאַרְגָזָא קֳדָמוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: I prostrated myself before Adonoy as before, forty days and forty nights, bread I did not eat nor water did I drink; for all of your sin that you sinned by doing what is evil in [before] Adonoy’s eyes to anger [before] Him.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי דְחֵלִית מִקָדָם רָגְזָא וְחֵמְתָא דִי רְגַז יְיָ עֲלֵיכוֹן לְשֵׁצָאָה יָתְכוֹן וְקַבִּיל יְיָ צְלוֹתִי אַף בְּזִמְנָא הַהִיא
verses.ar_en: Because I was afraid of the anger and the fury that Adonoy raged at you to destroy you; and Adonoy accepted my prayer that time as well.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל אַהֲרֹן הֲוָה רְגַז מִן קֳדָם יְיָ לַחֲדָא לְשֵׁצָיוּתֵהּ וְצַלֵיתִי אַף עַל אַהֲרֹן בְּעִדָנָא הַהִיא
verses.ar_en: And at Aharon [from before] Adonoy [He] grew very angry to destroy him; I prayed for Aharon, too, at that time.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת חוֹבָתְכוֹן דִי עֲבַדְתּוּן יָת עֶגְלָא נְסֵבִית וְאוֹקֵדִית יָתֵהּ בְּנוּרָא וְשָׁפִית יָתֵהּ בְּשׁוּפִינָא יָאוּת עַד דִי הֲוָה דַקִיק לְעַפְרָא וּרְמֵת יָת עַפְרֵהּ לְנַחֲלָא דְנָחֵת מִן טוּרָא
verses.ar_en: And the sin[-object] that you made, the calf, I took and burned it in fire. I crushed it—thoroughly grinding it—until it was fine—to dust; and I threw its dust into the stream that was flowing down from the mountain.

verses.ar_he: וּבִדְלֶקְתָּא וּבְנִסֵתָא וּבְקִבְרֵי דִמְשַׁאֲלֵי מַרְגְזִין הֲוֵיתוּן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: And in Tav’eiroh and in Massoh and in Kivros Hata’voh you were angerers of [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְכַד שְׁלַח יְיָ יָתְכוֹן מֵרְקַם גֵיאָה לְמֵימַר סְקוֹ וְאַחֲסִינוּ יָת אַרְעָא דִי יְהָבִית לְכוֹן וְסָרֶבְתּוּן עַל גְזֵרַת מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן וְלָא הֵימַנְתּוּן לֵהּ וְלָא קַבֶּלְתּוּן לְמֵימְרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: And when Adonoy sent you from Kodeish Barnei’a [Rekam Geyah], saying, ‘‘Go up and inherit the land that I have given you.’’ But you defied [the decree of the word of] Adonoy, your God, and did not trust Him, and did not heed Him [accept His word].

verses.ar_he: מְסָרְבִין הֲוֵיתוּן קֳדָם יְיָ מִיוֹמָא דִידָעִית יָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Defiers have you been with Adonoy, from the day I know you.

verses.ar_he: וְאִשְׁתַּטָחִית קֳדָם יְיָ יָת אַרְבְּעִין יְמָמִין וְיָת אַרְבְּעִין לֵילָוָן דִי אִשְׁתַּטָחִית אֲרֵי אֲמַר יְיָ לְשֵׁצָאָה יָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I prostrated myself before Adonoy the forty days and the forty nights that I prostrated myself, because Adonoy intended to destroy you.

verses.ar_he: וְצַלֵיתִי קֳדָם יְיָ וַאֲמָרִית יְיָ אֱלֹהִים לָא תְחַבֵּל עַמָךְ וְאַחֲסַנְתָּךְ דִי פְרַקְתָּא בְּתָקְפָּךְ דִי אַפֶּקְתָּא מִמִצְרַיִם בִּידָא תַקִיפָא
verses.ar_en: I prayed to Adonoy and said, ‘‘Adonoy, God, do not harm Your people and Your territory that You redeemed with Your power, whom You took out of Egypt with a powerful hand.

verses.ar_he: אִדְכַר לְעַבְדָיךְ לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיַעֲקֹב לָא תִתְפְּנֵי לְקַשְׁיוּת עַמָא הָדֵין וּלְחוֹבֵיהוֹן וְלַחֲטָאֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Recall Your servants—Avrohom, Yitzchok, and Yaakov; do not pay attention to the stubborness of this people, to its wickedness, and to its sin.

verses.ar_he: דִילְמָא יֵימְרוּן דָיְרֵי אַרְעָא דִי אַפֶּקְתָּנָא מִתַּמָן מִדְלֵית יוּכְלָא דַיְיָ לְאָעָלוּתְהוֹן לְאַרְעָא דִי מַלִיל לְהוֹן וּמִדְסָנֵי יָתְהוֹן אַפֵּקִנוּן לְקַטָלוּתְהוֹן בְּמַדְבְּרָא
verses.ar_en: Lest [the inhabitants] say—[of] the land that you took us out of—‘Because of Adonony’s inability to bring them [up] to the land that He promised for them, and because of His hatred of them, He took them out to kill them in the wilderness.’

verses.ar_he: וְאִנוּן עַמָךְ וְאַחֲסַנְתָּךְ דִי אַפֶּקְתָּא בְּחֵילָךְ רַבָּא וּבִדְרָעָךְ מְרָמְמָא
verses.ar_en: But they are Your people, Your territory, whom You took out with Your great power and with Your extended arm.’’

verses.ar_he: בְּעִדָנָא הַהִיא אֲמַר יְיָ לִי פְּסַל לָךְ תְּרֵין לוּחֵי אַבְנַיָא כְּקַדְמָאֵי וְסַק לָקֳדָמַי לְטּוּרָא וְתַעְבֵּד לָךְ אֲרוֹנָא דְאָעָא
verses.ar_en: At that time, Adonoy said to me, ‘‘Hew for yourself two stone tablets like the originals, and ascend to [before] Me on the mountain; and make for yourself a wooden case.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶכְתּוֹב עַל לוּחַיָא יָת פִּתְגָמַיָא דִי הֲווֹ עַל לוּחַיָא קַדְמָאֵי דִי תְבַרְתָּא וּתְשַׁוִנוּן בַּאֲרוֹנָא
verses.ar_en: And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the original tablets that you smashed, and you will place them in the case.’’

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדִית אֲרוֹנָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִּין וּפְסָלִית תְּרֵין לוּחֵי אַבְנַיָא כְּקַדְמָאֵי וּסְלֵקִית לְטוּרָא וּתְרֵין לוּחַיָא בִּידִי
verses.ar_en: So I made a case of shittim wood, and I hewed two stone tablets like the originals, and I ascended the mountain with the two tablets in my hand.

verses.ar_he: וּכְתַב עַל לוּחַיָא כִּכְתָבָא קַדְמָאָה יָת עַשְׂרָא פִתְגָמַיָא דִי מַלִיל יְיָ עִמְכוֹן בְּטוּרָא מִגוֹ אֶשְׁתָא בְּיוֹמָא דִקְהָלָא וִיהָבִנוּן יְיָ לִי
verses.ar_en: He wrote on the tablets like the original writing, the ten statements that Adonoy addressed to you on the mountain from within the fire on the day of assembly, and Adonoy gave them to me.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְפְּנֵיתִי וּנְחָתִית מִן טוּרָא וְשַׁוֵיתִי יָת לוּחַיָא בַּאֲרוֹנָא דִי עֲבָדִית וַהֲווֹ תַמָן כְּמָא דִי פַקְדַנִי יְיָ
verses.ar_en: I turned and descended the mountain, and placed the tablets into the case that I had made; and they remained there as Adonoy had commanded me.

verses.ar_he: וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נְטָלוּ מִבְּאֵרוֹת בְּנֵי יַעֲקָן לְמוֹסֵרָה תַּמָן מִית אַהֲרֹן וְאִתְקְבַר תַּמָן וְשַׁמֵשׁ אֶלְעָזָר בְּרֵהּ תְּחוֹתוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Bnei Yisroel traveled from Be’eiros Bnei Ya’akon to Moseiroh. There Aharon died and was buried there; and his son El’ozor served in his stead.

verses.ar_he: מִתַּמָן נְטָּלוּ לְגֻדְגֹד וּמִן גֻדְגֹד לְיָטְבָת אַרְעָא נָגְדָא נַחֲלִין דְמַיִין
verses.ar_en: From there they traveled to Goodgode, and from Goodgode to Yotvos, a land with flowing with streams of water.

verses.ar_he: בְּעִדָנָא הַהִיא אַפְרֵשׁ יְיָ יָת שִׁבְטָּא דְלֵוִי לְמִטַל יָת אֲרוֹן קְיָמָא דַיְיָ לְמֵיקַם קֳדָם יְיָ לְשַׁמָשׁוּתֵהּ וּלְבָרָכָא בִשְׁמֵהּ עַד יוֹמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: At that time Adonoy separated the tribe of Leivi to carry the case of Adonoy’s covenant, to stand before Adonoy to serve Him, and to bless in His name until this day.

verses.ar_he: עַל כֵּן לָא הֲּוָה לְלֵוִי חֳלָק וְאַחֲסָנָא עִם אֲחוֹהִי מַתְּנָן דִיהַב לֵהּ יְיָ אִנוּן אַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: This is why Leivi had no share or territory with his brothers: [the gifts which] Adonoy [has given him are] is his territory as Adonoy, your God, promised for him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲנָא הֲוֵיתִי קָאֵם בְּטוּרָא כְּיוֹמִין קַדְמָאִין אַרְבְּעִין יְמָמִין וְאַרְבְּעִין לֵילָוָן וְקַבִּיל יְיָ צְלוֹתִי אַף בְּזִמְנָא הַהוּא לָא אָבֵי יְיָ לְחַבָּלוּתָךְ
verses.ar_en: And I remained on the mountain like the previous time, forty days and forty nights, and Adonoy accepted my prayer that time, too; Adonoy was unwilling to harm you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לִי קוּם זִיל לְמִטוּל קֳדָם עַמָא וְיֵעֲלוּן וְיֵרְתוּן יָת אַרְעָא דִי קַיֵמִית לַאֲבָהָתְהוֹן לְמִתַּן לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy said to me, ‘‘Get ready! Go lead the people’s traveling, and let them come and inherit the land that I swore to their forefathers to give them.’’

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן יִשְׂרָאֵל מָה יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ תָּבַע מִנָךְ אֱלָהֵן לְמִדְחַל קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לִמְהַךְ בְּכָל אָרְחָן דְתָקְנָן קֳדָמוֹהִי וּלְמִרְחַם יָתֵהּ וּלְמִפְלַח קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּכָל לִבָּךְ וּבְכָל נַפְשָׁךְ
verses.ar_en: And now, Yisroel, what is Adonoy, your God, asking [demand] of you, other than to fear Adonoy, your God, to go in all His ways [that are correct before Him] and to love Him, and to serve Adonoy, your God, wholeheartedly and with your whole being.

verses.ar_he: לְמִטַר יָת פִּקוֹדַיָא דַיְיָ וְיָת קְיָמוֹהִי דַאֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין לִדְיֵיטַב לָךְ
verses.ar_en: To guard Adonoy’s commandments and His statutes that I am commanding you today; for your benefit.

verses.ar_he: הָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ שְׁמַיָא וּשְׁמֵי שְׁמַיָא אַרְעָא וְכָל דִי בַהּ
verses.ar_en: Look! to Adonoy, your God, belong the heavens and the heavens beyond the heavens, the earth and all that is in it.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד בַּאֲבָהָתָךְ צָבֵי יְיָ לְמִרְחַם יָתְהוֹן וְאִתִּרְעֵי בִּבְנֵיהוֹן בַּתְרֵיהוֹן בְּכוֹן מִכָּל עַמְמַיָא כְּיוֹמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: [Yet] only your forefathers did Adonoy desire, to love them; and He chose their descendants after them—you—from all the peoples, like this day.

verses.ar_he: וְתֶעְדוּן יָת טַפְשׁוּת לִבְּכוֹן וּקְדָלְכוֹן לָא תַקְשׁוּן עוֹד
verses.ar_en: You are to remove your heart’s blockage [foolishness], not to make yourselves stubborn any more.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן הוּא אֱלָהָא דַיָנִין וּמָרֵי מַלְכִין אֱלָהָא רַבָּא גִבָּרָא וּדְחִילָא דִי לֵית קֳדָמוֹהִי מִסַב אַפִּין וְאַף לָא לְקַבָּלָא שָׁחְדָא
verses.ar_en: For Adonoy, your God, is God over judges and Lord over lords [kings]; the Almighty—the Great, the Powerful, and the Awesome [One]—Who neither exercises [that there is not before Him] favoritism nor accepts bribes.

verses.ar_he: עָבֵד דִין יִתַּם וְאַרְמְלָא וְרָחֵם גִיוֹרָא לְמִתַּן לֵהּ מְזוֹנָא וּכְסוּ
verses.ar_en: Who performs justice for orphan and widow, and loves the convert to give him bread [sustenance] and a garment [shelter].

verses.ar_he: וְתִרְחֲמוּן יָת גִיוֹרָא אֲרֵי דַיָרִין הֲוֵיתוּן בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: You are to love the convert, because you were strangers in the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: יָת יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ תִּדְחַל וְקָדָמוֹהִי תִפְלָח וּלְדַחַלְתֵּהּ תִּקְרַב וּבִשְׁמֵהּ תְּקַיַם
verses.ar_en: You are to fear [before] Adonoy, your God, serve Him, cling to Him [come near to the fear of Him], and swear by His name.

verses.ar_he: הוּא תֻשְׁבַּחְתָּךְ וְהוּא אֱלָהָךְ דַעֲבַד עִמָךְ יָת רַבְרְבָתָא וְיָת חֲסִינָתָא הָאִלֵין דִי חֲזוֹ עֵינָיךְ
verses.ar_en: He is your praise and He is your God, Who performed with you these great and fearsome things that your eyes witnessed.

verses.ar_he: בְּשַׁבְעִין נַפְשָׁן נְחָתוּ אֲבָהָתָךְ לְמִצְרָיִם וּכְעַן שַׁוְיָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ כְּכוֹכְבֵי שְׁמַיָא לְמִסְגֵי
verses.ar_en: Numbering seventy people, your forefathers went down to Egypt; and now Adonoy, your God, has placed you like the stars of the sky, numerous.

verses.ar_he: וְתִרְחַם יָת יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וְתִטַּר מַטְרַת מֵימְרֵהּ וּקְיָמוֹהִי וְדִינוֹהִי וּפִקוֹדוֹהִי כָּל יוֹמַיָא
verses.ar_en: You are to love Adonoy, your God, and you are to guard His watch [word], and His statutes, and His laws, and His commandments, all the years.

verses.ar_he: וְתִדְעוּן יוֹמָא דֵין אֲרֵי לָא יָת בְּנֵיכוֹן דִי לָא יְדָעוּ וְדִי לָא חֲזוֹ יָת אֻלְפָנָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן יָת רְבוּתֵהּ יָת יְדֵהּ תַּקִיפָא וּדְרָעֵהּ מְרָמְמָא
verses.ar_en: You will know today that not with your children who have not known and who have not seen the teaching of Adonoy, your God—His greatness, His powerful hand and His extended arm,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת אַתְוָתֵהּ וְיָת עוֹבָדוֹהִי דִי עֲבַד בְּגוֹ מִצְרָיִם לְפַרְעֹה מַלְכָּא דְמִצְרַיִם וּלְכָל אַרְעֵהּ
verses.ar_en: and His signs and His deeds that He performed within Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, and to his entire land;

verses.ar_he: וְדִי עֲבַד לְמַשִׁרְיַת מִצְרַיִם לְסוּסְוָתֵהּ וְלִרְתִיכוֹהִי דִי אַטִיף יָת מֵי יַמָא דְסוּף עַל אַפֵּיהוֹן בְּמִרְדָפְהוֹן בַּתְרֵיכוֹן וְאוֹבָדִנוּן יְיָ עַד יוֹמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: And what He did to the Egyptian army [host], to its horses and to its chariots—that He flooded the waters of Yam Suf over them when they were chasing you—Adonoy destroyed them until this day;

verses.ar_he: וְדִי עֲבַד לְכוֹן בְּמַדְבְּרָא עַד מֵיתֵיכוֹן עַד אַתְרָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: And what He did for you in the wilderness, until you arrived at this place;

verses.ar_he: וְדִי עֲבַד לְדָתָן וְלַאֲבִירָם בְּנֵי אֱלִיאָב בַּר רְאוּבֵן דִי פְתָחַת אַרְעָא יָת פּוּמַהּ וּבְלָעָתְנוּן וְיָת אֱנַשׁ בָּתֵּיהוֹן וְיָת מַשְׁכְּנֵיהוֹן וְיָת כָּל יְקוּמָא דִי עִמְהוֹן בְּגוֹ כָּל יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: And what He did to Dosson and to Avirom sons of Eli’ov son of Re’uven, that the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them and [the members of] their families and their tents and all the sustenance at their feet [that was with them] amid all of Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי עֵינֵיכוֹן חֲזָאָן יָת כָּל עוֹבָדָא דַיְיָ רַבָּא דִי עֲבָד
verses.ar_en: Rather your eyes have been witnessing the entire overwhelming activity of Adonoy that He has performed.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן יָת כָּל תַּפְקֶדְתָּא דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין בְּדִיל דְתִתְקְפוּן וְתֵעֲלוּן וְתֵירְתוּן יָת אַרְעָא דִי אַתּוּן עָבְרִין תַּמָן לְמֵירְתַהּ
verses.ar_en: You will guard the entire mitzvah that I am commanding you today, in order that you be encouraged and will arrive in, [amd go up to,] and inherit the land that you are crossing over there to inherit.

verses.ar_he: וּבְדִיל דְתוֹרְכוּן יוֹמִין עַל אַרְעָא דִי קַיִים יְיָ לַאֲבָהָתְכוֹן לְמִתַּן לְהוֹן וְלִבְנֵיהוֹן אַרְעָא עָבְדָא חֲלַב וּדְבָשׁ
verses.ar_en: And in order that you will last long on the land that Adonoy swore to your forefathers to give to them and to their descendants, a land flowing [producing] milk and honey.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי אַרְעָא דִי אַתְּ עָלֵל לְתַמָן לְמֵירְתַהּ לָא כְאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם הִיא דִי נְפַקְתּוּן מִתַּמָן דִי תִזְרַע יָת זַרְעָךְ וּמַשְׁקַת לֵהּ בְּרַגְלָךְ כְּגִנְתָא יַרְקָא
verses.ar_en: For the land where you are arriving to inherit is not like the land of Egypt from which you departed, where you planted your seed and watered [it] on foot like a vegetable garden.

verses.ar_he: וְאַרְעָא דִי אַתּוּן עָבְרִין תַּמָן לְמֵירְתַהּ אֲרַע טוּרִין וּבִקְעָן לִּמְטַּר שְׁמַיָא תִּשְׁתֵּי מַיָא
verses.ar_en: Rather, the land where you are crossing to inherit is a land of mountains and plains—by the rain of the skies will you drink water.

verses.ar_he: אַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ תָּבַע יָתַהּ תְּדִירָא עֵינֵי דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בַּהּ מֵרֵישָׁא דְשַׁתָּא וְעַד סוֹפָא דְשַׁתָּא
verses.ar_en: A land that Adonoy, your God, looks after; the eyes of Adonoy, your God, are always upon it, from the year’s beginning until the year’s end.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אִם קַבָּלָא תְקַבְּלוּן לְפִקוּדַי דִי אֲנָא מְפַקֵד יָתְכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין לְמִרְחַם יָת יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן וּלְמִפְלַח קֳדָמוֹהִי בְּכָל לִבְּכוֹן וּבְכָל נַפְשְׁכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Should you thoroughly heed My commandments that I am commanding you today—to love Adonoy, your God, and to serve [before] Him with all your desires and with your entire beings,

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתֵּן מְטַר אַרְעֲכוֹן בְּעִדָנֵהּ בַּכִּיר וְלַקִישׁ וְתִכְנוֹשׁ עִבוּרָךְ וְחַמְרָךְ וּמִשְׁחָךְ
verses.ar_en: I will provide the rain of your land in its time, fall rain and spring rain, and you will harvest your grain and your wine and your olive oil.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתֵּן עִשְׂבָּא בְחַקְלָךְ לִבְעִירָךְ וְתֵיכוּל וְתִשְׂבָּע
verses.ar_en: And I will provide grass in your field for your animals, and you will eat and be full.

verses.ar_he: אִסְתַּמָרוּ לְכוֹן דִילְמָא יִטְעוּן לִבְּכוֹן וְתִסְטוּן וְתִפְלְחוּן לְטַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא וְתִסְגְדוּן לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Look out for yourselves lest your heart be misled [mistaken] and you turn away and serve other gods [idols of the nations] and bow to them,

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְקוֹף רָגְזָא דַיְיָ בְּכוֹן וְיֵחוֹד יָת שְׁמַיָא וְלָא יְהֵי מִטְרָא וְאַרְעָא לָא תִתֵּן יָת עֲלַלְתַּהּ וְתֵיבְדוּן בִּפְרִיעַ מֵעַל אַרְעָא טַבְתָא דַיְיָ יָהֵב לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy’s anger will be aroused against you, and He will restrain the skies and there will be no rain, and the soil will not yield its produce, and you will swiftly be removed from upon the good land that Adonoy is giving you.

verses.ar_he: וּתְשַׁווּן יָת פִּתְגָמַי אִלֵין עַל לִבְּכוֹן וְעַל נַפְשְׁכוֹן וְתִקְטְרוּן יָתְהוֹן לְאָת עַל יֶדְכוֹן וִיהוֹן לִתְפִלִין בֵּין עֵינֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You are to place these words of Mine on your mind and on your being, and bind them as a sign on your hand and they will be totafos [tefillin] on your head;

verses.ar_he: וְתַלְפוּן יָתְהוֹן יָת בְּנֵיכוֹן לְמַלָלָא בְהוֹן בְּמִתְּבָךְ בְּבֵיתָךְ וּבִמְהָכָךְ בְּאָרְחָא וּבְמִשְׁכְּבָךְ וּבִמְקִימָךְ
verses.ar_en: And you are to teach them to your sons to speak in them when you sit at home, and when you journey on the road, and when you go to sleep, and when you rise;

verses.ar_he: וְתִכְתְּבִנוּן עַל מְזוּזְיָן וְתִקְבְּעִנוּן בְּסִפֵּי בֵיתָךְ וּבְתַרְעָיךְ
verses.ar_en: And you are to write them on the doorposts [and affix them to the lintels] of your home and your gateways.

verses.ar_he: בְּדִיל דְיִסְגוּן יוֹמֵיכוֹן וְיוֹמֵי בְנֵיכוֹן עַל אַרְעָא דִי קַיִים יְיָ לַאֲבָהָתְכוֹן לְמִתַּן לְהוֹן כְּיוֹמֵי שְׁמַיָא עַל אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: In order that they will be many—your years and the years of your children on the soil that Adonoy swore to your forefathers to give them, like the years of heaven on earth.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי אִם מִטַר תִּטְרוּן יָת כָּל תַּפְקֶדְתָּא הָדָא דִי אֲנָא מְפַקֵד יָתְכוֹן לְמֶעְבְּדַהּ לְמִרְחַם יָת יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן לִמְהַךְ בְּכָל אָרְחָן דְתַקְנָן קֳדָמוֹהִי וּלְאִתְקְרָבָא לְדַחַלְתֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: For if you truly guard this entire mitzvah that I am commanding you to perform, to love Adonoy, your God, to walk in all His ways [that are correct before Him] and to cling to Him [come near to the fear of Him].

verses.ar_he: וִיתָרֵךְ יְיָ יָת כָּל עַמְמַיָא הָאִלֵין מִקֳדָמֵיכוֹן וְתֵירְתוּן עַמְמִין רַבְרְבִין וְתַקִיפִין מִנְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will expel all these nations before you, and you will inherit nations greater and more powerful than you.

verses.ar_he: כָּל אַתְרָא דִי תִדְרוֹךְ פַּרְסַת רַגְלְכוֹן בֵּהּ דִלְכוֹן יְהֵי מִן מַדְבְּרָא וְלִבְנָן מִן נַהֲרָא נְהַר פְּרָת וְעַד יַמָא מַעַרְבָא יְהֵי תְחוּמְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Every place that the sole of your foot steps on will be yours, from the wilderness and the Lebanon, form the river—the Euphrates River—up to the ultimate [western] sea, will be your boundary.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִתְעַתַּד אֱנָשׁ קֳדָמֵיכוֹן דַחֲלָתְכוֹן וְאֵימָתְכוֹן יִתֵּן יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן עַל אַפֵּי כָל אַרְעָא דִי תִדְרְכוּן בַּהּ כְּמָה דִי מַלִיל לְכוֹן: ססס
verses.ar_en: No man will stand up to you; fear of you and awe of you will Adonoy, your God, place upon the surface of the entire land that you are stepping into, as He promised you.

verses.ar_he: חֲזֵי דִי אֲנָא יָהֵב קֳדָמֵיכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין בִּרְכָן וּלְוָטִין
verses.ar_en: Look, I place before you today, a blessing and a curse.

verses.ar_he: יָת בִּרְכָן דִי תְקַבְּלוּן לְפִקוּדַיָא דַיְיָ אֳלָהֲכוֹן דִי אֲנָא מְפַקֵד יָתְכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין
verses.ar_en: The blessing—that you heed [obey] the commandments of Adonoy, your God, that I am commanding you today.

verses.ar_he: וּלְוָטִין אִם לָא תְקַבְּלוּן לְפִקוּדַיָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן וְתִסְטוּן מִן אָרְחָא דִי אֲנָא מְפַקֵד יָתְכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין לִמְהַךְ בָּתַר טַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא דִי לָא יְדַעְתּוּן
verses.ar_en: And the curse—if you do not heed the commandments of Adonoy, your God, and you veer from the course which I command you this day, to follow other gods [idols of the nations] which you did not know.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי יָעֵלִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְאַרְעָא דִי אַתְּ עָלֵל תַּמָן לְמֵירְתַהּ וְתִתֵּן יָת מְבָרְכַיָא עַל טוּרָא דִגְרִזִין וְיָת מְלַטְטַיָא עַל טוּרָא דְעֵיבָל
verses.ar_en: When Adonoy, your God, has brought you to the land that you are coming to inherit, you shall place the blessers on Mount Gerizim and the cursers on Mount Eival.

verses.ar_he: הֲלָא אִנוּן בְּעִבְרָא דְיַרְדְנָא אֲחוֹרֵי אֹרַח מַעֲלָנֵי שִׁמְשָׁא בְּאַרְעָא כְּנַעְנָאָה דְיָתֵב בְּמֵישְׁרָא לָקֳבֵל גִלְגְלָא בִּסְטַר מֵישְׁרֵי מֹרֶה
verses.ar_en: Are they not across the Yardein and far beyond, along the route of the sunset? In the land of the Canaanites who dwell on the Arava Plain, opposite Gilgol, next to the [at the side of] Moreh Plain.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי אַתּוּן עָבְרִין יָת יַרְדְנָא לְמֵעַל לְמֵירַת יָת אַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן יָהֵב לְכוֹן וְתֵירְתוּן יָתַהּ וְתֵיתְבוּן בַּהּ
verses.ar_en: For you shall pass across the Yardein to come to inherit the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you; you will inherit it and will dwell in it.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן לְמֶעְבַּד יָת כָּל קְיָמַיָא וְיָת דִינַיָא דִי אֲנָא יָהֵב קֳדָמֵיכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין
verses.ar_en: You will guard to fulfill all the statutes and the laws that I am setting before you today.

verses.ar_he: אִלֵין קְיָמַיָא וְדִינַיָא דִי תִטְרוּן לְמֶעְבַּד בְּאַרְעָא דִיהַב יְיָ אֱלָהָא דַאֲבְהָתָךְ לָךְ לְמֵירְתַהּ כָּל יוֹמַיָא דִי אַתּוּן קַיָמִין עַל אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: These are the statutes and the laws that you will guard to fulfill in the land that Adonoy, God of your forefathers, has given to inherit, all the years that you are alive on the land.

verses.ar_he: אַבָּדָא תְאַבְּדוּן יָת כָּל אַתְרַיָא דִי פְלָחוּ תַמָן עַמְמַיָא דִי אַתּוּן יָרְתִין יָתְהוֹן יָת טַעֲוָתְהוֹן עַל טוּרַיָא רָמַיָא וְעַל רָמָתָא וּתְחוֹת כָּל אִילַן עַבּוֹף
verses.ar_en: You must obliterate all the places where the nations worshipped, whom you are inheriting, their gods [idols], on the high mountains, and on the hills, and under every evergreen tree.

verses.ar_he: וּתְתָרְעוּן יָת אֱגוֹרֵיהוֹן וּתְתַבְּרוּן יָת קָמָתְהוֹן וַאֲשֵׁרֵיהוֹן תּוֹקְדוּן בְּנוּרָא וְצַלְמֵי טַעֲוָתְהוֹן תְּקוֹצְצוּן וְתוֹבְדוּן יָת שִׁמְהוֹן מִן אַ:תרָא הַהוּא
verses.ar_en: You are to break apart their altars, and you are to smash their pillars, and their asherahs are you to burn in fire, and the statues of their gods [idols] are you to cut down; and you are to obliterate their name from that place.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעְבְּדוּן כֵּן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Do not act this way to [before] Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: אֱלָהֵן לְאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן מִכָּל שִׁבְטֵּיכוֹן לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ תַּמָן לְבֵית שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ תִּתְבְּעוּן וְתֵיתוּן לְתַמָן
verses.ar_en: Rather at the place that Adonoy, your God, chooses from all your tribes to set His Presence [have His Shechinah dwell] there, [at the abode of His Shechinah] will you seek His Presence and come there.

verses.ar_he: וְתַיְתוּן לְתַמָן עֲלָוָתֵיכוֹן וְנִכְסַת קוּדְשֵׁיכוֹן וְיָת מַעְשְׂרָתֵיכוֹן וְיָת אַפְרָשׁוּת יֶדְכוֹן וְנִדְרֵיכוֹן וְנִדְבָתֵיכוֹן וּבְכוֹרֵי תוֹרְכוֹן וְעָנְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You are to bring there your burnt-offerings and your sacred-offerings, and your tithes and the elevation of your hands [hand-offerings], and your pledges, and your donations, and the firstborn of your cattle and your flocks.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵיכְלוּן תַּמָן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן וְתֶחֱדוּן בְכֹל אוֹשָׁטוּת יֶדְכוֹן אַתּוּן וֶאֱנַשׁ בָּתֵּיכוֹן דִי בָרְכָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: You are to eat there before Adonoy, your God, and you will be happy with the sum of your handiwork, you and [the members of] your households, as Adonoy, your God, has blessed you.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעְבְּדוּן כְּכֹל דִי אֲנַחְנָא עָבְדִין הָכָא יוֹמָא דֵין גְבַר כָּל מָן דְכָשַׁר קֳדָמוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: You may not do everything we do here today, each what is upright in his eyes [before him].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי לָא אֲתֵיתוּן עַד כְּעָן לְבֵית נְיָחָא וּלְאַחֲסָנָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ
verses.ar_en: For you will not have come as yet to the peace [the place of tranquility] and to the territory that Adonoy, your God, is giving you.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבְּרוּן יָת יַרְדְנָא וְתֵיתְבוּן בְּאַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן מַחְסֵן יָתְכוֹן וִינִיחַ לְכוֹן מִכָּל בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן מִסְחוֹר סְחוֹר וְתֵיתְבוּן לְרָחְצָן
verses.ar_en: When you cross the Yardein and settle in the land that Adonoy, your God, is apportioning to you, and He has granted you peace from all your enemies around, and you will live secure.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן בֵּהּ לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ תַּמָן לְתַמָן תַּיְתוּן יָת כָּל דִי אֲנָא מְפַקֵד יָתְכוֹן עֲלָוָתֵיכוֹן וְנִכְסַת קוּדְשֵׁיכוֹן מַעְשְׂרָתֵיכוֹן וְאַפְרָשׁוּת יֶדְכוֹן וְכֹל שְׁפַר נִדְרֵיכוֹן דִי תִדְרוּן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Let it be that the place where Adonoy, your God, chooses to place His Presence [Shechinah] therein—it is there you shall bring all that I am commanding you: your burnt-offerings and your sacred-offerings, your tithes and your hand-offerings, and your choice promissory offerings that you pledge to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתֶחֱדוּן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן אַתּוּן וּבְנֵיכוֹן וּבְנָתֵיכוֹן וְעַבְדֵיכוֹן וְאַמְהָתֵיכוֹן וְלֵוָאָה דִי בְקִרְוֵיכוֹן אֲרֵי לֵית לֵהּ חֳלָק וְאַחֲסָנָא עִמְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You are to rejoice in the presence of Adonoy, your God, you and your sons and your daughters, your male slaves and your female slaves, and the Levite who is in your cities, for he has no portion or territory with you.

verses.ar_he: אִסְתַּמַר לָךְ דִילְמָא תַסֵק עֲלָוָתָךְ בְּכָל אַתְרָא דִי תֶחֱזֵי
verses.ar_en: Take heed, lest you offer up your burnt-offerings anywhere you envision as proper.

verses.ar_he: אֶלָהֵן בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ בְּחַד מִן שִׁבְטָיךְ תַּמָן תַּסֵק עֲלָוָתָךְ וְתַמָן תַּעְבֵּד כֹּל דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ
verses.ar_en: Solely in the place that Adonoy chooses within one of your tribes, there are you to offer up your burnt-offerings, and there are you to do everything that I am commanding you.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד בְּכָל רְעוּת נַפְשָׁךְ תִּכּוֹס וְתֵיכוּל בִּשְׂרָא כְּבִרְכְּתָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ דִי יְהַב לָךְ בְּכָל קִרְוָיךְ מְסָאָבָא וְדַכְיָא יֵכְלֻנֵהּ כִּבְשַׂר טַבְיָא וְאַיְלָא
verses.ar_en: Except with the fullness of your appetite you may slaughter and eat meat in accord with the blessing of Adonoy, your God, that He has given you in all your cities; the ritually unclean and the clean will eat it like the [meat of the] deer and the gazelle.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד דְמָא לָא תֵיכְלוּן עַל אַרְעָא תִשְׁדִנֵהּ כְּמַיָא
verses.ar_en: However, you may not eat the blood; on the earth are you to spill it like water.

verses.ar_he: לֵית לָךְ רְשׁוּ לְמֵיכַל בְּקִרְוָיךְ מַעְשַׂר עִבוּרָךְ חַמְרָךְ וּמִשְׁחָךְ וּבְכוֹרֵי תוֹרָךְ וְעָנָךְ וְכָל נִדְרָךְ דִי תִדַר וְנִדְבָתָיךְ וְאַפְרָשׁוּת יְדָךְ
verses.ar_en: You are not permitted to eat in your cities the tithe of your grain and your wine and your olive oil, and the first-born of your cattle and your flocks, and all your pledges that you pledge, and your donations and the terumah-separation of your hand-offerings].

verses.ar_he: אֱלָהֵן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ תֵּיכְלִנֵהּ בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בֵּהּ אַתְּ וּבְרָךְ וּבְרַתָּךְ וְעַבְדָךְ וְאַמְתָךְ וְלֵוָאָה דִי בְקִרְוָיךְ וְתֶחֱדֵי קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּכָל אוֹשָׁטּוּת יְדָךְ
verses.ar_en: Rather, before Adonoy, your God, are you to eat it, in the place that Adonoy, your God, chooses—you and your son and your daughter, and your male slave and your female slave, and the Levite in your cities; and you will be happy in the presence of Adonoy, your God, with the sum of your handiwork.

verses.ar_he: אִסְתַּמַר לָךְ דִילְמָא תִשְׁבּוֹק יָת לֵוָאֵי כָּל יוֹמָיךְ עַל אַרְעָךְ
verses.ar_en: Watch yourself, lest you forsake the Levite, all your years on your land.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יַפְתֵּי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָת תְּחוּמָךְ כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל לָךְ וְתֵימַר אֵיכוּל בִּשְׂרָא אֲרֵי תִתִּרְעֵי נַפְשָׁךְ לְמֵיכַל בִּשְׂרָא בְּכָל רְעוּת נַפְשָׁךְ תֵּיכוּל בִּשְׂרָא
verses.ar_en: When Adonoy, your God, expands your border as He promised you, and you say, ‘‘I would like to eat meat’’ because you have an appetite to eat meat; to the full extent of your appetite eat meat.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִתְרָחַק מִנָךְ אַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ תַּמָן וְתִכּוֹס מִתּוֹרָךְ וּמֵעָנָךְ דִי יְהַב יְיָ לָךְ כְּמָא דִי פַּקֵדִתָּךְ וְתֵיכוּל בְּקִרְוָיךְ בְּכֹל רְעוּת נַפְשָׁךְ
verses.ar_en: When the place is distant from you that Adonoy, your God, chooses to set His Presence [Shechinah] there, you may slaughter some of your cattle or your flocks that Adonoy gave you, as I have commanded you; and you will eat in your cities with all your appetite.

verses.ar_he: בְּרַם כְּמָא דִי מִתְאֲכֵל בְּשַׂר טַבְיָא וְאַיְלָא כֵּן תֵּיכְלִנֵהּ מְסָאָבָא וְדַכְיָא כַּחֲדָא יֵכְלִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Only, as the [meat of the] dear and the gazelle may be eaten, so may you eat it; the ritually unclean and the clean together may eat it.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד תְּקֵף בְּדִיל דְלָא לְמֵיכַל דְּמָא אֲרֵי דְמָא הוּא נַפְשָׁא וְלָא תֵיכוּל נַפְשָׁא עִם בִּשְׂרָא
verses.ar_en: Only, exercise strength in not eating [in order not to eat] the blood, for the blood is the life; and do not eat the spirit with the meat.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵּיכְלִנֵהּ עַל אַרְעָא תִשְׁדִנֵהּ כְּמַיָא
verses.ar_en: Do not eat it; onto the earth are you to spill it like water.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵּיכְלִנֵהּ בְּדִיל דְיֵיטַב לָךְ וְלִבְנָיךְ בַּתְרָךְ אֲרֵי תַעְבֵּד דְכָשָׁר קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Do not eat it, so that you may enjoy beneficience, and your children after you, when you do the upright [proper] in Adonoy’s eyes.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד מַעְשַׂר קוּדְשָׁיךְ דִיהוֹן לָךְ וְנִדְרָךְ תִּטוֹל וְתֵיתֵי לְאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ
verses.ar_en: However, your sacred offerings [tithes] that you will have, and your pledges, you are to bring when you come to the place that Adonoy chooses.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד עֲלָוָתָךְ בִּשְׂרָא וּדְמָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וְדַם נִכְסַת קוּדְשָׁיךְ יִתָּשַׁד עַל מַדְבְּחָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וּבִשְׂרָא תֵּיכוּל
verses.ar_en: You are to execute your burnt-offerings—the meat and the blood—on the altar of Adonoy, your God; and the blood of your peace [sacred]-offerings will be poured on the altar of Adonoy, your God, then you will eat the meat.

verses.ar_he: טַר וּתְקַבֵּל יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא הָאִלֵין דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ בְּדִיל דְיֵיטַב לָךְ וְלִבְנָיךְ בַּתְרָךְ עַד עֳלָם אֲרֵי תַעְבֵּד דְתָקֵן וּדְכָשַׁר קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: Preserve and heed [obey] all these words that I am commanding you, in order that you have it good and your children after you forever, when you do that which is good and that which is upright [correct and proper before] in the eyes of Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְשֵׁצֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָת עַמְמַיָא דִי אַתְּ עָלֵל לְתַמָן לְתָרָכָא יָתְהוֹן מִקֳדָמָךְ וְתֵירַת יָתְהוֹן וְתֵיתַב בְּאַרְעֲהוֹן
verses.ar_en: When Adonoy, your God, will have eliminated the nations whom you are coming there to inherit, from before you; and you inherit them and dwell in their land;

verses.ar_he: אִסְתַּמַר לָךְ דִילְמָא תִתָּקַל בַּתְרֵיהוֹן בָּתַר דְיִשְׁתֵּצוּן מִקֳדָמָךְ וְדִילְמָא תִתְבַּע לְטַעֲוָתְהוֹן לְמֵימַר אֶכְדֵין פָּלְחִין עַמְמַיָא הָאִלֵין יָת טַעֲוָתְהוֹן וְאֶעְבֵּד כֵּן אַף אֲנָא
verses.ar_en: Look out for yourself, lest you are torn apart along with them, after they have been annihilated before you, and lest you inquire about their gods [idols], saying, ‘‘How did these nations worship their gods, let me do so, too.’’

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעְבֵּד כֵּן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ אֲרֵי כָּל דִמְרָחָק קֳדָם יְיָ דִי סָנֵי עֲבָדוּ לְטַעֲוָתְהוֹן אֲרֵי אַף יָת בְּנֵיהוֹן וְיָת בְּנָתֵיהוֹן מוֹקְדִין בְּנוּרָא לְטַּעֲוָתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Do not do so to [before] Adonoy, your God, because whatever is abominated by [distanced before] God, what He hates, they have done for their gods [idols]; for even their sons and their daughters do they burn in fire to their gods [idols].

verses.ar_he: יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמָא דִי אֲנָא מְפַקֵד יָתְכוֹן יָתֵהּ תִּטְרוּן לְמֶעְבָּד לָא תוֹסְפוּן עֲלוֹהִי וְלָא תִמְנְעוּן מִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Everything that I am commanding you—be careful to fulfill it; do not add to it and do not subtract from it.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְקוּם בֵּינָךְ נְבִיָא אוֹ חָלֵם חֶלְמָא וְיִתֶּן לָךְ אָת אוֹ מוֹפְתָא
verses.ar_en: If a prophet arises among you or a dreamer of a dream, and he gives you an omen or a miracle,

verses.ar_he: וְיֵיתֵי אָתָא וּמוֹפְתָא דִי מַלִיל עִמָךְ לְמֵימָר נְהַךְ בָּתַר טַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא דִי לָא יְדַעְתָּנוּן וְנִפְלְחִנוּן
verses.ar_en: And the omen or the miracle happens—the one he told you about—saying, ‘‘Let us go after other gods [idols of other nations], that you do not know, and let us serve them.’’

verses.ar_he: לָא תְקַבֵּל לְפִתְגָמֵי נְבִיָא הַהוּא אוֹ לְחָלֵם חֶלְמָא הַהוּא אֲרֵי מְנַסֵי יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן יָתְכוֹן לְמִדַע הַאִיתֵיכוֹן רָחֲמִין יָת יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן בְכָל לִבְּכוֹן וּבְכָל נַפְשְׁכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Do not listen to [accept] the words of that prophet or to that dreamer of a dream, because Adonoy, your God, is testing you to know whether you love Adonoy, your God, wholeheartedly and with your entire beings.

verses.ar_he: בָּתַר דַחַלְתָּא דַיְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן תְהָכוּן וְיָתֵהּ תִּדְחֲלוּן וְיָת פִּקוּדוֹהִי תִטְּרוּן וּלְמֵימְרֵהּ תְּקַבְּלוּן וְקָדָמוֹהִי תִפְלְחוּן וּבְדַחַלְתֵּהּ תִּתְקָרְבוּן
verses.ar_en: After [the fear of] Adonoy, your God, are you to go, fear Him, keep His commandments, heed His voice [accept His word], serve [before] Him, and cleave to [the fear of] Him.

verses.ar_he: וּנְבִיָא הַהוּא אוֹ חָלֵם חֶלְמָא הַהוּא יִתְקְטֵּל אֲרֵי מַלִיל סַטְיָא עַל יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן דִי אַפֵּיק יָתְכוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם וּדְפָרְקָךְ מִבֵּית עַבְדוּתָא לְאַטְעֲיוּתָךְ מִן אָרְחָא דִי פַקְדָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לִמְהַךְ בַּהּ וּתְפַלֵי עָבֵד דְבִישׁ מִבֵּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: And that prophet or that dreamer of a dream is to be executed, for he has uttered a fabrication about Adonoy, your God—Who took you out of the land of Egypt, and Who redeemed you from the house of bondage—to mislead you from the way that Adonoy, your God, commanded you to go upon, and you will eliminate the evil [doers] from within you.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְמַלְכִנָךְ אֲחוּךְ בַּר אִמָךְ אוֹ בְרָךְ אוֹ בְרַתָּךְ אוֹ אִתַּת קְיָמָךְ אוֹ חַבְרָךְ דִי כְנַפְשָׁךְ בְּסִתְרָא לְמֵימַר נְהַךְ וְנִפְלַח לְטַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא דִי לָא יְדַעְתְּ אַתְּ וַאֲבָהָתָךְ
verses.ar_en: If one shall incite you, your brother—son of your mother—or your son or your daughter, or the wife of your bosom [covenant], or your neighbor who is your soul mate, clandestinely, saying, ‘‘Let us go and serve other gods [idols of other nations]’’ whom you never knew—neither you nor your forefathers.

verses.ar_he: מִטַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא דִי בְסַחֲרָנֵיכוֹן דִקְרִיבִין לָךְ אוֹ דִרְחִיקִין מִנָךְ מִסְיָפֵי אַרְעָא וְעַד סְיָפֵי אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: From the gods [idols] of the nations that surround you, who are near you or at a distance from you, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the earth,

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵיבֵי לֵהּ וְלָא תְקַבֵּל מִנֵהּ וְלָא תְחוּס עֵינָךְ עֲלוֹהִי וְלָא תְרַחַם וְלָא תְכַסֵי עֲלוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Do not be favorbly inclined towards him, and do not listen to [accept from] him; and do not view him compassionately, and do not take pity and do not cover for him.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי מִקְטַל תִּקְטְּלִנֵהּ יְדָךְ תְּהֵי בֵהּ בְּקַדְמֵיתָא לְמִקְטְלֵהּ וִידָא דְכָל עַמָא בְבַתְרֵיתָא
verses.ar_en: For you must surely execute him. Let your hand strike him first to execute him, and the hand of the entire people afterward.

verses.ar_he: וְתִרְגְמִנֵהּ בְּאַבְנַיָא וִימוּת אֲרֵי בָעָא לְאַטְעֲיוּתָךְ מִדַחַלְתָּא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ דִי אַפְּקָךְ מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם מִבֵּית עַבְדוּתָא
verses.ar_en: And you are to stone him with stones so that he dies, for he sought to mislead you from [the fear of] Adonoy, your God, Who took you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל יִשְׂרָאֵל יִשְׁמְעוּן וְיִדְחֲלוּן וְלָא יוֹסְפוּן לְמֶעְבַּד כְּפִתְגָמָא בִישָׁא הָדֵין בֵּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: And all of Yisroel will hear and will fear, and they will not proceed to do so evil a thing as this, within you.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִשְׁמַע בְּחַד מִקִרְוָיךְ דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ לְמִתַּב תַּמָן לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: If you hear in one of your cities that Adonoy, your God, is giving you in which to settle, the following:

verses.ar_he: נְפָקוּ גֻבְרִין בְּנֵי רִשְׁעָא מִבֵּינָךְ וְאַטְעָיוּ יָת יָתְבֵי קַרְתְּהוֹן לְמֵימָר נְהַךְ וְנִפְלַח לְטַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא דִי לָא יְדַעְתּוּן
verses.ar_en: ‘‘Men have gone out—unscrupulous [evil]—from among you, and they have misled the inhabitants of their city by saying, ‘Let us go and serve other gods [idols of other nations]’ that you do not know.’’

verses.ar_he: וְתִתְבַּע וְתִבְדוֹק וְתִשְׁאַל יָאוּת וְהָא קֻשְׁטָּא כֵּוַן פִּתְגָמָא אִתְעֲבִידָא תּוֹעֶבְתָּא הָדָא בֵּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: You must investigate, inquire, and interrogate thoroughly; and if in fact the report is true and accurate—this abomination was committed among you.

verses.ar_he: מִמְחָא תִמְחֵי יָת יָתְבֵי קַרְתָּא הַהִיא לְפִתְגַם דְחָרֶב גַמַר יָתַהּ וְיָת כָּל דִי בַהּ וְיָת בְּעִירַהּ לְפִתְגַם דְחָרֶב
verses.ar_en: You must surely strike down the inhabitants of that city by the sword; annihilate it and everything that is in it, and its livestock by the sword.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כָּל עֲדָאַהּ תִּכְנוֹשׁ לְגוֹ פְתָיַהּ וְתוֹקֵד בְּנוּרָא יָת קַרְתָּא וְיָת כָּל עֲדָאַהּ גְמִיר קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וּתְהֵי תֵּל חָרִיב לְעָלָם לָא תִתְבְּנֵי עוֹד
verses.ar_en: And all its booty are you to collect within its plaza, and you are to burn in fire the city and all its booty—totally—for [before] Adonoy, your God; and it will be a ruin forever, it is never to be rebuilt.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא יִדְבַּק בִּידָךְ מִדַעַם מִן חֶרְמָא בְּדִיל דִיתוּב יְיָ מִתְּקוֹף רוּגְזֵהּ וִיהַב לָךְ רַחֲמִין וִירַחַם עֲלָךְ וְיַסְגִנָךְ כְּמָא דִי קַיִים לַאֲבָהָתָךְ
verses.ar_en: Let nothing of the cherem cling to your hand; so that Adonoy withdraws His raising fury and grant you mercy, and He will be merciful toward you and multiply you as He swore to your forefathers

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תְקַבֵּל לְמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְמִטַר יָת כָּל פִּקוּדוֹהִי דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין לְמֶעְבַּד דְכָשָׁר קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: When you heed the voice [accept the word] of Adonoy, your God, to guard all His commandments that I am commanding you today, to do the upright [proper before] in the eyes of Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: בְּנִין אַתּוּן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן לָא תִתְחַמְמוּן וְלָא תְשַׁווּן מְרָט בֵּין עֵינֵיכוֹן עַל מִית
verses.ar_en: You are sons to [before] Adonoy, your God; do not lacerate yourselves and do not make yourselves bald between your eyes for a dead person.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי עַם קַדִישׁ אַתְּ קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וּבָךְ אִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ לְמֶהֱוֵי לֵהּ לְעַם חַבִּיב מִכָּל עַמְמַיָא דִי עַל אַפֵּי אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: For you are a sacred people to Adonoy, your God, and Adonoy has chosen you to be for Him a treasured people from all the peoples who are on the surface of the earth.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵיכוּל כָּל דִמְרָחָק
verses.ar_en: Do not eat any abomination.

verses.ar_he: דֵין בְּעִירָא דְתֵיכְלוּן תּוֹרִין אִמְרִין דִרְחֵלִין וְגָדְיָן דְעִזִין
verses.ar_en: These are the animals that you are to eat: the bovine, the sheep and the goat;

verses.ar_he: אַיָלָא וְטַבְיָא וְיַחְמוּרָא וְיַעְלָא וְרֵימָא וְתוֹרְבָּלָא וְדִיצָא
verses.ar_en: The gazelle, the deer and the fallow deer; and the ibex and the adax; and the wild ox and the wild sheep.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל בְּעִירָא דִסְדִיקָא פַרְסָתָא וּמַטִלְפָא טִלְפִין תַּרְתֵּין פַּרְסָתָא מַסְקָא פִשְׁרָא בִּבְעִירָא יָתַהּ תֵּיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: And every animal whose sole is cloven, whose hoof is truly split in two, regurgitating [its] cud within the animals, it may you eat.

verses.ar_he: בְּרַם יָת דֵין לָא תֵיכְלוּן מִמַסְקֵי פִשְׁרָא וּמִמַסְדִיקֵי פַרְסָתָא מַטִלְפֵי טִלְפַיָא יָת גַמְלָא וְיָת אַרְנְבָא וְיָת טַּפְזָא אֲרֵי מַסְקֵי פִּשְׁרָא אִנוּן וּפַרְסָתְהוֹן לָא סְדִיקָא מְסָאֲבִין אִנוּן לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: These, however, do not eat from the regurgitators of cud and from the cloven-soled [split into hooves]: the dromedary, the camel, and the hare and the hyrax; for regurgitators of cud are they, but have no cloven sole; they are ritually unclean for you.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת חֲזִירָא אֲרֵי מַסְדִיק פַּרְסָתָא הוּא וְלָא פָשַׁר מְסָאָב הוּא לְכוֹן מִבִּסְרְהוֹן לָא תֵיכְלוּן וּבִנְבֵלְתְּהוֹן לָא תִקְרְבוּן
verses.ar_en: Also the pig, because it is cloven-soled but does not [regurgitate its] cud; it is ritually unclean for you. From their flesh do not eat, and do not come in contact [near] with their carcasses.

verses.ar_he: יָת דֵין תֵּיכְלוּן מִכֹּל דִי בְמַיָא כֹּל דִי לֵהּ צִיצִין וְקַלְפִין תֵּיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: These are you to eat from whatever is in the water: whatever has fins and scales may you eat.

verses.ar_he: וְכֹל דִי לֵית לֵהּ צִיצִין וְקַלְפִין לָא תֵיכְלוּן מְסָאָב הוּא לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: And whatever does not have fins and scales do not eat; they are ritually unclean for you.

verses.ar_he: כָּל צִפַּר דַכְיָא תֵּיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: You may eat any pure bird.

verses.ar_he: וְדֵין דִי לָא תֵיכְלוּן מִנְהוֹן נִשְׁרָא וְעָר וְעַזְיָא
verses.ar_en: And this is what you may not eat: the griffon vulture and the bearded vulture, and the black vulture;

verses.ar_he: וּבַת כַּנְפָא וְטָרָפִיתָא וְדַיְתָא לִזְנַהּ
verses.ar_en: The ra’ah and the ayah, and the kite according to its kind;

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כָּל עֹרְבָא לִזְנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: And every raven according to its kind;

verses.ar_he: וְיָת בַּת נַעֲמִיתָא וְצִיצָא וְצִפַּר שַׁחְפָּא וְנָצָא לִזְנוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: And the dark desert eagle owl and the kestrel, and the gull, and the sparrow hawk according to its kind;

verses.ar_he: וְקַדְיָא וְקִפוֹפָא וּבַוְתָא
verses.ar_en: The dark little owl and the long-eared owl, and the tinshames;

verses.ar_he: וְקָתָא וִירַקְרֵקָא וְשָׁלֵי נוּנָא
verses.ar_en: And the light little owl and the Egyptian vulture, and the shalach;

verses.ar_he: וְחַוָרִיתָא וְאִבּוּ לִזְנַהּ וְנַגַר טוּרָא וַעֲטַּלֵפָא
verses.ar_en: And the stork, and the heron according to its kind, and the duchifas, and the bat.

verses.ar_he: וְכֹל רִחֲשָׁא דְעוֹפָא מְסָאָב הוּא לְכוֹן לָא יִתְאָכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: And all flying creeping creatures are ritually unclean for you; they may not be eaten.

verses.ar_he: כָּל עוֹפָא דְכֵי תֵּיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: Every ritually clean bird you may eat.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵיכְלוּן כָּל נְבִילָא לְתוֹתָב עָרֵל דִי בְקִרְוָיךְ תִּתְּנִנַהּ וְיֵיכְלִנַהּ אוֹ תְזַבְּנִנַהּ לְבַר עַמְמִין אֲרֵי עַם קַדִישׁ אַתְּ קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָא תֵיכוּל בְּשַׂר בַּחֲלָב
verses.ar_en: Do not eat any carcass; to the [uncircumcised] alien in your cities give it and he will eat it or sell it to a non-Jew [foreigner], for you are a people sanctified to Adonoy, your God; do not cook a kid in its mother’s milk [milk with meat].

verses.ar_he: עַשְׂרָא תְעַשַׂר יָת כָּל עֲלָלַת זַרְעָךְ דְיִפּוֹק חַקְלָא שַׁתָּא בְשַׁתָּא
verses.ar_en: You must surely tithe all the produce of your planting, that your field yields on a yearly basis.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵיכוּל קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ תַּמָן מַעְשַׂר עִבוּרָךְ חַמְרָךְ וּמִשְׁחָךְ וּבְכוֹרֵי תוֹרָךְ וְעָנָךְ בְּדִיל דְתֵילַף לְמִדְחַל קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ כָּל יוֹמַיָא
verses.ar_en: You shall eat in the presence of Adonoy, your God, in the place He chooses to house His Presence [Shechinah] there—the tithe of your grain, your wine, and your olive oil, and the firstborn of your cattle and flocks; in order that you learn to fear [before] Adonoy, your God, all the years.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִסְגֵי מִנָךְ אָרְחָא אֲרֵי לָא תִכּוּל לְמִטְלֵהּ אֲרֵי יִתְרָחַק מִנָךְ אַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ תַּמָן אֲרֵי יְבָרֵכִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: If the journey will be beyond you; if you will be unable to carry it because the place is distant for you where Adonoy, your God, chooses to set His Presence [Shechinah] there, for Adonoy, your God, has blessed you—

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן בְּכַסְפָּא וּתְצוּר כַּסְפָּא בִּידָךְ וּתְהַךְ לְאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: you will substitute coins. You will bundle the coins in your hand, and will go to the place that Adonoy, your God, chooses.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן כַּסְפָּא בְּכֹל דִי יִתִּרְעֵי נַפְשָׁךְ בְּתוֹרֵי וּבְעָנָא וּבַחֲמַר חֲדַת וְעַתִּיק וּבְכֹל דִי תִשְׁאֲלִנָךְ נַפְשָׁךְ וְתֵיכוּל תַּמָן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וְתֶחֱדֵי אַתְּ וֶאֱנַשׁ בֵּיתָךְ
verses.ar_en: You will spend the money for anything you desire—for cattle, sheep, wine, intoxicating liquor [fresh and aged wine]—and for anything that you wish; and you will eat there in the presence of Adonoy, your God, and will rejoice, you and [the members of] your household.

verses.ar_he: וְלֵוָאָה דִי בְקִרְוָיךְ לָא תִשְׁבְּקִנֵהּ אֲרֵי לֵית לֵהּ חֳלָק וְאַחֲסָנָא עִמָךְ
verses.ar_en: And the Levite who is in your city, you must not abandon; since he has no portion or inheritance with you.

verses.ar_he: מִסוֹף תְּלַת שְׁנִין תַּפֵק יָת כָּל מַעְשַׂר עֲלַלְתָּךְ בְּשַׁתָּא הַהִיא וְתַצְנַע בְּקִרְוָיךְ
verses.ar_en: At the end of three years, separate all the tithes of your produce of that year and set them aside in your city.

verses.ar_he: וְיֵיתֵי לֵוָאָה אֲרֵי לֵית לֵהּ חֳלָק וְאַחֲסָנָא עִמָךְ וְגִיוֹרָא וְיִתַּמָא וְאַרְמְלָא דִי בְקִרְוָיךְ וְיֵיכְלוּן וְיִשְׂבְּעוּן בְּדִיל דִי יְבָרֵכִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּכָל עוֹבָדֵי יְדָךְ דִי תַעְבֵּד
verses.ar_en: The Levite shall come, for he has no portion or inheritance with you, and the proselyte and the orphan and the widow who are in your city, let them eat their fill; in order that Adonoy, your God, bless you in all the endeavors that you make.

verses.ar_he: מִסוֹף שְׁבַע שְׁנִין תַּעְבֵּד שְׁמִטְתָא
verses.ar_en: At the end of seven years, you are to make shemitah.

verses.ar_he: וְדֵין פִּתְגַם שְׁמִטְתָא דְתַשְׁמֵט כָּל גְבַר מַרֵי רְשׁוּ דִי יַרְשֵׁי בְּחַבְרֵהּ לָא יִתְבַּע מִן חַבְרֵהּ וּמִן אֲחוּהִי אֲרֵי קְרָא שְׁמִטְתָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: And this is the statement of shemitah: suspend every creditor’s hand from his loan to his neighbor; he will not claim [it] from his neighbor or his brother because it was proclaimed shemitah to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: מִן בַּר עַמְמִין תִּתְבַּע וְדִי יְהֵי לָךְ עִם אָחוּךְ תַּשְׁמֵט יְדָךְ
verses.ar_en: You should demand payment from the stranger [foreigner], but what you have with your brother your hand will relinquish.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד אֲרֵי לָא יְהֵי בָךְ מִסְכֵּנָא אֲרֵי בָרָכָא יְבָרֵכִנָךְ יְיָ בְּאַרְעָא דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ אַחֲסָנָא לְמֵירְתַהּ
verses.ar_en: End it [poverty], so that there will be no one, destitute among you when Adonoy will surely bless you in the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you as territory to inherit.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד אִם קַבָּלָא תְקַבֵּל לְמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְמִטַר לְמֶעְבַּד יָת כָּל תַּפְקֶדְתָּא הָדָא דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין
verses.ar_en: Only if you will listen to [heed] the voice [word] of Adonoy, your God, to guard to fulfill this entire mitzvah that I am commanding you today.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בָּרְכָךְ כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל לָךְ וְתוֹזֵף לְעַמְמִין סַגִיאִין וְאַתְּ לָא תְזוּף וְתִשְׁלוֹט בְּעַמְמִין סַגִיאִין וּבָךְ לָא יִשְׁלְטוּן
verses.ar_en: When Adonoy, your God, blesses you just as He told you, you will grant loans to nations but you will not borrow; and you will rule over many nations, but over you they will not rule.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְהֵי בָךְ מִסְכֵּנָא מֵחַד מֵאַחָיךְ בַּחֲדָא מִקִרְוָיךְ בְּאַרְעָךְ דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ לָא תַתְקֵף יָת לִבָּךְ וְלָא תִקְפֹּץ יָת יְדָךְ מֵאֲחוּךְ מִסְכֵּנָא
verses.ar_en: If there should be someone destitute in your midst among one of your brothers in one of your cities, in your land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you; do not harden your heart and do not close your hand against your destitute brother.

verses.ar_he: אֶלָא מִפְתַּח תִּפְתַּח יָת יְדָךְ לֵהּ וְאוֹזָפָא תּוֹזְפִנֵהּ כְּמִסַת חֶסְרוֹנֵהּ דְיַחֲסִיר לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Rather, you must surely open your hand generously to him, and you must surely extend a loan to him to cover the wants [the measure of that] which he lacks.

verses.ar_he: אִסְתַּמַר לָךְ דִילְמָא יְהֵי פִתְגָם עִם לִבָּךְ בִּרְשַׁע לְמֵימַר קְרִיבָא שַׁתָּא שְׁבִיעֲתָא שַׁתָּא דִשְׁמִטְתָא וְתַבְאֵשׁ עֵינָךְ בְּאָחוּךְ מִסְכֵּנָא וְלָא תִתֵּן לֵהּ וְיִקְרֵי עֲלָךְ קֳדָם יְיָ וִיהֵי בָךְ חוֹבָא
verses.ar_en: Look out for yourself lest there be an evil thought in your mind, saying, ‘‘The seventh year is approaching, the shemitah year,’’ and you will look askance at your destitute brother and will not give him; and if he cries out concerning you to Adonoy, you will be regarded as sinful.

verses.ar_he: מִתַּן תִתֵּן לֵהּ וְלָא יַבְאֵשׁ לִבָּךְ בְּמִתְּנָךְ לֵהּ אֲרֵי בְּדִיל פִּתְגָמָא הָדֵין יְבָרֵכִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּכָל עוֹבָדָךְ וּבְכֹל אוֹשָׁטוּת יְדָךְ
verses.ar_en: You must surely give him, and let your heart not hurt when you give him; for, as a consequence of this thing, Adonoy, your God, will bless you in all your work and in all your commerce.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי לָא יִפְסוֹק מִסְכֵּנָא מִגוֹ אַרְעָא עַל כֵּן אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ לְמֵימַר מִפְתַּח תִּפְתַּח יָת יְדָךְ לַאֲחוּךְ לְעַנְיָךְ וּלְמִסְכֵּנָךְ בְּאַרְעָךְ
verses.ar_en: For the destitute will not cease to exist within the land; therefore I am commanding you saying, ‘‘Open your hand generously to your brother, to your indigent, and to your destitute in your land.’’

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִזְדַבַּן לָךְ אֲחוּךְ בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִפְלְחִנָךְ שִׁית שְׁנִין וּבְשַׁתָּא שְׁבִיעֲתָא תִּפְטְרִנֵהּ בַּר חוֹרִין מֵעִמָךְ
verses.ar_en: If your brother—Jew or Jewess—is sold to you and he serves you six years; then in the seventh year you are to send him free from you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תִפְטְרִנֵה בַּר חוֹרִין מֵעִמָךְ לָא תִפְטְּרִנֵה רֵיקָן
verses.ar_en: When you send him [a] free [man] from you, do not send him away empty-handed.

verses.ar_he: אַפְרָשָׁא תַפְרֵשׁ לֵהּ מֵעָנָךְ וּמֵאִדְרָךְ וּמִמַעֲצַרְתָּךְ דִי בָרְכָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ תִּתֶּן לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: You must surely present him with a severance bonus from your flocks, and from your threshing area, and your wine cellar, whatever Adonoy, your God, has blessed you with are you to give him.

verses.ar_he: וְתִדְכַּר אֲרֵי עַבְדָא הֲוֵיתָא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם וּפָרְקָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ עַל כֵּן אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יָת פִּתְגָמָא הָדֵין יוֹמָא דֵין
verses.ar_en: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and Adonoy, your God, redeemed you; that is why I am commanding you this matter today.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי יֵימַר לָךְ לָא אֶפוֹק מֵעִמָךְ אֲרֵי רָחֲמָךְ וְיָת אֱנַשׁ בֵּיתָךְ אֲרֵי טַב לֵהּ עִמָךְ
verses.ar_en: Should he say to you, ‘‘I am not leaving you;’’ because he loves you and [the members of] your household, for he has it good with you.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָת מַרְצְעָא וְתִתֵּן בְּאֻדְנֵהּ וּבְדָשָׁא וִיהֵי לָךְ עִבֵד פָּלַח לְעָלָם וְאַף לְאַמְתָךְ תַּעְבֶּד כֵּן
verses.ar_en: Take the awl and put it through his ear and the door, and he will become your perpetual slave [ministering servant]. And do the same to your maid-servant as well.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִקְשֵׁי בְעֵינָךְ בְּמִפְטְרָךְ יָתֵהּ בַּר חוֹרִין מֵעִמָךְ אֲרֵי עַל חַד תְּרֵין כַּאֲגַר אֲגִירָא פָּלְחָךְ שִׁית שְׁנִין וִיבָרֵכִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּכֹל דִי תַעְבֵּד
verses.ar_en: Let it not seem difficult to you when you send him [a] free [man] from you, for double [two for one] the profit produced by the wage earner has he worked for you six years; and Adonoy, your God, will bless you in everything you do.

verses.ar_he: כָּל בּוּכְרָא דִי יִתְיְלִיד בְּתוֹרָךְ וּבְעָנָךְ דִכְרִין תַּקְדֵשׁ קָדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָא תִפְלַח בְּבוּכְרָא דְתוֹרָךְ וְלָא תֵגוֹז בּוּכְרָא דְעָנָךְ
verses.ar_en: Every firstborn that is born in your cattle, and in your flocks—a male—you must consecrate to Adonoy, your God; you may not work with your first-born ox, or shear the first-born of your flocks.

verses.ar_he: קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ תֵּיכְלִנֵהּ שַׁתָּא בְשַׁתָּא בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אַתְּ וֶאֱנַשׁ בֵּיתָךְ
verses.ar_en: Before Adonoy, your God, you must eat it, each year, in the place that Adonoy chooses, you and [the members of] your household.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יְהֵי בֵהּ מוּמָא חֲגִיר אוֹ עֲוִיר כֹּל מוּם בִּישׁ לָא תִכְּסִנֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: And if it has a blemish—if it is crippled or blind—or has any severe blemish, do not slaughter it to Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: בְּקִרְוָיךְ תֵּיכְלִנֵהּ מְסָאָבָא וְדַכְיָא כַּחֲדָא כִּבְסַר טַבְיָא וְאַיְלָא
verses.ar_en: In your cities may you eat it; the ritually unclean and the clean together, like the [meat of the] deer and the gazelle.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד יָת דְמֵהּ לָא תֵיכוּל עַל אַרְעָא תִשְׁדִנֵהּ כְּמַיָא
verses.ar_en: Only, do not eat its blood; spill it like water on the ground.

verses.ar_he: טַר יָת יַרְחָא דַאֲבִיבָא וְתַעְבֵּד פִּסְחָא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ אֲרֵי בְּיַרְחָא דַאֲבִיבָא אַפְּקָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מִמִצְרַיִם וַעֲבַד לָךְ נִסִין בְּלֵילְיָא
verses.ar_en: Take heed of [observe] the month of spring, when you will celebrate Pesach for [before] Adonoy your God; for in the month of spring Adonoy, your God, took you out from Egypt [and performed miracles for you] at night.

verses.ar_he: וְתִכּוֹס פִּסְחָא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מִן בְּנֵי עָנָא וְנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא מִן תּוֹרֵי בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתֵּה תַּמָן
verses.ar_en: You shall slaughter the pesach-offering to [before] Adonoy, your God, flocks of ruminants [young lambs] and cattle [sacred offerings of oxen] in the place that Adonoy chooses to house His Presence [Shechinah] there.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵיכוּל עֲלוֹהִי חֲמִיעַ שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין תֵּיכוּל עֲלוֹהִי פַטִיר לְחֵם עֹנִי אֲרֵי בִּבְהִילוּ נְפַקְתָּא מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם בְּדִיל דְתִדְכַּר יָת יוֹמָא מִפְּקָךְ מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם כָּל יוֹמֵי חַיָיךְ
verses.ar_en: Do not eat chometz on it; seven days are you to eat on it matzos, bread of anguish; since in haste you left the land of Egypt, so that you remember the day of your exodus from the land of Egypt all the days of your life.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא יִתְחֲזֵי לָךְ חֲמִר בְּכָל תְּחוּמָךְ שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין וְלָא יְבִית מִן בִּסְרָא דִי תִכּוֹס בְּרַמְשָׁא בְּיוֹמָא קַדְמָאָה לְצַפְרָא
verses.ar_en: And no sourdough of yours may be seen in all of your boundary seven days; and none of the flesh may remain overnight which you slaughtered towards the evening of the first day—until morning.

verses.ar_he: לֵית לָךְ רְשׁוּ לְמִכֹּס יָת פִּסְחָא בַּחֲדָא מִקִרְוָיךְ דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ
verses.ar_en: You are forbidden [have no permission] to slaughter the pesach in any of your cities that Adonoy, your God, is giving you.

verses.ar_he: אֱלָהֵן לְאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ תַּמָן תִּכּוֹס יָת פִּסְחָא בְּרַמְשָׁא כְּמֵעַל שִׁמְשָׁא זְמַן מִפְקָךְ מִמִצְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: Solely in the place that Adonoy, your God, chooses to house His Presence [Shechinah], there will you slaughter the pesach towards the afternoon, at sunset, at the time you left Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וּתְבַשֵׁל וְתֵיכוּל בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בֵּהּ וְתִתְפְּנֵי בְצַפְרָא וּתְהַךְ לְקִרְוָיךְ
verses.ar_en: You shall cook [it] and eat [it] in the place that Adonoy, your God, chooses; and you may depart in the morning and go to your residence.

verses.ar_he: שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין תֵּיכוּל פַּטִירָא וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה כְּנֵשׁ קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָא תַעְבֵּד עִבִידָא
verses.ar_en: For six days you shall eat matzos, and on the seventh day, is one of withdrawal [assembly] for the sake of Adonoy, your God, do not do work.

verses.ar_he: שִׁבְעָא שָׁבוּעִין תִּמְנֵי לָךְ מִדְשַׁרְיוּת מַגְלָא בַּחֲצַד עוּמְרָא דַאֲרָמוּתָא תִּשְׁרֵי לְמִמְנֵּי שִׁבְעָא שָׁבוּעִין
verses.ar_en: Seven weeks count for yourself; from the time the sickle begins felling the standing grain, begin to count seven weeks.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד חַגָא דְשָׁבוּעַיָא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מִסַת נִדְבַת יְדָךְ דִי תִתֵּן כְּמָא דִי יְבָרֵכִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: You are to celebrate the festival of Shovuos for [before] Adonoy, your God, to the fullness of your open-handed gift that you can give, as Adonoy, your God, has blessed you.

verses.ar_he: וְתֶחֱדֵי קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ אַתְּ וּבְרָךְ וּבְרַתָּךְ וְעַבְדָךְ וְאַמְתָךְ וְלֵוָאָה דִי בְקִרְוָיךְ וְגִיוֹרָא וְיִתַּמָא וְאַרְמְלָא דִי בֵינָךְ בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ תַּמָן
verses.ar_en: You are to rejoice in the presence of [before] Adonoy, your God—you, and your son and your daughter, and your male slave and your female slave, and the Levite who is in your city, and the proselyte, and the orphan and the widow who are among you—in the place that Adonoy, your God, chooses to house His Presence [Shechinah] there.

verses.ar_he: וְתִדְכַּר אֲרֵי עַבְדָא הֲוֵיתָא בְּמִצְרָיִם וְתִטַר וְתַעְבֵּד יָת קְיָמַיָא הָאִלֵין
verses.ar_en: Remember that you were a slave in Egypt; you are to guard and celebrate these statutes.

verses.ar_he: חַגָא דִמְטָלַיָא תַּעְבֵּד לָךְ שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין בְּמִכְנְשָׁךְ מֵאִדְרָךְ וּמִמַעְצַרְתָּךְ
verses.ar_en: The festival of Sukkos celebrate for yourself seven days, when you harvest your threshing-floor and your wine-press.

verses.ar_he: וְתֶחֱדֵי בְּחַגָךְ אַתְּ וּבְרָךְ וּבְרַתָּךְ וְעַבְדָךְ וְאַמְתָךְ וְלֵוָאָה וְגִיוֹרָא וְיִתַּמָא וְאַרְמְלָא דִי בְקִרְוָיךְ
verses.ar_en: You are to rejoice during your festival—you and your son and your daughter, and your male slave and your female slave, and the Levite and the proselyte, and the orphan and the widow who are in your city.

verses.ar_he: שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין תֵּחוֹג קָדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֲרֵי יְבָרֵכִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּכָל עֲלַלְתָּךְ וּבְכָל עוֹבָדֵי יְדָיךְ וּתְהֵי בְּרַם חָדֵי
verses.ar_en: Seven days are you to be festive for Adonoy, your God, in the place Adonoy chooses, for Adonoy, your God, will bless you in all your produce and in all your endeavors; and you shall experience pure joy.

verses.ar_he: תְּלַת זִמְנִין בְּשַׁתָּא יִתְחֲזֵי כָל דְכוּרָךְ קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי בְּחַגָא דְפַטִירַיָא וּבְחַגָא דְשָׁבוּעַיָא וּבְחַגָא דִמְטָּלַיָא וְלָא יִתְחֲזֵי קֳדָם יְיָ רֵיקָנוּן
verses.ar_en: Three times a year are all your males to be seen in the presence of [before] Adonoy, your God, in the place that He chooses—in the festival of Matzos, and on the festival of Shovuos, and on the festival of Sukkos—and he shall not appear in the presence of [before] Adonoy empty-handed.

verses.ar_he: גְבַר כְּמַתְּנַת יְדֵהּ כְּבִרְכָּתָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ דִי יְהַב לָךְ: ססס
verses.ar_en: Everyone according to the gift appropriate to his means, according to the blessing of Adonoy, your God, that He gave you.

verses.ar_he: דַיָנִין וּפֻרְעָנִין תְּמַנֵי לָךְ בְּכֹל קִרְוָיךְ דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ לְשִׁבְטָיךְ וִידוּנוּן יָת עַמָא דִין דִקְשׁוֹט
verses.ar_en: Judges and police officers you shall appoint for yourself in all of your cities that Adonoy, your God, is giving you for your tribes; who will judge the people righteous justice [true judgment].

verses.ar_he: לָא תַצְלֵי דִין לָא תִשְׁתְּמוֹדַע אַפִּין וְלָא תְקַבֵּל שֹׁחֲדָא אֲרֵי שֹׁחֲדָא מְעַוֵּר עֵינֵי חַכִּימִין וּמְקַלְקַל פִּתְגָמִין תְּרִיצִין
verses.ar_en: Do not pervert justice; do not display favoritism; and do not accept bribery, for bribery blinds the eyes of the wise and distorts words that are just [perverts the words of justice].

verses.ar_he: קֻשְׁטָא קֻשְׁטָא תְּהֵי רָדִיף בְּדִיל דְתֵיחֵי וְתֵירַת יָת אַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Pursue absolute justice so that you may live and inherit the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִצוֹב לָךְ אֲשֵׁרַת כָּל אִילָן בִּסְטַר מַדְבְּחָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ דִי תַעְבֶּד לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Do not plant an Asherah for yourself [or] any tree near the altar of Adonoy, your God, that you will make for yourself.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תְקִים לָךְ קָמָא דִי סָנֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: And do not erect for yourself a monument that Adonoy, your God, detests.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִכּוֹס קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ תּוֹר וְאִמָר דִי יְהֵי בֵהּ מוּמָא כֹּל מִדַעַם בִּישׁ אֲרֵי מְרָחָק קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ הוּא
verses.ar_en: Do not sacrifice to [before] Adonoy, your God, an ox or a lamb that has a blemish, any bad thing; for it is abominated [distanced] by [before] Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִשְׁתְּכַח בֵּינָךְ בַּחֲדָא מִקִרְוָיךְ דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ גְבַר אוֹ אִתְּתָא דִי יַעְבֵּד יָת דְבִישׁ קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְמֶעְבַּר עַל קְיָמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If there is found among you, in one of your cities that Adonoy, your God, is giving you, a man or a woman who does what is evil in the eyes of Adonoy, your God, by violating His covenant.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזַל וּפְלַח לְטַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא וּסְגִיד לְהוֹן וּלְשִׁמְשָׁא אוֹ לְסִיהֲרָא אוֹ לְכָל חֵילֵי שְׁמַיָא דִי לָא פַקֵדִית
verses.ar_en: He goes and serves other gods [idols of the nations] and bows to them—whether to the sun or to the moon or to any of the host of heaven that I did not command.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְחַוֵי לָךְ וְתִשְׁמַע וְתִתְבַּע יָאוּת וְהָא קֻשְׁטָא כֵּוַן פִּתְגָמָא אִתְעֲבִידַת תּוֹעֶבְתָּא הָדָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: When you are told and you understand, you are to inquire thoroughly. If in fact the report is authenticated and accurate—this abomination was committed within Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וְתַפֵּק יָת גַבְרָא הַהוּא אוֹ יָת אִתְּתָא הַהִיא דִי עֲבָדוּ יָת פִּתְגָמָא בִישָׁא הָדֵין לִתְרַע בֵּית דִינָךְ יָת גַבְרָא אוֹ יָת אִתְּתָא וְתִרְגְמִנוּן בְּאַבְנַיָא וִימוּתוּן
verses.ar_en: You are to take out that man or that woman who did this evil thing to your city [the door of your court]—the man or the woman—and you are to stone them with stones so that they die.

verses.ar_he: עַל מֵימַר תְּרֵין סַהֲדִין אוֹ תְּלָתָא סַהֲדִין יִתְקְטִל דְחַיַב קְטוֹל לָא יִתְקְטֵל עַל מֵימַר סָהִיד חָד
verses.ar_en: By the speech of two witnesses or three witnesses is the guilty one [the one sentenced to death] to be executed; he is not to be executed by the oral testimonoy of one witness.

verses.ar_he: יְדָא דְסַהֲדַיָא תְּהֵי בֵהּ בְּקַדְמֵיתָא לְמִקְטְלֵהּ וִידָא דְכָל עַמָא בְּבַתְרֵיתָא וּתְפַלֵי עָבֵד דְבִישׁ מִבֵּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: Let the hand of the witnesses be against him first to execute him, and the hand of the entire people afterward; and you will eliminate the evil [doer] from within you.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִתְכַסֵי מִנָךְ פִּתְגָמָא לְדִינָא בֵּין דְמָא לִדְמָא בֵּין דִינָא לְדִינָא וּבֵין מַכְתַּשׁ סְגִירוּ לְמַכְתַּשׁ סְגִירוּ פִּתְגָמֵי פְלֻגְתָּא דִינָא בְּקִרְוָיךְ וּתְקוּם וְתִסַק לְאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: If a matter of law is too abstruse for you—between blood and blood, between decision and decision, or between leprosy [a plague of confinement] and leprosy [a plague of confinement], matters under [legal] dispute in your city; you shall rise and ascend to the place that Adonoy, your God, will have chosen.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵיתֵי לְוָת כָּהֲנַיָא לֵוָאֵי וּלְוָת דַיָנָא דִי יְהֵי בְּיוֹמַיָא הָאִנוּן וְתִתְבַּע וִיחַוּוּן לָךְ יָת פִּתְגָמָא דְדִינָא
verses.ar_en: You are to come before the kohanim-the Levites and the judge officiating during those days; you will inquire and they will tell you the legal decision.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד עַל מֵימַר פִּתְגָמָא דִי יְחַוּוּן לָךְ מִן אַתְרָא הַהוּא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ וְתִטַר לְמֶעְבַּד כְּכֹל דִי יַלְפֻנָךְ
verses.ar_en: You are to act according to the word that they tell you from that place that Adonoy will have chosen; and you are to be careful to fulfill exactly as they instruct you.

verses.ar_he: עַל מֵימַר אוֹרַיְתָא דִי יַלְפֻנָךְ וְעַל דִינָא דִי יֵימְרוּן לָךְ תַּעְבֵּד לָא תִסְטֵּי מִן פִּתְגָמָא דִי יְחַוּוּן לָךְ יַמִינָא וּשְׂמָאלָא
verses.ar_en: In accord with the Torah that they instruct you and upon the law that they state to you, are you to act; do not deviate from the word they tell you, neither right or left.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יַעְבֵּד בִּרְשַׁע בְּדִיל דְלָא לְקַבָּלָא מִן כַּהֲנָא דְקָאֵם לְשַׁמָשָׁא תַמָן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ אוֹ מִן דַיָנָא וְיִתְקְטֵל גַבְרָא הַהוּא וּתְפַלֵי עָבֵד דְבִישׁ מִיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: But the man who acts deliberately to not heed the kohein who stands to serve there [before] Adonoy, your God, or the judge; that man is to be executed and you will eliminate the evil [doer] from Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל עַמָא יִשְׁמְעוּן וְיִדְחֲלוּן וְלָא יַרְשִׁיעוּן עוֹד
verses.ar_en: Let all the people hear and fear, and not sin deliberately again.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תֵעוֹל לְאַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ וְתֵירְתַהּ וְתֵיתֵב בַּהּ וְתֵימַר אֱמַנִי עֲלַי מַלְכָּא כְּכָל עַמְמַיָא דִי בְסַחֲרָנָי
verses.ar_en: When you arrive in the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you and inherit it and live in it, and you say, ‘‘Let me appoint over me a king like all the nations around me;’’

verses.ar_he: מַנָאָה תְמַנֵי עֲלָךְ מַלְכָּא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בֵּהּ מִגוֹ אַחָיךְ תְּמַנֵי עֲלָךְ מַלְכָּא לֵת לָךְ רְשׁוּ לְמַנָאָה עֲלָךְ גְבַר נוּכְרַי דִי לָא אֲחוּךְ הוּא
verses.ar_en: Appoint are you to appoint over yourself a king whom Adonoy, your God, will choose. From among your brothers are you to appoint over yourself a king; you may not [you have no permission to] place over yourself a foreigner who is not your brother.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד לָא יַסְגֵי לֵהּ סוּסָוָן וְלָא יָתֵב יָת עַמָא לְמִצְרָיִם בְּדִיל לְאַסְגָּאָה לֵהּ סוּסָוָן וַיְיָ אֲמַר לְכוֹן לָא תוֹסְפוּן לְמִתוּב בְּאֹרַח הָדֵין עוֹד
verses.ar_en: However, he must not acquire an abundance of horses for himself so that he will not return the people to Egypt in order to acquire an abundance of horses, because Adonoy told you, ‘‘You are not to proceed to return along this route again.’’

verses.ar_he: וְלָא יַסְגֵי לֵהּ נְשִׁין וְלָא יִטְעֵי לִבֵּהּ וְכַסְפָּא וְדַהַבָא לָא יַסגֵי לֵהּ לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: And he is not to acquire an abundance of wives for himself so that his heart will not veer; and silver and gold he may not accumulate for himself in great abundance.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי כְמִתְּבֵהּ עַל כָּרְסָא מַלְכוּתֵהּ וְיִכְתּוֹב לֵהּ יָת פַּתְשֶׁגֶן אוֹרַיְתָא הָדָא עַל סִפְרָא מִן קֳדָם כָּהֲנַיָא לֵוָאֵי
verses.ar_en: It shall be, that when he occupies the throne of his kingdom, he must write for himself a duplicate of this Torah in a scroll form [the scroll] before the kohanim—the Levites.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי עִמֵהּ וִיהֵי קָרֵי בֵהּ כָּל יוֹמֵי חַיוֹהִי בְּדִיל דְיֵלַף לְמִדְחַל קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֵהּ לְמִטַּר יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמֵי אוֹרַיְתָא הָדָא וְיָת קְיָמַיָא הָאִלֵין לְמֶעְבָּדְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: It is to accompany him and he is to read in it all the days of his life, in order that he learn to fear [before] Adonoy, his God, to guard every word of this Torah and these statutes to fulfill them;

verses.ar_he: בְּדִיל דְלָא יְרִים לִבֵּהּ מֵאֲחוֹהִי וּבְדִיל דְלָא יִסְטֵּי מִן תַּפְקֶדְתָּא יַמִינָא וּשְׂמָאלָא בְּדִיל דְיוֹרֵךְ יוֹמִין עַל מַלְכוּתֵהּ הוּא וּבְנוֹהִי בְּגוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: That his pride not increase over his brothers and he does not stray from the commandment right or left; so that the days of his reign are lengthy over his kingdom, he and his sons within Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: לָא יְהֵי לְכָהֲנַיָא לֵוָאֵי כָּל שִׁבְטָא דְלֵוִי חֳלָק וְאַחֲסָנָא עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל קֻרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ וְאַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ יֵיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: They will not have—the kohanim, the Levites, the entire tribe of Levi—a portion or an inheritance with Yisroel; Adonoy’s fire-offerings [sacrifices] and His inheritance will they eat.

verses.ar_he: וְאַחֲסָנָא לָא יְהֵי לֵהּ בְּגוֹ אֲחוֹהִי מַתְּנָן דִיהַב לֵהּ יְיָ אִנוּן אַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: But he will have no territory among his brothers; [the gifts that] Adonoy [has given him] is his territory, as He said to him.

verses.ar_he: וְדֵין יְהֵי דְחָזֵי לְכָהֲנַיָא מִן עַמָא מִן נָכְסֵי נִכְסָתָא אִם תּוֹר אִם אִמָר וְיִתֵּן לְכַהֲנָא דְרוֹעָא וְלוֹעָא וְקֻבְתָא
verses.ar_en: And this will be the stipend of the kohanim from the people from the slaughterers of [permitted] meat, whether an ox or a sheep; he will give the kohein the foreleg and the jaw and the [fourth] stomach.

verses.ar_he: רֵישׁ עִבוּרָךְ חַמְרָךְ וּמִשְׁחָךְ וְרֵישׁ גִזָא דְעָנָךְ תַּפְרֵשׁ לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: The first portion of your grain, your wine, and your olive oil, and the first of the shearing of your sheep are you to give him.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי בֵהּ יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מִכָּל שִׁבְטָיךְ לְמֵקַם לְשַׁמָשָׁא בִשְׁמָא דַיְיָ הוּא וּבְנוֹהִי כָּל יוֹמַיָא
verses.ar_en: For him did Adonoy, your God, choose from all your tribes to stand and perform the service in the name of Adonoy, he and his sons for all time.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יֵיתֵי לֵוָאָה מֵחֲדָא מִקִרְוָיךְ מִכָּל יִשְׂרָאֵל דִי הוּא דָר תַּמָן וְיֵיתֵי בְּכָל רְעוּת נַפְשֵׁהּ לְאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ
verses.ar_en: If a Levite should come from one of your cities throughout Yisroel where he sojourns, coming will all his soul’s desire to the place that Adonoy chooses.

verses.ar_he: וִישַׁמַשׁ בִּשְׁמָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהֵהּ כְּכָל אֲחוֹהִי לֵוָאֵי דִמְשַׁמְשִׁין תַּמָן (בִּצְלוֹ) קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He shall perform the service in the name of Adonoy, his God, like all his brother Levites who stand [serve] there [(in prayer)] in Adonoy’s Presence.

verses.ar_he: חֳלָק כָּחֳלָק יֵיכְלוּן בַּר מִמַטַרְתָּא דְיֵיתֵי בְּשַׁבַּתָּא דְכֵן אַתְקִינוּ אֲבָהָתָא
verses.ar_en: They shall eat equal portions [portion for portions], except for what the families sold [to one another] [exept for the allotment which come on Shabbos, as our (fore)fathers have regulated].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי אַתְּ עָלֵל לְאַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ לָא תֵילַף לְמֶעְבַּד כְּתֹעֲבַת עַמְמַיָא הָאִנוּן
verses.ar_en: Because you are entering the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you; do not learn to perpetrate the abominations of those nations.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִשְׁתְּכַח בָּךְ מַעֲבַר בְּרֵהּ וּבְרַתֵּהּ בְּנוּרָא קָסֵם קֻסְמִין מְעָנֵן וּמְנַחֵשׁ וְחָרָשׁ
verses.ar_en: Let there not exist among you anyone who passes his son or daughter through fire, who practices the kosem-occult; who practices time-frame-occult or who divines portentuous events or a sorcerer.

verses.ar_he: וְרָטִין רְטָן וְשָׁאֵל בִּדִין וּדְכוּרוּ וְתָבַע מִן מֵתַיָא
verses.ar_en: Or a snake charmer, or one who invokes the spirit of Ov or yidoni, or communicates with the dead.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי מְרָחָק יְיָ כָּל דְיַעְבֵּד אִלֵין וּבְדִיל תּוֹעֲבָתָא הָאִלֵין יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מְתָרַךְ יָתְהוֹן מִקֳדָמָךְ
verses.ar_en: For Adonoy’s abomination is [distances] anyone perpetrating this and because of these abominations, Adonoy, your God, is expelling them from before you.

verses.ar_he: שְׁלִים תְּהֵי בְּדַחַלְתָּא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: Walk in perfect trust with [in the fear of] Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי עַמְמַיָא הָאִלֵין דִי אַתְּ יָרֵת יָתְהוֹן מִן מְעָנְנַיָא וּמִן קַסָמַיָא שָׁמְעִין וְאַתְּ לָא כֵן יְהַב לָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: Although these nations whom you are inheriting heed augurers and sorcerers, but as to you—Adonoy, your God, has not given you their status.

verses.ar_he: נְבִיָא מִבֵּינָךְ מֵאַחָיךְ כְּוָתִי יְקִים לָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מִנֵהּ תְּקַבְּלוּן
verses.ar_en: A prophet from your midst, of your brethren, like me, will Adonoy, your God, establish for you; heed him.

verses.ar_he: כְּכֹל דִי שְׁאֶלְתָּא מִקֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּחֹרֵב בְּיוֹמָא דִקְהָלָא לְמֵימָר לָא אוֹסֵף לְמִשְׁמָע יָת קָל מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהַי וְיָת אֶשָׁתָא רַבְּתָא הָדָא לָא אֶחֱזֵי עוֹד וְלָא אֵמוּת
verses.ar_en: Exactly as you requested from [before] Adonoy, your God, at Choreiv, on the day of assembly, saying, ‘‘Let me not continue to hear the voice [the word] of Adonoy, my God, and this great fire let me not see any more as that I will not die.’’

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לִי אוֹטִיבוּ דִי מַלִילוּ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to me, ‘‘What they said is excellent.

verses.ar_he: נְבִיָא אֲקִים לְהוֹן מִגוֹ אֲחֵיהוֹן כְּוָתָךְ וְאֶתֵּן פִּתְגָמֵי נְבוּאָתִי בְּפוּמֵהּ וִימַלֵל עִמְהוֹן יָת כָּל דִי אֲפַקְדִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: A prophet will I establish for them from among their brethren like you, and I will place My words [of prophecy] in his mouth and he will tell them everything that I command him.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי גַבְרָא דִי לָא יְקַבֵּל לְפִתְגָמַי דִי יְמַלֵל בִּשְׁמִי מֵימְרִי יִתְבַּע מִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Now, the man who does not heed My words that he speaks in My Name; I [My word] will demand from him.
