verses.ar_he: בְּרַם נְבִיָא דִי יַרְשַׁע לְמַלָלָא פִתְגָמָא בִּשְׁמִי יָת דִי לָא פַקֵדִתֵּה לְמַלָלָא וְדִי יְמַלֵיל בְּשׁוּם טַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא וְיִתְקְטֵל נְבִיָא הַהוּא
verses.ar_en: But the prophet who will malevolently make a statement in My Name, something that I did not instruct him to say, or which he says in the name of foreign gods [idols of the nations], that prophet must die.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תֵימַר בְּלִבָּךְ אֶכְדֵן נִדַע יָת פִּתְגָמָא דִי לָא מַלְלֵהּ יְיָ
verses.ar_en: If you should say to yourself, ‘‘How can we know [which is] the statement that Adonoy did not speak?’’

verses.ar_he: דִי יְמַלֵל נְבִיָא בִּשְׁמָא דַיְיָ וְלָא יְהֵי פִתְגָמָא וְלָא יִתְקַיַם הוּא פִתְגָמָא דִי לָא מַלְלֵהּ יְיָ בִּרְשַׁע מַלְלֵהּ נְבִיָא לָא תִדְחַלּ מִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Should the prophet speak in Adonoy’s Name, and the matter does not happen and is not fulfilled, that is the statement that Adonoy did not speak. The prophet spoke it malevolently; do not fear him.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְשֵׁצֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָת עַמְמַיָא דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ יָת אַרְעֲהוֹן וְתֵרְתִנוּן וְתֵיתֵב בְּקִרְוֵיהוֹן וּבְבָתֵּיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: When Adonoy, your God, annihilates the nations whose land Adonoy, your God is giving you; and you inherit them and live in their cities and in their houses;

verses.ar_he: תְּלַת קִרְוִין תַּפְרֵשׁ לָךְ בְּגוֹ אַרְעָךְ דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ לְמֵירְתַהּ
verses.ar_en: Separate three cities for yourself, within your land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you to inherit.

verses.ar_he: תְּתַקֵן לָךְ אָרְחָא וּתְתַלַת יָת תְּחוּם אַרְעָךְ דִי יַחְסְנִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וִיהֵי לְמֵעִירוֹק תַּמָן כָּל קָטוֹלָא
verses.ar_en: Ready the route for yourself and divide the borders of your land into three sections that Adonoy, your God, will allot you; this will serve for any murderer to flee there.

verses.ar_he: וְדֵין פִּתְגַם קָטוֹלָא דְיֵעִרוֹק תַּמָן וְיִתְקַיַם דִי יִקְטוֹל יָת חַבְרֵהּ בְּלָא מַנְדְעֵהּ וְהוּא לָא סָנֵי לֵהּ מֵאִתְמַלֵי וּמִדְקָמוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: And this is the matter of the murderer who may flee there to survive: whoever smites his peer without intent, and he had not been his enemy yesterday [or] the day before;

verses.ar_he: וְדִי יֵעוֹל עִם חַבְרֵהּ בְּחֻרְשָׁא לְמִקַץ אָעִין וְתִתְמְרֵיג יְדֵהּ בְּפַרְזְלָא לְמִקַץ אָעָא וְיִשְׁתְּלֵף פַּרְזְלָא מִן אָעָא וְיַשְׁכַּח יָת חַבְרֵהּ וִימוּת הוּא יֵעִרוֹק לַחֲדָא מִן קִרְוַיָא הָאִלֵין וְיִתְקַיַם
verses.ar_en: And whoever comes with his peer into the woods to chop trees, and as his hand swung the axe downward to cut the wood the iron flew off the wooden handle and encounters his peer and he dies; he is to flee to one of these cities to survive.

verses.ar_he: דִילְמָא יִרְדוֹף גָאֵל דְמָא בָּתַר קָטוֹלָא אֲרֵי יֵחַם לִבֵּה וְיַדְבְּקִנֵהּ אֲרֵי תִסְגֵי אָרְחָא וְיִקְטְלִנֵהּ נְפַשׁ וְלֵהּ לֵית חוֹבַת דִין דִקְטוֹל אֲרֵי לָא סָנֵי הוּא לֵהּ מִתְּמַלֵי וּמִדְקָמוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Lest the blood-redeemer pursue the murderer when his heart grows heated, and he catches up with him over the length of the road and he smite him dead when he has no [judgment of a] death sentence because he had not been his enemy yesterday [or] the day before.

verses.ar_he: עַל כֵּן אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ לְמֵימָר תְּלַת קִרְוִין תַּפְרֵשׁ לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Therefore am I commanding you the following: three cities shall you separate for yourself.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם יַפְתֵּי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָת תְּחוּמָךְ כְּמָא דִי קַיִים לַאֲבָהָתָךְ וְיִתֶּן לָךְ יָת כָּל אַרְעָא דִי מַלִיל לְמִתַּן לַאֲבָהָתָךְ
verses.ar_en: And when Adonoy, your God, expands your boundary, in accordance with His oath to your forefathers, and He give you the entire land that He promised to give to your forefathers,

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִטַר יָת כָּל תַּפְקֶדְתָּא הָדָא לְמֶעְבְּדַהּ דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין לְמִרְחַם יָת יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וְלִמְהַךְ בְּאָרְחָן דְתַקְנָן קֳדָמוֹהִי כָּל יוֹמַיָא וְתוֹסֵף לָךְ עוֹד תְּלַת קִרְוִין עַל תְּלַת אִלֵין
verses.ar_en: When you will be guarding this entire mitzvah to fulfill it, that I am commanding you today, to love Adonoy, your God, and to go in His ways [that are proper before Him] for all time; then you shall add three more cities to these three.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא יִשְׁתְּפֵךְ דָם זַכַּי בְּגוֹ אַרְעָךְ דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ אַחֲסָנָא וִיהֵי עֲלָךְ חוֹבַת דִין דִקְטוֹל
verses.ar_en: And let innocent blood not be shed within your land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you as territory, [otherwise] you will bear liability for the blood [the judgment of a death sentence].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יְהֵי גְבַר סָנֵי לְחַבְרֵהּ וְיִכְמַן לֵהּ וִיקוּם עֲלוֹהִי וְיִמְחִנֵהּ נְפָשׁ וִימוּת וְיֵעִרוֹק לַחֲדָא מִן קִרְוַיָא הָאִלֵין
verses.ar_en: If there is a man who hates his neighbor, and will ambush him, arising against him and smiting him dead, and he will flee to one of these cities;

verses.ar_he: וִישַׁלְחוּן סָבֵי קַרְתֵּהּ וְיִדְבְּרוּן יָתֵהּ מִתַּמָן וְיִתְּנוּן יָתֵהּ בְּיַד גָאֵל דְמָא וִימוּת
verses.ar_en: The elders of his city will send for and take him from there, and will hand him over to the blood-redeemer, and he will be executed.

verses.ar_he: לָא תְחוּס עֵינָךְ עֲלוֹהִי וּתְפַלֵי אַשְׁדִי דָם זַכַּי מִיִשְׂרָאֵל וְיֵיטַב לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Do not view him with compassion. You are to eliminate the [shedding of] innocent blood from Yisroel, and you will have it good.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַשְׁנֵי תְּחוּמָא דְחַבְרָךְ דִי תְחִימוּ קַדְמָאֵי בְּאַחֲסַנְתָּךְ דִי תַחֲסֵן בְּאַרְעָא דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ לְמֵירְתַהּ
verses.ar_en: Do not move back the boundary of your neighbor that the first [settlers] determine [bounded] in your territory that you will inherit in the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you to inherit.

verses.ar_he: לָא יְקוּם סָהִיד חַד בִּגְבַר לְכָל עַוָיָן וּלְכָל חוֹבִין בְּכָל חֵט דִי יֶחְטֵי עַל מֵימַר תְּרֵין סָהֲדִין אוֹ עַל מֵימַר תְּלָתָא סָהֲדִין יִתְקַיַם פִּתְגָמָא
verses.ar_en: One witness may not arise against a man about any sin or for any transgression or transgression that he transgresses; by the word of two witnesses or by the word of three witnesses let a matter be established.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְקוּם סָהִיד שְׁקַר בִּגְבָר לְאַסְהָדָא בֵהּ סַטְּיָא
verses.ar_en: If false witnesses arise against a man and bear fallacious testimony [with perversity] against him;

verses.ar_he: וִיקוּמוּן תְרֵין גֻבְרִין דִי לְהוֹן דִינָא קֳדָם יְיָ קֳדָם כָּהֲנַיָא וְדַיָנַיָא דִי יְהוֹן בְּיוֹמַיָא הָאִנוּן
verses.ar_en: The two men shall stand, who are involved in the dispute, before Adonoy, before the kohanim and the judges who are in those days.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְבְּעוּן דַיָנַיָא יָאוּת וְהָא סָהִיד שְׁקַר סָהֲדָא שִׁקְרָא אַסְהַד בַּאֲחוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: When the judges shall investigate thoroughly and behold, the witness testified falsely, they testified falsely against their brother;

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבְּדוּן לֵהּ כְּמָא דִי חַשִׁיב לְמֶעְבַּד לַאֲחוֹהִי וּתְפַלֵי עָבֵד דְבִישׁ מִבֵּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: You are to do to [each of] them as he conspired to do to his brother, and eliminate the evil [doers] from among you;

verses.ar_he: וּדְיִשְׁתַּאֲרוּן יִשְׁמְעוּן וְיִדְחֲלוּן וְלָא יוֹסְפוּן לְמֶעְבַּד עוֹד כְּפִתְגָמָא בִישָׁא הָדֵין בֵּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: And the remainder will hear and be fearful, and they will not repeat this evil thing among you.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תְחוּס עֵינָךְ נַפְשָׁא חֳלַף נַפְשָׁא עֵינָא חֳלַף עֵינָא שִׁנָא חֳלַף שִׁנָא יְדָא חֳלַף יְדָא רַגְלָא חֳלַף רַגְלָא
verses.ar_en: You are not to have compassion: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִפּוֹק לַאֲגָחָא קְרָבָא עַל בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ וְתֶחֱזֵי סוּסָוָן וּרְתִכִּין עַם סַגִי מִנָךְ לָא תִדְחַל מִנְהוֹן אֲרֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מֵימְרֵהּ בְּסַעְדָךְ דְאַסְקָךְ מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: When you go to [wage] war against your enemy, and you see horse and chariot, people who outnumber you; do not be afraid of them, for [the word of] Adonoy, your God, is with you [will aid you], He Who brought you up from the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי כְּמִקְרָבְכוֹן לַאֲגָחָא קְרָבָא וְיִתְקְרִיב כַּהֲנָא וִימַלֵל עִם עַמָא
verses.ar_en: Now, as you [come] near the battle [to wage war], the kohein shall approach and speak to the people.

verses.ar_he: וְיֵימַר לְהוֹן שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל אַתּוּן קְרִיבִין יוֹמָא דֵין לַאֲגָחָא קְרָבָא עַל בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן לָא יְזוּעַ לִבְּכוֹן לָא תִדְחֲלוּן וְלָא תִתְבַּהֲתוּן וְלָא תִתָּבְרוּן מִקֳדָמֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: He will say to them, ‘‘Hear, Yisroel! You are setting out today to battle [to wage war] against your enemies. Do not be faint hearted; or intimidated and do not panic, and do not be crushed [broken] before them;

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן דִמְדַבַּר קֳדָמֵיכוֹן לַאֲגָחָא לְכוֹן קְרָב עִם בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן לְמִפְרַק יָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Because Adonoy, your God, marches with you [before you] to do battle [wage war] for you with your enemies to save you.’’

verses.ar_he: וִימַלְלוּן סָרְכַיָא קֳדָם עַמָא לְמֵימָר מָן גַבְרָא דִי בְנָא בֵיתָא חַדְתָּא וְלָא חָנְכֵהּ יְהַךְ וִיתוּב לְבֵיתֵהּ דִילְמָא יְמוּת בַּאֲגָחָא קְרָבָא וּגְבַר אָחָרָן יַחְנְכִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: The officers will address the people as follows, ‘‘Whichever man has built a new house and did not inaugurate it as a dwelling, let him go and return home lest he die in battle [while waging war] and another man will inaugurate it.

verses.ar_he: וּמָן גַבְרָא דִי נְצִיב כַּרְמָא וְלָא אַחֲלֵהּ יְהַךְ וִיתוּב לְבֵיתֵהּ דִילְמָא יְמוּת בַּאֲגָחָא קְרָבָא וּגְבַר אָחָרָן יְחַלִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: And whichever man has planted a vineyard and did not redeem it[s fruit,] let him go and return home, lest he die in battle [while waging war] and another man redeem it.

verses.ar_he: וּמָן גַבְרָא דִי אֵרַס אִתְּתָא וְלָא נָסְבַהּ יְהַךְ וִיתוּב לְבֵיתֵהּ דִילְמָא יְמוּת בַּאֲגָחָא קְרָבָא וּגְבַר אָחֳרָן יִסְבִנַהּ
verses.ar_en: And whichever man has betrothed a woman and not married her, let him go and return home, lest he die in battle [while waging war] and another man marry her.’’

verses.ar_he: וְיוֹסְפוּן סָרְכַיָא לְמַלָלָא עִם עַמָא וְיֵימְרוּן מָן גַבְרָא דְדָחֵל וּתְבִיר לִבָּא יְהַךְ וִיתוּב לְבֵיתֵהּ וְלָא יִתְּבַר יָת לִבָּא דַאַחוֹהִי כְּלִבֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: The officers will further address the people and say. ‘‘Whoever is afraid or faint [broken] hearted, let him go and return home, and let him not destroy the resolve [break the heart] of his brothers like his own resolve.’’

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי כַּד יְשֵׁצוּן סָרְכַיָא לְמַלָלָא עִם עַמָא וִימַנוּן רַבָּנֵי חֵילָא בְּרֵישׁ עַמָא
verses.ar_en: When the officers finish addressing the people; they will appoint army commanders at the head of the people.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִקְרַב לְקַרְתָּא לַאֲגָחָא (קְרָבָא) עֲלַהּ וְתִקְרֵי לַהּ מִלִין דִשְׁלָם
verses.ar_en: When you near a city to do battle against it, you are to offer it [words of] peace.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אִם שְׁלַם תַּעֲנִנָךְ וְתִפְתַּח לָךְ וִיהֵי כָּל עַמָא דְיִשְׁתְּכַח בַּהּ יְהוֹן לָךְ מַסְקֵי מִסִין וְיִפְלְחֻנָךְ
verses.ar_en: Should it respond, ‘‘Peace!’’ and open for you, then all the people found in it will become your payers of tribute, and your servants.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא תַשְׁלֵם עִמָךְ וְתַעְבֵּד עִמָךְ קְרָב וּתְצוּר עֲלַהּ
verses.ar_en: And if it does not settle for peace with you but engages in war against you, you shall lay siege to it.

verses.ar_he: וְיִמְסְרִנַהּ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בִּידָךְ וְתִמְחֵי יָת כָּל דְכוּרַהּ לְפִתְגַם דְחָרֶב
verses.ar_en: Adonoy, your God, will deliver it into your hand, and you will smite all its males by the sword.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד נְשַׁיָא וְטַפְלָא וּבְעִירָא וְכֹל דִי יְהֵי בְקַרְתָּא כָּל עֲדָאַהּ תֵּבוֹז לָךְ וְתֵיכוּל יָת עֲדָאָה דְסַנְאָךְ דִי יְהַב יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָךְ
verses.ar_en: However, the women and the children, and the animals, and everything that will be in the city—all its booty—are you to plunder for yourself; you will eat the booty of your enemies that Adonoy, your God, gave you.

verses.ar_he: כֵּן תַּעְבֵד לְכָל קִרְוַיָא דִי רְחִיקִין מִנָךְ לַחֲדָא דִי לָא מִקִרְוֵי עַמְמַיָא הָאִלֵין אִנוּן
verses.ar_en: So will you do to all the cities, that are very distant from you, that are not among the cities of these nations.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד מִקִרְוֵי עַמְמַיָא הָאִלֵין דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ אַחֲסָנָא לָא תְקַיַם כָּל נִשְׁמָתָא
verses.ar_en: However, from the cities of these peoples that Adonoy, your God, is giving you as inheritance, you are not to leave any person alive.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי גַמָרָא תְגַמְרִנוּן חִתָּאֵי וֶאֱמֹרָאֵי כְּנַעֲנָאֵי וּפְרִזָאֵי חִוָאֵי וִיבוּסָאֵי כְּמָא דִי פַקְדָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: Rather annihilate are you to annihilate them: the Chittites and the Emorites, the Canaanites and the Perizites, the Chivites and the Yevusites; as Adonoy, your God, commanded you.

verses.ar_he: בְּדִיל דִי לָא יַלְפוּן יָתְכוֹן לְמֶעְבַּד כְּכָל תּוֹעֲבָתְהוֹן דִי עֲבָדוּ לְטַעֲוָתְהוֹן וּתְחוֹבוּן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: In order that they do not teach you to do any of their abominations that they did for their gods [idols], and you will sin to [before] Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תְצוּר לְקַרְתָּא יוֹמִין סַגִיאִין לַאֲגָחָא עֲלַהּ לְמִכְבְּשַׁהּ לָא תְחַבֵּל יָת אִילָנַהּ לַאֲרָמָא עֲלוֹהִי פַּרְזְלָא אֲרֵי מִנֵה תֵּיכוּל וְיָתֵהּ לָא תְקוּץ אֲרֵי לָא כַאֲנָשָׁא אִילַן חַקְלָא לְמֵיעַל מְקָדָמָךְ בִּצְיָרָא
verses.ar_en: If you besiege a city many days to wage war against it, to capture it, do not harm [any of] its trees by chopping it with an ax, because you eat from it you are not to cut it down; For, is [not] the tree in the field a man to join the besieged to escape you?

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד אִילָן דְתִדַע אֲרֵי לָא אִילַן דְמַאֲכָל הוּא יָתֵהּ תְּחַבַּל וּתְקוּץ וְתִבְנֵי כַרְקוֹמִין עַל קַרְתָּא דִי הִיא עָבְדָא עִמָךְ קְרָבָא עַד דְתִכְבְּשַׁהּ
verses.ar_en: Only a tree that you know that it is not a fruit tree may you harm or cut down; and you will build battlements [fortifications] against the city that is waging war against you until it is conquered.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִשְׁתְּכַח קְטִּילָא בְּאַרְעָא דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ לְמֵירְתַהּ רָמֵי בְּחַקְלָא לָא אִתְיְדַע מַן קָטְּלֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If a corpse is found in the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you to inherit, fallen in the field, it is not known who smote him.

verses.ar_he: וְיִפְּקוּן סָבָיךְ וְדַיָנָיךְ וְיִמְשְׁחוּן לְקִרְוַיָא דִי סַחֲרָנוּת קְטִילָא
verses.ar_en: Your elders shall go out—and your judges—and measure in the direction of the cities around the corpse.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי קַרְתָּא דִקְרִיבָא לִקְטִילָא וְיִדְבְּרוּן סָבֵי קַרְתָּא הַהִיא עֶגְלַת תּוֹרֵי דִי לָא אִתְפְּלַח בַּהּ דִי לָא נְגִידַת בְּנוּר
verses.ar_en: Now, the city nearest the corpse—the elders of that city are to take a calf-heifer that has not been worked, that has not drawn [with] a yoke.

verses.ar_he: וְיֶחֱתוּן סָבֵי קַרְתָּא הַהִיא יָת עֲגַלְתָּא לְנַחֲלָא בַיָר דִי לָא יִתְפְּלַח בֵּהּ וְלָא יִזְדְרַע וְיִנְקְפוּן תַּמָן יָת עֲגַלְתָּא בְּנַחֲלָא
verses.ar_en: The elders of that city will take down the calf to a stony valley that is not to be tilled and not to be seeded, and they shall decapitate the calf in that valley.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְקָרְבוּן כָּהֲנַיָא בְּנֵי לֵוִי אֲרֵי בְהוֹן יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְשַׁמָשׁוּתֵהּ וּלְבָרָכָא בִּשְׁמָא דַיְיָ וְעַל מֵימְרֵהוֹן יְהֵי כָּל דִין וְכָל מַכְתַּשׁ סְגִירוּ
verses.ar_en: The kohanim, descendants of Levi, will approach; because them did Adonoy, your God, choose to serve Him and to bless in Adonoy’s Name; and they will decide every dispute [law] and every nega.

verses.ar_he: וְכֹל סָבֵי קַרְתָּא הַהִיא דִקְרִיבִין לִקְטִילָא יַסְחוּן יָת יְדֵיהוֹן עַל עֲגַלְתָּא דִנְקֶפְתָּא בְנַחֲלָא
verses.ar_en: And all the elders of that city, those near the corpse, will wash their hands over the calf beheaded in that valley.

verses.ar_he: וִיתִיבוּן וְיֵימְרוּן יְדָנָא לָא אַשְׁדוֹ יָת דְמָא הָדֵין וְעֵינָנָא לָא חֲזָאָה
verses.ar_en: They will [answer] loudly declare, ‘‘Our hands have not spilled this blood and our eyes did not see.’’

verses.ar_he: כָּהֲנַיָא יֵימְרוּן כַּפַּר לְעַמָךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל דִי פְרַקְתָּא יְיָ וְלָא תִתֵּן חוֹבַת דַם זַכַּי בְּגוֹ עַמָךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִתְכַּפַּר לְהוֹן עַל דְמָא
verses.ar_en: [The kohanim will say,] ‘‘Forgive Your people Yisroel, whom You, Adonoy, have redeemed; and do not allow [the responsibility of] innocent blood [liability] within Your people Yisroel.’’ The blood shall thus be atoned for in their behalf.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ תְּפַלֵי אַשְׁדִי דַם זַכַּי מִבֵּינָךְ אֲרֵי תַעְבֵּד דְכָשַׁר קֳדָם יְיָ: ססס
verses.ar_en: Still, you must eradicate the [liability for] [shedding] innocent blood from within you, when you do what is upright [proper] in Adonoy’s eyes.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִפּוֹק לַאֲגָחָא קְרָבָא עַל בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ וְיִמְסְרִנוּן יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בִּידָךְ וְתִשְׁבֵּי שִׁבְיְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: If you should go to [wage] war against your enemies, and Adonoy, your God, puts them in your hand, and you capture prisoners from them;

verses.ar_he: וְתֶחֱזֵי בְּשִׁבְיָה אִתְּתָא שַׁפִּירַת חֵזוּ וְתִתִּרְעֵי בַהּ וְתִסְבַהּ לָךְ לְאִנְתּוּ
verses.ar_en: And you see among the prisoners a beautifully formed woman; if you desire her, you may take her as your wife.

verses.ar_he: וְתָעֵלִנַהּ לְגוֹ בֵיתָךְ וּתְגַלַח יָת רֵישַׁהּ וּתְרַבִּי יָת טוּפְרָנָהָא
verses.ar_en: You will bring her into your house and she will shave her head and allow her nails to grow.

verses.ar_he: וְתֶעְדֵי יָת כְּסוּת שִׁבְיַהּ מִנַהּ וְתֵיתַב בְּבֵיתָךְ וְתִבְכֵּי יָת אֲבוּהָא וְיָת אִמַהּ יְרַח יוֹמִין וּבָתַר כֵּן תֵּיעוּל לְוָתַהּ וְתִבְעֲלִנַהּ וּתְהֵי לָךְ לְאִנְתּוּ
verses.ar_en: She must discard her prisoner’s garb from upon her, and she will remain in your home and weep for her father and her mother a month of days; and afterwards you may come to her and consummate with her, and she will become your wife.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אִם לָא תִתִּרְעֵי בַהּ וְתִפְטְּרִנַהּ לְנַפְשַׁהּ וְזַבָּנָא לָא תְזַבְּנִנַהּ בְּכַסְפָּא לָא תִתָּגַר בַּהּ חֳלַף דִי עִינִיתַהּ
verses.ar_en: But it shall come to pass, that if you do not desire her you will send her free, but to sell—you may not sell her for money; you may not exploit her since you have oppressed her.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תְהֶוְיָן לִגְבַר תַּרְתֵּין נְשִׁין חֲדָא רְחֶמְתָּא וַחֲדָא שְׂנִיאֲתָא וִילִידָן לֵהּ בְּנִין רְחֶמְתָּא וּשְׂנִיאֲתָא וִיהֵי בְּרָא בוּכְרָא לִשְׂנִיאֲתָא
verses.ar_en: If a man has two wives, one loved and the other hated, and they bear him sons, the loved [one] and the hated [one], and the firstborn son will be the hated one’s.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי בְּיוֹמָא דְיַחְסֵן לִבְנוֹהִי יָת דִי יְהֵי לֵהּ לֵית לֵהּ רְשׁוּ לְבַכָּרָא יָת בַּר רְחֶמְתָּא עַל אַפֵּי בַר שְׂנִיאֲתָא בּוּכְרָא
verses.ar_en: When the day comes for him to will to his sons what he owns, he may not prefer the son of the loved one over the son of the hated one—the firstborn.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יָת בּוּכְרָא בַר שְׂנִיאֲתָא יַפְרַשׁ לְמִתַּן לֵהּ תַּרְתֵּין חָלָקִין בְּכֹל דִי יִשְׁתְּכַח לֵהּ אֲרֵי הוּא רֵישׁ תָּקְפֵּהּ לֵהּ חָזְיָא בְכֵרוּתָא
verses.ar_en: Rather, the firstborn son of the hated one is he to recognize [separate] to give him doublefold of all that he possesses; for he is the first of his power, he has the rights of primogeniture.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְהֵי לִגְבַר בַּר סָטֵי וּמָרֵי לֵיתוֹהִי מְקַבַּל לְמֵימַר אֲבוּהִי וּלְמֵימַר אִמֵהּ וּמַלְפָן יָתֵהּ וְלָא יְקַבֵּל מִנְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: If a man has a wayward and rebellious son who does not obey his father[’s words] and his mother[’s words]; though they chasten [teach] him; he does not listen to [obey] them.

verses.ar_he: וְיֶחֱדוּן בֵּהּ אֲבוּהִי וְאִמֵּהּ וְיַפְּקוּן יָתֵהּ לָקֳדָם סָבֵי קַרְתֵּהּ וְלִתְרַע בֵּית דִין אַתְרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: His father and mother are to grasp him and take him out to [before] the judges of his city and to the court in his location.

verses.ar_he: וְיֵימְרוּן לְסָבֵי קַרְתֵּהּ בְּנָנָא דֵין סָטֵי וּמָרֵי לֵיתוֹהִי מְקַבֵּל לְמֵימְרָנָא זָלֵל בְּסָר וְסָבֵי חֲמַר
verses.ar_en: They will say to the judges of his city, ‘‘This son of ours is wayward and rebellious—he does not obey [our words]—gluttonous [with meat] and drunken [with wine].’’

verses.ar_he: וְיִרְגְמֻנֵהּ כָּל אֶנָשֵׁי קַרְתֵּהּ בְּאַבְנַיָא וִימוּת וּתְפַלֵי עָבֵד דְבִישׁ מִבֵּינָךְ וְכָל יִשְׂרָאֵל יִשְׁמְעוּן וְיִדְחֲלוּן
verses.ar_en: And all the men of his city will stone him with stones so that he dies, and you will eliminate the evil [doers] within you; and let all Yisroel hear and be fearful.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יְהֵי בִגְבַר חוֹבַת דִין דִקְטוֹל וְיִתְקְטֵל וְתִצְלוֹב יָתֵהּ עַל צְלִיבָא
verses.ar_en: If a man is guilty of a capital offense and is executed; you shall hang [crucify] him from a tree [on a crucifix].

verses.ar_he: לָא תְבִית נְבִלְתֵּהּ עַל צְלִיבָא אֲרֵי מִקְבַּר תִּקְבְּרִנֵהּ בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא אֲרֵי עַל דְחָב קֳדָם יְיָ אִצְטְלַב וְלָא תְסָאֵב יָת אַרְעָךְ דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ אַחֲסָנָא
verses.ar_en: Do not leave his corpse overnight on the tree [crucifix], but you are surely to bury him on that day, for a hanging corpse is an affront to God [for he was crucified because he sinned before Hashem]; so do not defile your land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you as territory.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֶחֱזֵי יָת תּוֹרָא דְאָחוּךְ אוֹ יַת אִמְרֵהּ דְטָעָן וְתִתְכְּבֵשׁ מִנְהוֹן אָתָבָא תָתֵבִנוּן לְאָחוּךְ
verses.ar_en: You may not observe your brother’s ox or his sheep lost and conceal yourself from them; you must surely return them to your brother.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא קָרֵב אֲחוּךְ לְוָתָךְ וְלָא יְדַעַתְּ לֵהּ וְתַכְנְשִׁנֵהּ לְגוֹ בֵיתָךְ וִיהֵי עִמָךְ עַד דְיִתְבַּע אֲחוּךְ יָתֵהּ וְתָתֵיבִנֵהּ לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: But if your brother is not near you or you do not know him, gather it into your house and let it stay with you until your brother seeks it, when you must return it to him.

verses.ar_he: וְכֵן תַּעְבֵּד לַחֲמָרֵהּ וְכֵן תַּעְבֵּד לִכְסוּתֵהּ וְכֵן תַּעְבֵּד לְכָל אֲבֵדַת אֲחוּךְ דִי תֵיבַד מִנֵהּ וְתַשְׁכְּחִנַהּ לֵית לָךְ רְשׁוּ לְאִתְכַּסָאָה
verses.ar_en: And so are you to do for his donkey, and so are you to do for his garment, and so are you to do for any lost object of your brother’s that is lost from him which you find. You may not [have no permission to] conceal yourself.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֶחֱזֵי יָת חֲמָרָא דְאָחוּךְ אוֹ תוֹרֵהּ רָמָן בְּאָרְחָא וְתִתְכְּבֵשׁ מִנְהוֹן אֲקָמָא תְקִים עִמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Do not observe your brother’s donkey or his ox collapsing on the road and ignore them. You must surely lift it up with him.

verses.ar_he: לָא יְהֵי תִקוּן זֵין דִגְבַר עַל אִתְּתָא וְלָא יְתַקֵן גְבַר בְּתִקוּנֵי אִתְּתָא אֲרֵי מְרָחָק קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ כָּל עָבֵד אִלֵין
verses.ar_en: A man’s attire [weapons] may not be on a woman nor may a man wear [adorn himself with] a woman’s garment [adornments]; for the abomination of [are distanced before] Adonoy, your God, are all who do these [things].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְעָרַע קִנָא דְצִפְּרָא קֳדָמָךְ בְּאָרְחָא בְּכָל אִילָן אוֹ עַל אַרְעָא אֶפְרוֹחִין אוֹ בֵיעִין וְאִמָא רְבֵעָא עַל אֶפְרֹחִין אוֹ עַל בֵּיעִין לָא תִסַב אִמָא עַל בְּנַיָא
verses.ar_en: If you should chance upon a bird’s nest before you on the road in any tree, or on the ground, [with] fledglings or eggs, and the mother is sitting on the fledglings or on the eggs; do not take the mother with her offspring.

verses.ar_he: שַׁלָחָא תְשַׁלַח יָת אִמָא וְיָת בְּנַיָא תִּסַב לָךְ בְּדִיל דְיֵיטַב לָךְ וְתוֹרִיךְ יוֹמִין
verses.ar_en: You must surely send away the mother and the offspring take for yourself, so that you will benefit and you will live long.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִבְנֵי בֵּיתָא חַדְתָּא וְתַעְבֵּד תְּיָקָא לְאִגְרָךְ וְלָא תְשַׁוִי חוֹבַת דִין דִקְטוֹל בְּבֵיתָךְ אֲרֵי יִפֵּל דְנָפֵל מִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: When you build a new home, you are to make a fence for your roof; and do not place blood [death] [liability] in your house, for someone who should fall may fall from it.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִזְרַע כַּרְמָךְ עֵרוּבִין דִילְמָא תִסְתָּאַב דִמְעַת זַרְעָא דִי תִזְרַע וַעֲלָלַת כַּרְמָא
verses.ar_en: Do not plant in your vineyard mixed species, lest the expansion become obnoxious [impure]—the seed that you plant—and the produce of the vineyard.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִרְדֵי בְתוֹרָא וּבַחֲמָרָא כַּחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: You may not plow with an ox and with a donkey together.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִלְבַּשּׁ שַׁעַטְנֵזָא עֲמַר וְכִתָּן מְחֻבַּר כַּחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: Do not don a mixture of threads, wool and flax [combined] together.

verses.ar_he: כְּרֻסְפְּדִין תַּעְבֶּד לָךְ עַל אַרְבַּע כַּנְפֵי כְסוּתָךְ דִי תְכַסֵי בַהּ
verses.ar_en: Make yourself pendant threads upon four corners of your garment that you cover with.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִסַב גְבַר אִתְּתָא וְיֵעוּל לְוָתַהּ וְיִסְנִנַהּ
verses.ar_en: If a man marries a woman, and he has relations with her and hates her.

verses.ar_he: וִישַׁוִי לַהּ תַּסְקוֹפֵי מִלִין וְיַפֵּק עֲלַהּ שׁוּם בִּישׁ וְיֵימַר יָת אִתְּתָא הָדָא נְסֵבִית וְעַלִית לְוָתַהּ וְלָא אַשְׁכָּחִית לַהּ בְּתוּלִין
verses.ar_en: Then berates her with calumnies [libelous words] and alleges defamation about her, and he claims, ‘‘I married this woman and was intimate with her, and did not find signs of her virginity.’’

verses.ar_he: וְיִסַב אֲבוּהָא (נ''א אֲבוּהִי) דְעוּלֶמְתָּא וְאִמַהּ וְיַפְּקוּן יָת בְּתוּלֵי עוּלֶמְתָּא לָקֳדָם סָבֵי קַרְתָּא לִתְרַע בֵּית דִין אַתְרָא
verses.ar_en: The girl’s father and mother will take and will prove the girl’s virginity to [before] the city judges in the [door of the] court [of that place].

verses.ar_he: וְיֵימַר אֲבוּהָא דְעוּלֶמְתָּא לְסָבַיָא יָת בְּרַתִּי יְהָבִית לְגַבְרָא הָדֵין לְאִנְתּוּ וּסְנִנַהּ
verses.ar_en: The girl’s father should assert to the judges, ‘‘My daughter did I marry to this man as a wife and he hates her.

verses.ar_he: וְהָא הוּא שַׁוִי תַּסְקוֹפֵי מִלִין לְמֵימַר לָא אַשְׁכָּחִית לִבְרַתָּךְ בְּתוּלִין וְאִלֵין בְּתוּלֵי בְרַתִּי וְיִפְרְסוּן שׁוֹשִׁיפָא קֳדָם סָבֵי קַרְתָּא
verses.ar_en: Look! He has promulgated libelous words, claiming ‘I did not find signs of your daughter’s virginity.’ But this is [the proof of] my daughter’s virginity.’’ And let them spread the cloth before the city judges.

verses.ar_he: וְיִדְבְּרוּן סָבֵי קַרְתָּא הַהִיא יָת גַבְרָא וְיַלְקוּן יָתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: The judges of that city will take the man and will chastise [whip] him.

verses.ar_he: וְיִגְבּוּן מִנֵהּ מְאָה סִלְעִין דִכְסָף וְיִתְּנוּן לַאֲבוּהָא דְעוּלֶמְתָּא אֲרֵי אַפֵּק שׁוּם בִּישׁ עַל בְּתוּלְתָּא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל וְלֵהּ תְּהֵי לְאִנְתּוּ לֵית לֵהּ רְשׁוּ לְמִפְטְּרַהּ כָּל יוֹמוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: And they will fine him one hundred silver [shekels] and give [them] to the girl’s father, because he defamed a virgin of Yisroel; and she shall remain his wife, he may not [does not have permission] divorce her all his life.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם קֻשְׁטָא הֲוָה פִּתְגָמָא הָדֵין לָא אִשְׁתְּכָחוּ בְתוּלִין לְעוּלֶמְתָּא
verses.ar_en: However, if the allegation is true; signs of the girl’s virginity were not found.

verses.ar_he: וְיַפְּקוּן יָת עוּלֶמְתָּא לִתְרַע בֵּית אָבוּהָא וְיִרְגְמֻנַהּ אֱנָשֵׁי קַרְתַּהּ בְּאַבְנַיָא וּתְמוּת אֲרֵי עָבְדַת קְלָנָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לְזַנָאָה בֵּית אֲבוּהָא וּתְפַלֵי עָבֵד דְבִישׁ מִבֵּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: They are to take the girl out to the entrance of her father’s home and the people of her city will stone her with stones to death, because she committed a disgraceful act against Yisroel by behaving promiscuously [in] her father’s house; and you will eliminate the evil [doer] within you.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִשְׁתְּכַח גְבַר דְשָׁכֵב עִם אִתְּתָא אִתַּת גְבַר וְיִתְקַטְלוּן אַף תַּרְוֵיהוֹן גַבְרָא דְשָׁכֵב עִם אִתְּתָא וְאִתְּתָא וּתְפַלֵי עָבֵד דְבִישׁ מִיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: If a man is found having intercourse with a woman who is the wife of a man, even both of them shall die—the man who had intercourse with the woman and the woman—and you will eliminate the evil [doer] from Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תְהֵי עוּלֶמְתָּא בְתֻלְתָּא דִמְאָרְסָא לִגְבַר וְיַשְׁכְּחִנַהּ גְבַר בְּקַרְתָּא וְיִשְׁכּוּב עִמַהּ
verses.ar_en: If there will be a virgin girl married to a man, and a man encounters her in the city and has intercourse with her,

verses.ar_he: וְתַפְּקוּן יָת תַּרְוֵיהוֹן לִתְרַע קַרְתָּא הַהִיא וְתִרְגְמוּן יָתְהוֹן בְּאַבְנַיָא וִימוּתוּן יָת עוּלֶמְתָּא עַל עֵסַק דִי לָא צְוָחַת בְּקַרְתָּא וְיָת גַבְרָא עַל עֵסַק דְעַנִי יָת אִתַּת חַבְרֵהּ וּתְפַלֵי עָבֵד דְבִּישׁ מִבֵּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: You are to take them both out to the court of that city and stone them with stones to death, the girl for the fact that she did not scream in the city and the man for the fact that he oppressed the wife of his peer; and you will eliminate the evil [doer] within you.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם בְּחַקְלָא יַשְׁכַּח גְבַר יָת עוּלֶמְתָּא דִמְאָרְסָא וְיִתְקֶף בַּהּ גַבְרָא וְיִשְׁכּוּב עִמַהּ וְיִתְקְטֵּל גַבְרָא דְשָׁכֵב עִמַהּ בִּלְחוֹדוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: But if in the field the man encounters the married girl, and the man holds her and had intercourse with her; then he shall die—only the man who had intercourse with her.

verses.ar_he: וּלְעוּלֶמְתָּא לָא תַעְבֵּד מִדַעַם לֵית לְעוּלֶמְתָּא חוֹבַת דִין דִקְטוֹל אֲרֵי כְּמָא דִיקוּם גַבְרָא עַל חַבְרֵהּ וְיִקְטְּלִנֵהּ נְפַשׁ כֵּן פִּתְגָמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: But to the girl you will not do a thing, the girl has no death liability; for, just as if a man rises up against his peer and murders him, so is this matter.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי בְחַקְלָא אַשְׁכְּחַהּ צְוָחַת עוּלֶמְתָּא דִמְאָרְסָא וְלֵית דְפָרִיק לַהּ
verses.ar_en: For he encountered her in the field; the married girl screamed, but there was no one to rescue her.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יַשְׁכַּח גְבַר עוּלֶמְתָּא בְתֻלְתָּא דִי לָא מְאָרְסָא וְיֶחֱדִנַהּ וְיִשְׁכּוּב עִמַהּ וְיִשְׁתַּכְּחוּן
verses.ar_en: If a man encounters a virgin girl who was not married and grabs her and has intercourse with her; and they are discovered.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתֵּן גַבְרָא דְיִשְׁכֻּב עִמַהּ לַאֲבוּהָא דְעוּלֶמְתָּא חַמְשִׁין סִלְעִין דִכְסַף וְלֵהּ תְּהֵי לְאִנְתּוּ חֳלַף דִי עַנְיַהּ לֵית לֵהּ רְשׁוּ לְמִפְטְרַהּ כָּל יוֹמוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: The man who had intercourse with her must give to the girl’s father fifty silver [shekels]; and she shall be his wife, since he oppressed her; he may not [has no permission to] divorce her all his life.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִסַב גְבַר יָת אִתַּת אֲבוּהִי וְלָא יְגַלֵי כַּנְפָא דַאֲבוּהִי
verses.ar_en: A man may not marry his father’s wife, and may not expose the edge of his father’s garment.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִדְכֵּי דְפָסִיק וְדִמְחַבַּל לְמֵעַל בִּקְהָלָא דַיְיָ
verses.ar_en: One may not [be “cleansed” to] enter—with injured or crushed genitals or with a gash causing spilling—into Adonoy’s community.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִדְכֵּי מַמְזֵרָא לְמֵעַל בִּקְהָלָא דַיְיָ אַף דָרָא עֲשִׂירָאָה לָא יִדְכֵּי לֵהּ לְמֵעַל בִּקְהָלָא דַיְיָ
verses.ar_en: A base-born may not [be “cleansed” to] enter into Adonoy’s community, even his tenth generation may not [“cleanse” him] enter into Adonoy’s community.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִדְכּוּן עַמוֹנָאֵי וּמוֹאָבָאֵי לְמֵעַל בִּקְהָלָא דַיְיָ אַף דָרָא עֲשִׂירָאָה לָא יִדְכֵּי לְהוֹן לְמֵעַל בִּקְהָלָא דַיְיָ עַד עָלָם
verses.ar_en: [Neither] an Ammonite nor a Moavite may [be “cleansed” to] enter into Adonoy’s community; even their tenth generation may not [be “cleansed” to] enter into Adonoy’s community forever.

verses.ar_he: עַל עֵסַק דִי לָא עֲרָעוּ יָתְכוֹן בְּלַחְמָא וּבְמַיָא בְּאָרְחָא בְּמִפָּקְכוֹן מִמִצְרָיִם וְדִי אֲגַר עֲלָךְ יָת בִּלְעָם בַּר בְּעוֹר מִפְּתוֹר אֲרַם דִי עַל פְּרָת לְלַטָּיוּתָךְ
verses.ar_en: Because of the matter that they did not greet you with bread and water on the way when you came out of Egypt; and because he hired against you Bilam son of Beor from Pesor in Aram Naharayim [on the river Peras] to curse you.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא אָבֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְקַבָּלָא מִן בִּלְעָם וַהֲפַךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָךְ יָת לְוָטִין לְבִרְכָן אֲרֵי רָחֲמָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy, your God, was unwilling to heed Bilam, and Adonoy, your God, turned for you the curse[s] into a blessing[s], because Adonoy, your God, loved you.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִתְבַּע שְׁלָמְהוֹן וְטָבָתְהוֹן כָּל יוֹמָיךְ לְעָלָם
verses.ar_en: Do not pursue their peace and their benefit all your life forever.

verses.ar_he: לָא תְרַחַק אֱדוֹמָאָה אֲרֵי אֲחוּךְ הוּא לָּא תְרַחַק מִצְרָאָה אֲרֵי דַיָר הֲוֵיתָא בְאַרְעֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Do not despise [distance] the Edomite, for he is your brother; do not despise [distance] the Egyptian, for you were a stranger in his land.

verses.ar_he: בְּנִין דִי יִתְיְלִידוּ לְהוֹן דָרָא תְלִיתָאָה יִדְכֵּי לְהוֹן לְמֵעַל בִּקְהָלָה דַיְיָ
verses.ar_en: Children who will be born to them, in the third generation, will [be “cleansed” to] enter into Adonoy’s community.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִפּוֹק מַשְׁרִיתָא עַל בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ וְתִסְתַּמַר מִכֹּל מִדַעַם בִּישׁ
verses.ar_en: When you go out to encamp against your enemies take precautions from every evil thing.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְהֵי בָךְ גְבַר דִי לָא יְהֵּי דְכֵי מִקְרֵהּ לֵילְיָא וְיִפּוֹק לְמִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא לָא יֵעוּל לְגוֹ מַשְׁרִיתָא
verses.ar_en: If there is a man among you who is not undefiled [because of] a nocturnal incident; he must go out of the camp, he may not enter into the midst of the camp.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי לְמִפְנֵי רַמְשָׁא יַסְחֵי בְמַיָא וּכְמֵעַל שִׁמְשָׁא יֵעוּל לְגוֹ מַשְׁרִיתָא
verses.ar_en: As sunset nears he is to immerse in water; and after the sun has set he may enter the the midst of the camp.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתַר מְתַקֵן יְהֵי לָךְ מִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא וְתִפּוֹק תַּמָן לְבָרָא
verses.ar_en: Have a designated [prepared] place outside the camp, and you will go out there to excrete.

verses.ar_he: וְסִכְּתָא תְּהֵי לָךְ עַל זֵינָךְ וִיהֵי בְּמִיתְבָךְ לְבָרָא וְתַחְפַּר בַּהּ וּתְתוּב וּתְכַסֵי יָת מִפְּקָתָךְ
verses.ar_en: And a peg are you to have in addition to your weapons; when you need to sit to excrete dig with it, then use it again to cover your excrement.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ שְׁכִינְתֵּהּ מְהַלְכָא בְּגוֹ מַשְׁרִיתָךְ לְשֵׁזָבוּתָךְ וּלְמִמְסַר בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ קֳדָמָךְ וּתְהֵי מַשְׁרִיתָךְ קַדִישָׁא וִלָא יִתְחֲזֵי בָךְ עֲבֵרַת פִּתְגָם וִיתוּב מֵימְרֵהּ מִלְאוֹטָבָא לָךְ
verses.ar_en: For Adonoy, your God, [His Shechinah] is moving within your camp to save you and to defeat your enemies before you, so your camp must be holy; let Him not see within you disgraceful [offensive] objects lest He [His word] turn away from you [from benefiting you].

verses.ar_he: לָא תִמְסַר עֶבֶד עַמְמִין לְיַד רִבּוֹנֵהּ דְיִשְׁתֵּזֵב לְוָתָךְ מִלְוָת רִבּוֹנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Do not deliver a [foreign] slave to [the hand of] his master, who escaped to you from his master.

verses.ar_he: עִמָךְ יִתֵּב בֵּינָךְ בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי בַּחֲדָא מִן קִרְוָיךְ בִּדְיֵיטַּב לֵהּ לָא תוֹנִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: With you will he live among you, in the place that he chooses in any of your cities, wherever it is good for him; do not distress him.

verses.ar_he: לָא תְהֵי אִתְּתָא מִבְּנַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לִגְבָר עָבֵד וְלָא יִסַב גַבְרָא מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אִתְּתָא אָמָא
verses.ar_en: There is not to be a [woman] harlot from the daughters of Yisroel [to a man slave]; and there shall not be a [man] male prostitute from the sons of Yisroel [to a woman servant].

verses.ar_he: לָא תָעֵל אֲגַר זַנִיתָא וְחוּלְפַן כַּלְבָא לְבֵית מַקְדְשָׁא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְכָל נִדְרָא אֲרֵי מְרָחָק קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ אַף תַּרְוֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Do not bring a harlot’s fee or payment for a dog to the house of Adonoy, your God, in fulfillment of any vow; because [distanced from] Adonoy, your God’s abominations are even both of them.

verses.ar_he: לָא תְרַבֵּי לַאֲחוּךְ רִבִּית כְּסַף רִבִּית עִבוּר רִבִּית כָּל מִדַעַם דְמִתְרַבֵּי
verses.ar_en: You may not pay usury to your brother, usury on money, usury on food; usury on any matter where it is paid.

verses.ar_he: לְבַר עַמְמִין תְּרַבֵּי וְלַאֲחוּךְ לָא תְרַבֵּי בְּדִיל דִיבָרֵכִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּכֹל אוֹשָׁטוּת יְדָךְ עַל אַרְעָא דִי אַתְּ עָלֵל:לתַמָן לְמֵירְתַהּ
verses.ar_en: You may pay usury to the stranger [foreigner], but to your brother do not pay usury; in order that Adonoy, your God, will bless you in all your commerce on the land that you are coming there to inherit.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִדַר נְדַר קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָא תְאַחַר לְשַׁלָמוּתֵהּ אֲרֵי מִתְבַּע יִתְבְּעִנֵהּ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מִנָךְ וִיהֵי בָךְ חוֹבָא
verses.ar_en: If you make a vow to [before] Adonoy, your God, do not delay in discharging it; for Adonoy, your God, will surely demand it from you, and you will be at fault.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תִתִּמְנַע לְמִנְדַר לָא יְהֵי בָךְ חוֹבָא
verses.ar_en: But if you desist from vowing, no fault will be found with you.

verses.ar_he: אַפָּקוּת סִפְוָתָךְ תִּטַר וְתַעְבֵּד כְּמָא דִי נְדַרְתָּא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ נְדַבְתָּא דִי מַלֶלְתָּא בְּפוּמָךְ
verses.ar_en: Keep what you have articulated; and perform whatever you vow; to [before] Adonoy, your God, voluntarily—whatever you say with your mouth.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִתָּגַר בְּכַרְמָא דְחַבְרָךְ וְתֵיכוּל עִנְבִין כְּנַפְשָׁךְ שִׂבְעָךְ וּלְמָאנָךְ לָא תִתֵּן
verses.ar_en: When you [are hired to] enter your fellow’s vineyard, you may eat grapes as you desire, to your satisfaction; but you may not place it in your container.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִתָּגַר בְּקַמְתָא דְחַבְרָךְ וְתִקְטוֹף מְלִילָן בִּידָךְ וּמַגְלָא לָא תְרִים עַל קַמְתָא דְחַבְרָךְ
verses.ar_en: When you [are hired to] enter your fellow’s standing grainstalks, you may cut off stalks by hand, but do not lift a sickle over your fellow’s standing grainstalks.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִסַב גְבַר אִתְּתָא וְיִבְעֲלִנַהּ וִיהֵי אִם לָא תַשְׁכַּח רַחֲמִין בְּעֵינוֹהִי אֲרֵי אַשְׁכַּח בַּהּ עֲבֵרַת פִתְגָם וְיִכְתּוֹב לַהּ גֵט פִּטוּרִין וִיהַב בִּידַהּ וְיִפְטְּרִנַהּ מִבֵּיתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If a man marries a woman and consummates with her; should she not find favor in his eyes because he found in her something lecherous [sinful], he is to write for her a document of severance and place [it] in her hand and send her from his home.

verses.ar_he: וְתִפּוֹק מִבֵּיתֵהּ וּתְהַךְ וּתְהֵי לִגְבַר אָחֳרָן
verses.ar_en: If she leaves his home and goes and becomes [wife] to another man.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְנִנַהּ גַבְרָא בַתְרָאָה וְיִכְתּוֹב לַהּ גֵטּ פִטּוּרִין וְיִתֵּן בִּידַהּ וְיִפְטְרִנַהּ מִבֵּיתֵהּ אוֹ אֲרֵי יְמוּת גַבְרָא בַתְרָאָה דְנָסְבַהּ לֵה לְאִנְתּוּ
verses.ar_en: If her last husband hates her and writes for her a document of severance and places [it] in her hand and sends her from his house, or if the latter man dies, who had taken her as his wife;

verses.ar_he: לֵית לֵהּ רְשׁוּ לְבַעֲלַהּ קַדְמָאָה דִי פָטְרַהּ לְמִתֻּב לְמִסְבַהּ לְמֶהֱוֵי לֵהּ לְאִנְתּוּ בָּתַר דִי אִסְתָּאָבַת אֲרֵי מְרָחָקָא הִיא קֳדָם יְיָ וְלָא תְחַיַב יָת אַרְעָא דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ אַחֲסָנָא
verses.ar_en: Her first husband who divorced her may not [has no permission to] remarry her to be his wife after her having been defiled, for it is an abomination before Adonoy; and you are not to make liable the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you as territory.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִסַב גְבַר אִתְּתָא חַדְתָּא לָא יִפּוֹק בְּחֵילָא וְלָא יֵעִבַר עֲלוֹהִי לְכָל מִדָעַם פָּנֵי יְהֵי לְבֵיתֵהּ שַׁתָּא חֲדָא וְיַחְדֵי יָת אִתְּתֵהּ דִי נְסַב
verses.ar_en: When a man marries a new wife, he is not to be mobilized into the army, it shall not impose itself over him in any matter; he shall be free for his home one year and he shall bring joy to the wife he married.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִסַב מַשְׁכּוֹנָא רֵחַיָא וְרִכְבָּא אֲרֵי בְהוֹן מִתְעֲבֵד מָזוֹן לְכָל נְפַשׁ
verses.ar_en: He may not secure as collateral a mortar or pestle, for his is taking life as security [for sustinance is made with these for all souls].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִשְׁתְּכַח גְבַר גָנֵב נַפְשָׁא מֵאֲחוֹהִי מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִתָּגַר בֵּהּ וִיזַבְּנִנֵהּ וְיִתְקְטֵל גַנָבָא הַהוּא וּתְפַלֵי עָבֵד דְבִישׁ מִבֵּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: If a man is apprehended having kidnaped a person from his brothers, from the descendants of Yisroel, and he exploited him and sold him; that kidnaper is to be put to death and you will eliminate the evil [doer] within you.

verses.ar_he: אִסְתַּמַר בְּמַכְתַּשׁ סְגִירוּ לְמִטַּר לַחֲדָא וּלְמֶעְבָּד כְּכֹל דִי יַלְפוּן יָתְכוֹן כָּהֲנַיָא לֵוָאֵי כְּמָא דִי פַקֶדְתִּנוּן תִּטְרוּן לְמֶעְבָּד
verses.ar_en: Take precautions with the leprosy affliction to be extremely careful and to do—in accordance with everything that the kohanim the Levites shall instruct you; as I commanded them are you to make sure to do.

verses.ar_he: הֱוֵי דְכִיר יָת דִי עֲבַד יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְמִרְיָם בְּאָרְחָא בְּמִפָקְכוֹן מִמִצְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: Remember what Adonoy, your God, did to Miriam on the way when you were going out of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תַרְשֵׁי בְחַבְרָךְ רְשׁוּ מִדָעַם לָא תֵעוּל לְבֵיתֵהּ לְמִסַב מַשְׁכּוֹנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If you become your fellow’s creditor for any amount of debt, do not enter his house to take his pledge [collateral].

verses.ar_he: בְּבָרָא תְּקוּם וְגַבְרָא דִי אַתְּ רָשֵׁי בֵהּ יַפֵק לְוָתָךְ יָת מַשְׁכּוֹנָא לְבָרָא
verses.ar_en: Stand outside, and the man from whom you are claiming, will bring out the pledge [collateral] to you outside.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם גְבַר מִסְכֵּן הוּא לָא תִשְׁכּוּב בְּמַשְׁכּוֹנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: And if he is a poor man, do not repose with his collateral [in your possession].

verses.ar_he: אָתָבָא תָתֵב לֵהּ יָת מַשְׁכּוֹנָא כְּמֵעַל שִׁמְשָׁא וְיִשְׁכּוּב בִּכְסוּתֵהּ וִיבָרֵכִנָךְ וְלָךְ תְּהֵי זְכוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: Return are you to return the pledge [collateral] to him at sunset, and he will sleep with his garment and bless you; and it will be to your credit [merit] before Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעֲשׁוֹק אֲגִירָא עַנְיָא וּמִסְכֵּנָא מֵאַחָיךְ אוֹ מִגִיוֹרָךְ דִי בְאַרְעָךְ בְּקִרְוָיךְ
verses.ar_en: Do not steal from the wage earner who is poor or destitute; from your brothers or your converts who are in your land in your cities.

verses.ar_he: בְּיוֹמֵהּ תִּתֵּן אַגְרֵהּ וְלָא תֵעוּל עֲלוֹהִי שִׁמְשָׁא אֲרֵי עַנְיָא הוּא וְלֵהּ הוּא מְסַר יָת נַפְשֵׁהּ וְלָא יִקְרֵי עֲלָךְ קֳדָם יְיָ וִיהֵי בָךְ חוֹבָא
verses.ar_en: On its day give his wage and let the sun not set upon it, for he is a poor man, and he places his life in jeopardy for it; [so that] he should not complain about you to [before] Adonoy, and you will have a sin.

verses.ar_he: לָא יְמוּתוּן אֲבָהָן עַל פּוּם בְּנִין וּבְנִין לָא יְמוּתוּן עַל פּוּם אֲבָהָן אֱנַשׁ בְּחוֹבֵהּ יְמוּתוּן
verses.ar_en: Fathers shall not be executed through [by the mouths of] sons, and sons shall not be executed through [by the mouths of] fathers; each to be executed for his sin.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַצְלֵי דִין גִיוֹרָא וְיִתַּמָא וְלָא תִסַב מַשְׁכּוֹנָא לְבוּשׁ אַרְמְלָא
verses.ar_en: Do not be devious in [forcibly wrench] the judgment of the proselyte or orphan; and you may not secure as collateral, a widow’s garment.

verses.ar_he: וְתִדְכַּר אֲרֵי עַבְדָא הֲוֵיתָא בְּמִצְרַיִם וּפָרְקָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מִתַּמָן עַל כֵּן אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ לְמֶעְבַּד יָת פִּתְגָמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: Remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and Adonoy, your God, redeemed you from there; that is why I am commanding you to do this thing.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תַחְצוֹד חֲצָדָךְ בְּחַקְלָךְ וְתִנְשֵׁי עֻמְרָא בְחַקְלָא לָא תְתוּב לְמִסְבֵהּ לְגִיוֹרָא לְיִתַּמָא וּלְאַרְמְלָא יְהֵי בְּדִיל דִיבָרֵכִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּכֹל עוֹבָדֵי יְדָךְ
verses.ar_en: When you reap your reaping in your field, and you forget a sheaf in the field, you may not return to take it; for the proselyte, for the orphan, and for the widow let it be; in order that Adonoy, your God, will bless you in all your endeavors.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תַחְבּוֹט זֵיתָךְ לָא תְפַלֵי בַּתְרָךְ לְגִיוֹרָא לְיִתַּמָא וּלְאַרְמְלָא יְהֵי
verses.ar_en: When you harvest your olive tree, you may not strip it of its glory behind you. for the proselyte, for the orphan, and for the widow let it be.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִקְטוֹף כַּרְמָךְ לָא תְעָלֵל בַּתְרָךְ לְגִיוֹרָא לְיִתַּמָא וּלְאַרְמְלָא יְהֵי
verses.ar_en: When you harvest your vineyard you may not harvest pygmy vines behind you; for the proselyte, for the orphan, and for the widow let it be.

verses.ar_he: וְתִדְכַּר אֲרֵי עַבְדָא הֲוֵיתָא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם עַל כֵּן אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ לְמֵעְבַּד יָת פִּתְגָמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt; that is why I am commanding you to do this thing.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְהֵי דִין בֵּין גֻבְרַיָא וְיִתְקָרְבוּן לְדִינָא וִידוּנֻנוּן וִיזַכּוּן יָת זַכָּאָה וִיחַיְבוּן יָת חַיָבָא
verses.ar_en: If a quarrel [lawsuit] should occur among men and they bring it to court and they judge them and they determine who is righteous and they convict the villain.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אִם בַּר חַיָבָא לְאַלְקָאָה חַיָבָא וְיִרְמִנֵהּ דַיָנָא וְיַלְקִנֵהּ קֳדָמוֹהִי כְּמִסַת חוֹבְתֵהּ בְּמִנְיָן
verses.ar_en: Should the wicked one deserve flogging, the judge shall incline him and have him flogged before him in the amount befitting his crime, with the number near.

verses.ar_he: אַרְבְּעִין יַלְקִנֵהּ לָא יוֹסֵף דִילְמָא יוֹסֵף לְאַלְקָיוּתֵהּ עַל אִלֵין מָחָא רַבָּא וְיֵקַל אֲחוּךְ לְעֵינָיךְ
verses.ar_en: Forty is he to have him flogged, he may not add; lest he additionally flog him over these, a great flogging, when your brother will be slighted before you.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵחוֹד פּוּם תּוֹרָא בִּדְיָשֵׁהּ
verses.ar_en: You may not muzzle [the mouth of] an ox while it threshes.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יֵתְבוּן אַחִין כַּחֲדָא וִימוּת חַד מִנְהוֹן וּבַר לֵית לֵהּ לָא תְהֵי אִתַּת מֵתָנָא לְבָרָא לִגְבַר אוֹחֲרָן יְבָמַהּ יֵעוּל עֲלַהּ וְיִסְבַהּ לֵהּ לְאִנְתּוּ וְיִבְּמַהּ
verses.ar_en: If brothers reside together, and one of them dies having no son, let the wife of the dead man not marry outside [the family] to a strange man; her brother-in-law will consummate with her thus marrying her to be his wife, and perform levirate marriage with her.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי בּוּכְרָא דִי תְלִיד יְקוּם עַל שְׁמָא דַאֲחוּהִי מֵתָנָא וְלָא יִתִּמְחֵי שְׁמֵהּ מִיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: It shall be that the firstborn, when she is capable of bearing children, shall be established in place of his deceased brother, so that his name may not be obliterated from Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא יִצְבֵי גַבְרָא לְמִסַב יָת יְבִמְתֵּהּ וְתִסַק יְבִמְתֵהּ לִתְרַע בֵּית דִינָא לָקֳדָם סָבַיָא וְתֵימַר לָא צָבֵי יְבָמִי לַאֲקָמָא לַאֲחוּהִי שְׁמָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לָא אָבֵי לְיַבָּמוּתִי
verses.ar_en: But if the man will not want to marry his sister-in-law; his sister-in-law must go up to the portal [of the court], to [before] the judges, and say, ‘‘My brother-in-law refuses [does not agree] to establish for his brother a name in Yisroel; he is unwilling to do perform levirate marriage with me.’’

verses.ar_he: וִיקְרוּן לֵהּ סָבֵי קַרְתֵּהּ וִימַלְלוּן עִמֵהּ וִיקוּם וְיֵימַר לָא רְעֵנָא לְמִסְבַהּ
verses.ar_en: The judges of his city will call him and converse with him. He shall stand and say, ‘‘I do not want to marry her.’’

verses.ar_he: וְתִתְקְרַב יְבִמְתֵּהּ לְוָתֵה לָקֳדָם סָבַיָא וְתַשְׁרֵי סֵינֵהּ מֵעַל רַגְלֵהּ וְתֵרוֹק בְּאַנְפּוֹהִי וְתָתֵב וְתֵימַר כְּדֵין יִתְעֲבֵד לִגְבַר דִי לָא יִבְנֵי יָת בֵּיתָא דַאֲחוּהִי
verses.ar_en: And his sister-in-law will approach him in the sight of the judges, and she will remove his shoe from upon his foot, and spit before him; and she will say aloud, ‘‘This is done to the man who will not build his brother’s family.’’

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְקְרֵי שְׁמֵהּ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּית שְׁרִי סֵינָא
verses.ar_en: And it will be entitled in Yisroel, the house of the divestiture of the shoe.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִנְצוּן גֻבְרִין כַּחֲדָא גְבַר וַאֲחוּהִי וְתִתְקְרֵב אִתַּת חַד לְשֵׁזָבָא יָת בַּעֲלַהּ מִיַד מָחוּהִי וְתוֹשֵׁט יְדַהּ וְתִתְקֵף בְּבֵית בַּהֲתְּתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If men engage in an altercation—a man and his brother—and the wife of one approaches to save her husband from his assailant, and she puts out her hand and grasps his genitals [the place of his shame],

verses.ar_he: וּתְקוּץ יָת יְדַהּ לָא תְחוּס עֵינָךְ
verses.ar_en: You shall sever her hand; you are not to have compassion.

verses.ar_he: לָא יְהֵי לָךְ בְּכִיסָךְ מַתְקַל וּמַתְקָל רַבְּתָא וּזְעֶרְתָּא
verses.ar_en: You are not to have for yourself in your pouch varying weight-stones, large and small.

verses.ar_he: לָא יְהֵי לָךְ בְּבֵיתָךְ מְכִילָא וּמְכִילָא רַבְּתָא וּזְעֶרְתָּא
verses.ar_en: You shall not have in your house varying measures, large and small.

verses.ar_he: מַתְקִלִין שָׁלְמִין דִקְשׁוֹט יְהוֹן לָךְ מְכִילָן שָׁלְמִין דִקְשׁוֹט יְהוֹן לָךְ בְּדִיל דְיוֹרְכוּן יוֹמָיךְ עַל אַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ
verses.ar_en: A fully accurate, just weight, you shall have, you are to have whole and honest measures; in order that you live long on the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי מְרָחָק קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלהָךְ כָּל עָבֵד אִלֵין כֹּל עָבֵד שְׁקַר
verses.ar_en: Because [distanced from before] Adonoy, your God’s abomination, are all who do these [things]; all who do falsehood.

verses.ar_he: הֲוֵי דְכִיר יָת דִי עֲבַד לָךְ עֲמָלֵק בְּאָרְחָא בְּמִפָּקְכוֹן מִמִצְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: Remember what Amalek perpetrated against you on the way when you were going out of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: דִי עָרְעָךְ בְּאָרְחָא וְקָטֵל בָּךְ כָּל דַהֲווֹ מִתְאַחֲרִין בַּתְרָךְ וְאַתְּ מְשַׁלְהֵי וְלָאֵי וְלָא דָחֵיל מִן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: When they chanced upon [overtook] you en route struck down [killed] your appendage—all the feeble ones behind you—and you were exhausted and wearied, and they had no fear of [before] God.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי כַּד יְנִיחַ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָךְ מִכָּל בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ מִסְחוֹר סְחוֹר בְּאַרְעָא דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ אַחֲסָנָא לְמֵירְתַהּ תִּמְחֵי יָת דוּכְרָנָא דַעֲמָלֵק מִתְּחוֹת שְׁמַיָא לָא תִּתִּנְשֵׁי
verses.ar_en: When Adonoy, your God, has given you repose from all your enemies around, in the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you as territory to inherit, you shall obliterate the memory [males] of Amalek from beneath the sky; do not forget.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי תֵעוּל לְאַרְעָא דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ אַחֲסָנָא וְתֵירְתַהּ וְתֵיתֵב בַּהּ
verses.ar_en: When it happens that you come to the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you as territory, nd you inherit it and settle it;

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב מֵרֵישׁ כָּל אִבָּא דְאַרְעָא דִי תָעֵל מֵאַרְעָךְ דִי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ וּתְשַׁוֵי בְסַלָא וּתְהַךְ לְאַתְרָא דִי יִתִּרְעֵי יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ תַּמָן
verses.ar_en: You are to take of the first of all the fruits of the soil that you bring from your land, that Adonoy, your God, is giving you, and place [it] in a basket; and go to the place that Adonoy, your God, chooses to house His Presence there.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵיתֵי לְוָת כַּהֲנָא דִי יְהֵי בְּיוֹמַיָא הָאִנוּן וְתֵימַר לֵהּ חַוֵיתִי יוֹמָא דֵין קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ אֲרֵי עַלִית לְאַרְעָא דִי קַיִים יְיָ לַאֲבָהָתָנָא לְמִתַּן לָנָא
verses.ar_en: You are to come to the kohein who will be [of service] during those days and you will say to him, ‘‘I ascertain today to [before] Adonoy, your God, that I have arrived in the land that Adonoy swore to our forefathers to give us.’’

verses.ar_he: וְיִסַב כַּהֲנָא סַלָא מִידָךְ וְיַחְתִנֵהּ קֳדָם מַדְבְּחָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall then take the basket from your hand, and he will place it before the altar of Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וְתָתֵיב וְתֵימַר קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָבָן אֲרָמָאָה בָּעָא לְאוֹבָדָא יָת אַבָּא וּנְחַת לְמִצְרַיִם וְדָר תַּמָן בְּעַם זְעֵר וַהֲוָה תַמָן לְעַם רַב תַּקִיף וְסַגִי
verses.ar_en: And you shall then proclaim and say before Adonoy, your God, ‘‘[Lovon] the Aramite [wanted to] destroy[ed] my forefather, then he descended to Egypt and sojourned there with a tiny community [small nation]; and there he became a great people, powerful and numerous.

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְאִישׁוּ לָנָא מִצְרָאֵי וְעַנְיָנָא וִיהָבוּ עֲלָנָא פָּלְחָנָא קַשְׁיָא
verses.ar_en: ‘‘The Egyptians treated us badly and oppressed us, and they imposed hard labor upon us.

verses.ar_he: וְצַלֵינָא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָא דַאֲבָהָתָנָא וְקַבִּיל יְיָ צְלוֹתָנָא וּגְלֵי קֳדָמוֹהִי עַמְלָנָא וְלֵאוּתָנָא וְדוּחֲקָנָא
verses.ar_en: ‘‘We prayed to [before] Adonoy, God of our forefathers, and Adonoy accepted our prayer, and perceived [before Him] our oppression, and our labor, and the pressure upon us.

verses.ar_he: וְאַפְּקָנָא יְיָ מִמִצְרַיִם בִּידָא תַקִיפָא וּבִדְרָעָא מְרַמְמָא וּבְחֶזְוָנָא רַבָּא וּבְאָתִין וּבְמוֹפְתִין
verses.ar_en: ‘‘And Adonoy took us out of Egypt with a powerful hand and with an extended arm, and with great display, and with signs, and with wonders.

verses.ar_he: וְאַיְתָנָא לְאַתְרָא הָדֵין וִיהַב לָנָא יָת אַרְעָא הָדָא אַרְעָא עָבְדָא חֲלַב וּדְבָש
verses.ar_en: ‘‘And He brought us to this place, and He gave us this land, a land flowing milk and honey.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן הָא אַיְתֵתִי יָת רֵישׁ אִבָּא דְאַרְעָא דִיהַבְתְּ לִי יְיָ וְתַחְתִנֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וְתִסְגוּד קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: And now, see! I have brought the first of the fruits of the soil that You have given me Adonoy.’’ And you shall then place it before Adonoy, your God, and you will prostrate yourself in the presence of Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וְתֶחֱדֵי בְכָל טַבְתָא דִי יְהַב לָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וְלֶאֱנַשׁ בֵּיתָךְ אַתְּ וְלֵוָאֵי וְגִיוֹרָא דִי בֵינָךְ
verses.ar_en: You shall rejoice with all the good that Adonoy, your God, gave you and [the members of] your household; you, the levi, and the proselyte in your midst.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תְשֵׁצֵי לְעַשָׂרָא יָת כָּל מַעְשַׂר עֲלַלְתָּךְ בְּשַׁתָּא תְלִיתָאָה שְׁנַת מַעְשְׂרָא וְתִתֵּן לְלֵוָאֵי לְגִיוֹרָא לְיִתַּמָא וּלְאַרְמְלָא וְיֵכְלוּן בְּקִרְוָיךְ וְיִשְׂבְּעוּן
verses.ar_en: When you finish tithing all the tithes of your produce in the third year, the year of the tithe; and you have given to the Levi, to the proselyte, to the orphan, and to the widow, so that they may eat within your portals to their satisfaction;

verses.ar_he: וְתֵימַר קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ פַּלֵתִי קֹדֶשׁ מַעְשְׂרָא מִן בֵּיתָא וְאַף יְהָבִתֵּהּ לְלֵוָאֵי וּלְגִיוֹרָא לְיִתַּמָא וּלְאַרְמְלָא כְּכָל פִּקוּדָךְ דִי פַקִדְתַּנִי לָא עֲבָרִית מִפִּקוּדָיךְ וְלָא אִתִּנְשֵׁיתִי
verses.ar_en: You shall declare before Adonoy, your God, ‘‘I have divested my estate of sacred [tithe] material, and I have also presented it to the Levi and also to the proselyte, the orphan, and the widow, totally according to Your command that You commanded me; I did not transgress any of Your commandments nor did I forget.

verses.ar_he: לָא אֲכָלִית בְּאֶבְלִי מִנֵהּ וְלָא פַלֵתִי מִנֵהּ בִּמְסָאָב וְלָא יְהָבִית מִנֵהּ לְמִית קַבֵּלִית לְמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָי עֲבָדִית כְּכֹלּ דִי פַקִדְתַּנִי
verses.ar_en: I did not eat of it when grieving, nor did I devour it when ritually defiled, nor did I make use of it for the dead; I have heeded the voice [word] of Adonoy, my God; I have fulfilled everything that You commanded me.

verses.ar_he: אִסְתְּכִי מִמְדוֹר קוּדְשָׁךְ מִן שְׁמַיָא וּבָרֵךְ יָת עַמָךְ יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיָת אַרְעָא דִי יְהַבְתְּ לָנָא כְּמָא דִי קַיֶמְתָּא לַאֲבָהָתָנָא אֲרַע עָבְדָא חֲלַב וּדְבָשׁ
verses.ar_en: View, from Your sacred residence, from the heavens, and bless Your people, Yisroel and the soil which You have given us, as You swore to our forefathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.’’

verses.ar_he: יוֹמָא הָדֵין יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מְפַקְדָךְ לְמֶעְבַּד יָת קְיָמַיָא הָאִלֵין וְיָת דִינַיָא וְתִטַר וְתַעְבֵּד יָתְהוֹן בְּכָל לִבָּךְ וּבְכָל נַפְשָׁךְ
verses.ar_en: This very day, Adonoy, your God, commands you to perform these statutes and the laws; you shall observe and perform them wholeheartedly and with your whole being.

verses.ar_he: יָת יְיָ חֲטַּבְתָּ יוֹמָא דֵין לְמֶהֱוֵי לָךְ לֶאֱלָהּ וְלִמְהַךְ בְּאָרְחָן דְתָקְנָן קֳדָמוֹהִי וּלְמִטַר קְיָמוֹהִי וּפִקוּדוֹהִי וְדִינוֹהִי וּלְקַבָּלָא לְמֵימְרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy, you have distinguised today to be a God for you and to go in His ways [which are proper before Him] and to guard His statutes and His commandments and His laws, and to obey Him [accept His word].

verses.ar_he: וַיְיָ חָטְבָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין לְמֶהֱוֵי לֵהּ לְעַם חַבִּיב כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל לָךְ וּלְמִטַר כָּל פִּקוּדוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy has distinguished you today to be for Him a treasured people as He said to you, and to guard all His commandments.

verses.ar_he: וּלְמִתְּנָךְ עִלָאָה עַל כָּל עַמְמַיָא דִי עֲבַד לְתֻשְׁבָּחָא וּלְשׁוּם וְלִרְבוּ וּלְמֶהֱוָךְ עַם קַדִישׁ קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל
verses.ar_en: And to place you superior to all the nations whom He made, for praise and for renown and for glory, and so that you may be a people sanctified to [before] Adonoy, your God, as He said.

verses.ar_he: וּפַקִיד מֹשֶׁה וְסָבֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת עַמָא לְמֵימָר טַר יָת כָּל תַּפְקֶדְתָּא דִי אֲנָא מְפַקֵד יָתְכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין
verses.ar_en: Moshe and the elders of Yisroel commanded the people the following, ‘‘Keep all of the commandment that I am commanding you today.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי בְּיוֹמָא דִי תַעְבְּרוּן יָת יַרְדְנָא לְאַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ וּתְקִים לָךְ אַבְנִין רַבְרְבִין וּתְסוּד יָתְהוֹן בְּסִידָא
verses.ar_en: When the day comes that you cross the Yardein to the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you, erect large stones and coat them with whitewash.

verses.ar_he: וְתִכְתּוֹב עֲלֵיהוֹן יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמֵי אוֹרַיְתָא הָדָא בְּמֶעְבְּרָךְ בְּדִיל דִי תֵעוּל לְאַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ אַרְעָא עָבְדָא חֲלַב וּדְבַשׁ כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל יְיָ אֱלָהָא דַאֲבָהָתָךְ לָךְ
verses.ar_en: You are to write on them all statements of this Torah upon your crossing; in order that you come to the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you, a land flowing milk and honey, as promised by Adonoy, God of your forefathers, to you.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי בְּמֵעֲבָרְכוֹן יָת יַרְדְנָא תְּקִימוּן יָת אַבְנַיָא הָאִלֵין דִי אֲנָא מְפַקֵד יָתְכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין בְּטּוּרָא דְעֵיבָל וּתְסוּד יָתְהוֹן בְּסִידָא
verses.ar_en: As soon as you have crossed the Yardein, set up these stones that I am commanding you today, on Mount Eival, and coat them with whitewash.

verses.ar_he: וְתִבְנֵי תַמָן מַדְבְּחָא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ מַדְבַּח אַבְנִין לָא תְרִים עֲלֵיהוֹן פַּרְזְלָא
verses.ar_en: Build there an altar to [before] Adonoy, your God; an altar of stones; do not lift iron upon them.

verses.ar_he: אַבְנִין שָׁלְמִין תִּבְנֵי יָת מַדְבְּחָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וְתַסֵק עֲלוֹהִי עֲלָוָן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: [Of] whole stones are you to build the altar of Adonoy, your God; and you are to bring upon it burnt-offerings to [before] Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וְתִכּוֹס נִכְסַת קוּדְשִׁין וְתֵיכוּל תַּמָן וְתֶחֱדֵי קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: You are to slaughter peace [sacred]-offerings and eat [them] there; and you are to rejoice in the presence of Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וְתִכְתּוֹב עַל אַבְנַיָא יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמֵי אוֹרַיְתָא הָדָא פָּרַשׁ יָאוּת
verses.ar_en: You are to write on the stones all the statements of this Torah, explained properly.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל מֹשֶׁה וְכָהֲנַיָא לֵוָאֵי לְכָל יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימָר אֲצֵית וּשְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹמָא הָדֵין הֲוֵיתָא לְעַמָא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: Moshe and the kohanim-Levi’im addressed all of Yisroel, to say, ‘‘Take heed and accept, Yisroel! [On] this day you have become a people to [before] Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקַבֵּל לְמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וְתַעְבֵּד יָת פִּקוּדוֹהִי וְיָת קְיָמוֹהִי דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין
verses.ar_en: You are to obey [accept the word of] Adonoy, your God, and perform His commandments and His statutes that I am commanding you today.’’

verses.ar_he: וּפַקִיד מֹשֶׁה יָת עַמָא בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Moshe commanded the people on that day, to say,

verses.ar_he: אִלֵין יְקוּמוּן לְבָרָכָא יָת עַמָא עַל טוּרָא דִגְרִזִים בְּמֵעֲבָרְכוֹן יָת יַרְדְנָא שִׁמְעוֹן וְלֵוִי וִיהוּדָה וְיִשָׂשכָר וְיוֹסֵף וּבִנְיָמִין
verses.ar_en: ‘‘The following will stand to bless the people on Mount Gerizim, upon your crossing the Yardein: Shimon and Levi and Yehudah, and Yisachar and Yoseif and Binyomin.

verses.ar_he: וְאִלֵין יְקוּמוּן עַל לְוָטַיָא בְּטוּרָא דְעֵיבָל רְאוּבֵן גָד וְאָשֵׁר וּזְבוּלֻן דָן וְנַפְתָּלִי
verses.ar_en: And the following will stand for the curse[rs] at Mount Eival: Reuvein, Gad and Asher, and Zevulun, Don and Naftoli.

verses.ar_he: וִיתִיבוּן לֵוָאֵי וְיֵימְרוּן לְכָל אֱנַשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָלָא רָמָא
verses.ar_en: The Levi’im are to respond and say to every man of Yisroel aloud:

verses.ar_he: לִיט גַבְרָא דִי יַעְבֵּד צֶלֶם וּמַתְּכָא מְרָחָקָא קֳדָם יְיָ עֹבַד יְדֵי אֳמָן וְשַׁוִי בְסִתְרָא וִיתִיבוּן כָּל עַמָא וְיֵימְרוּן אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is the man who makes a statue or a molten image, [distanced before] Adonoy’s abomination, the handiwork of a craftsman, and places [it] in a secret [place];’ the entire people will respond and say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיטּ דְיִקְלֵי אֲבוּהִי וְאִמֵהּ וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever reviles his father or his mother,’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיטּ דְיַשְׁנֵי תְּחוּמָא דְחַבְרֵהּ וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever casts aside [changes] the boundary of his fellow;’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיט דְיַטְעֵי עַוִירָא בְּאָרְחָא וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever misleads the blind about the way;’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיטּ דְיַצְלֵי דִין דַיַר יִתַּמָא וְאַרְמְלָא וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever distorts justice for a convert, orphan, or widow;’ and entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיט דְיִשְׁכּוּב עִם אִתַּת אֲבוּהִי אֲרֵי גַלִי כַּנְפָא דַאֲבוּהִי וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever has intercourse with his father’s wife, because he exposed the corner of his father[’s garment];’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיט דְיִשְׁכּוּב עִם כָּל בְּעִירָא וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever has intercourse with any animal;’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיט דְיִשְׁכּוּב עִם אֲחָתֵהּ בַּת אֲבוּהִי אוֹ בַת אִמֵהּ וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever has intercourse with his sister, daughter of his father or daughter of his mother;’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיט דְיִשְׁכּוּב עִם חֲמוֹתֵהּ וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever has intercourse with his father’s-in-law wife;’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיט דְיִמְחֵי לְחַבְרֵהּ בְּסִתְרָא וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever strikes his fellow in secret;’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיטּ דִי מְקַבֵּל שׂחֲדָא לְמִקְטַל נְפַשׁ דַם זַכַּי וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever accepts a bribe to kill an innocent person;’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: לִיט דִי לָא יְקַיַם יָת פִּתְגָמֵי אוֹרַיְתָא הָדָא לְמֶעְבַּד יָתְהוֹן וְיֵימַר כָּל עַמָא אָמֵן
verses.ar_en: ‘Cursed is whoever does not uphold the statements of this Torah to perform them;’ and the entire people will say, Amein.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אִם קַבָּלָא תְקַבֵּל לְמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְמִטַר לְמֶעְבַּד יָת כָּל פִּקוּדוֹהִי דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין וְיִתְּנִנָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ עִלָאָה עַל כָּל עַמְמֵי אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: When you hearken and obey [accept the word of] Adonoy, your God, to be sure to perform all of His commandments that I am commanding you today; Adonoy, your God, will place you superior to all the nations of the earth.

verses.ar_he: וְיֵיתוּן עֲלָךְ כָּל בִּרְכְּתָא הָאִלֵין וְיִדְבְּקֻנָךְ אֲרֵי תְקַבַּל לְמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: All these blessings will come upon you and will reach [adhere to] you, when you obey [accept the word of] Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: בְּרִיךְ אַתְּ בְּקַרְתָּא וּבְרִיךְ אַתְּ בְּחַקְלָא
verses.ar_en: Blessed are you in the city, and blessed are you in the field.

verses.ar_he: בְּרִיךְ וַלְדָא דִמְעָךְ וְאִבָּא דְאַרְעָךְ וּוַלְדָא דִבְעִירָךְ בַּקְרֵי תוֹרָיךְ וְעֶדְרֵי עָנָךְ
verses.ar_en: Blessed is the fruit [offspring] of your belly, and the produce [fruit] of your soil, and the offspring of your animals, the issue of your cattle and the flocks of your sheep and goats.

verses.ar_he: בְּרִיךְ סַלָךְ וְאַצְוָתָךְ
verses.ar_en: Blessed will be your [fruit] basket and your solid foods.

verses.ar_he: בְּרִיךְ אַתְּ בְּמֵעֲלָךְ וּבְרִיךְ אַתְּ בְּמִפְּקָךְ
verses.ar_en: You will be blessed at your arrival, and blessed at your departure.

verses.ar_he: יִתֵּן יְיָ יָת בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ דְקָיְמִין עֲלָךְ תְּבִירִין קֳדָמָךְ בְּאָרְחָא חַדָא יִפְּקוּן לְוָתָךְ וּבְשִׁבְעָא אָרְחָן יֵעִרְקוּן מִקֳדָמָךְ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will set your enemies who rise against you smitten [broken] before you; by one road will they approach you, but by seven roads they will flee from you.

verses.ar_he: יְפַקֵד יְיָ עִמָךְ יָת בִּרְכְּתָא בְּאוֹצָרָךְ וּבְכֹל אוֹשָׁטוּת יְדָךְ וִיבָרְכִנָךְ בְּאַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will order upon you the blessing in your storehouses and in all your commerce; and He will bless you in the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you.

verses.ar_he: יְקִימִנָךְ יְיָ לֵהּ לְעַם קַדִישׁ כְּמָא דִי קַיִים לָךְ אֲרֵי תִטַר יָת פִּקוּדַיָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וּתְהַךְ בְּאָרְחָן דְתָקְנָן קֳדָמוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will establish you for Himself as a holy people as He swore to you; when you will guard the commandments of Adonoy, your God, and will go in His ways [that are correct before Him].

verses.ar_he: וְיֶחֱזוּן כָּל עַמְמֵי אַרְעָא אֲרֵי שְׁמָא דַיְיָ אִתְקְרֵי עֲלָךְ וְיִדְחֲלוּן מִנָךְ
verses.ar_en: And all the peoples of the earth will see that you are called by Adonoy’s Name and they will fear you.

verses.ar_he: וְיוֹתְרִנָךְ יְיָ לְטָבָא בְּוַלְדָא דִמְעָךְ וּבְוַלְדָא דִבְעִירָךְ וּבְאִבָּא דְאַרְעָךְ עַל אַרְעָא דִי קַיִים יְיָ לַאֲבָהָתָךְ לְמִתַּן לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will give you surplus as benefit in the fruit [offspring] of your belly, and the offspring of your animals, and the produce [fruit] of your soil; upon the land that Adonoy swore to your forefathers to give you.

verses.ar_he: יִפְתַּח יְיָ לָךְ יָת אוֹצָרֵהּ טָבָא יָת שְׁמַיָא לְמִתַּן מְטַר אַרְעָךְ בְּעִדָנֵהּ וּלְבָרָכָא יָת כָּל עוֹבָדֵי יְדָךְ וְתוֹזֵף לְעַמְמִין סַגִיאִין וְאַתְּ לָא תְזוּף
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will open for you His good storehouse, the sky, to give you your land’s rain on time and to bless all your endeavors; and you will lend to many nations, but you will not borrow.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְּנִנָךְ יְיָ לְתַקִיף וְלָא לְחַלָשׁ וּתְהֵי בְּרַם לְעֵלָא וְלָא תְהֵי לְתַחְתָּא אֲרֵי תְקַבֵּל לְפִקוּדַיָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין לְמִטַר וּלְמֶעְבָּד
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will place you at the head [to be powerful], not at the tail [to be weak]; and you will be solely on top, you will not be on the bottom; when you heed the commandments of Adonoy, your God, that I am commanding you today to guard and to perform.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תִסְטוּן מִכָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא דִי אֲנָא מְפַקֵד יָתְכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין יַמִינָא וּשְׂמָאלָא לִמְהַךְ בָּתַר טַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא לְמִפְלְחִנוּן
verses.ar_en: And you do not deviate from all the statements that I am commanding you today to the right or to the left, to follow other gods [idols of the nations] to serve them.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אִם לָא תְקַבַּל בְּמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְמִטַר לְמֶעְבַּד יָת כָּל פִּקוּדוֹהִי וּקְיָמוֹהִי דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין וְיֵיתוּן עֲלָךְ כָּל לְוָטַיָא הָאִלֵין וְיִדְבְּקֻנָךְ
verses.ar_en: Should you not obey [accept the word of] Adonoy, your God, to guard to perform all His commandments and His statutes that I am commanding you today; then all these curses will come upon you and will reach [cleave to] you.

verses.ar_he: לִיטּ אַתְּ בְּקַרְתָא וְלִיט אַתְּ בְּחַקְלָא
verses.ar_en: Cursed are you in the city and cursed are you in the field.

verses.ar_he: לִיט סַלָךְ וְאַצְוָתָךְ
verses.ar_en: Cursed is your [fruit] basket and cursed are your solid foods.

verses.ar_he: לִיטּ וַלְדָא דִמְעָךְ וְאִבָּא דְאַרְעָךְ בַּקְרֵי תוֹרָיךְ וְעֶדְרֵי עָנָךְ
verses.ar_en: Cursed is the fruit [offspring] of your belly and the produce [fruit] of your soil, the calves of your cattle and the flocks of your sheep and goats.

verses.ar_he: לִיט אַתְּ בְּמֵעֲלָךְ וְלִיט אַתְּ בְּמִפְּקָךְ
verses.ar_en: Cursed are you upon your arrival and cursed are you upon your departure.

verses.ar_he: יְגָרֵי יְיָ בָּךְ יָת מֵאַרְתָּא וְיָת שִׁגוּשַׁיָא וְיָת מְזוֹפִיתָא בְּכָל אוֹשָׁטוּת יְדָךְ דִי תַעְבֵּד עַד דְתִשְׁתֵּצֵי וְעַד דְתֵיבַד בִּפְרִיעַ מִן קֳדָם בִּישׁוּת עוֹבָדָיךְ דִשְׁבַקְתָּא דַחַלְתִּי
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will visit upon you ruin, panic, and frustration in all the endeavors you undertake, until you are destroyed and until you are swiftly removed because of the wickedness of your deeds [in] that you forsook [the fear of] Me.

verses.ar_he: יַדְבֵּק יְיָ בָּךְ יָת מוֹתָא עַד דִישֵׁיצֵי יָתָךְ מֵעַל אַרְעָא דִי אַתְּ עָלֵל לְתַמָן לְמִירְתַהּ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will attach the plague to you until He exterminates you from upon the land that you are coming there to inherit.

verses.ar_he: יִמְחִנָךְ יְיָ בְּשַׁחֶפְתָּא וּבְקַדַחְתָּא וּבִדְלֶקְתָּא וּבְחַרְחוּרָא וּבְחַרְבָּא וּבְשִׁדְפוֹנָא וּבְיַרְקוֹנָא וְיִרְדְפֻנָךְ עַד דְתֵיבָד
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will smite you with blistering and with searing temperature, and with raging fever, and with charchur, and with the sword, and with wind-blight, and with yellowing; and they will chase you until your annihilation.

verses.ar_he: וִיהוֹן שְׁמַיָךְ דִי עִלָוֵי רֵישָׁךְ חֲסִינִין כִּנְחָשָׁא מִלְאֲחָתָא מִטְרָא וְאַרְעָא דִי תְחוֹתָךְ תַּקִיפָא כְפַרְזְלָא מִלְמֶעְבַּד פֵּרִין
verses.ar_en: And the heavens above your head will be [unyielding] like copper [in withholding rain] and the earth that is beneath you, [as strong as] iron [so as not to bear fruit].

verses.ar_he: יִתֵּן יְיָ יָת מְטַר אַרְעָךְ אַבְקָא וְעַפְרָא מִן שְׁמַיָא יֵחוּת עֲלָךְ עַד דְתִשְׁתֵּצֵי
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will make the rain of your land into dust and soil; from the sky will it come down upon you until you are destroyed.

verses.ar_he: יִתְּנִנָךְ יְיָ תְּבִיר קֳדָם סָנְאָךְ בְּאָרְחָא חֲדָא תִּפּוֹק לְוָתֵהּ וּבְשִׁבְעָא אָרְחָן תֵּעִרוֹק מִקָדָמוֹהִי וּתְהֵי לְזִיעַ לְכָל מַלְכְּוַת אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will set you smitten [broken] before your enemies. By one road will you go out toward them and by seven roads will you flee before them; and you will be a cause of shuddering for all the kingdoms of the earth.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי נְבִלְתָּךְ מְשַׁגְרָא לְמֵיכַל לְכָל עוֹפָא דִשְׁמַיָא וְלִבְעִירַת אַרְעָא וְלֵית דְמָנִיד
verses.ar_en: Your corpse will be [cast out for] food for every bird of the sky and for the animals of the earth; with no one to scare [them].

verses.ar_he: יִמְחִנָךְ יְיָ בְּשִׁחֲנָא דְמִצְרַיִם וּבִטְּחוֹרִין וּבְגַרְבָּא וּבַחֲרִיס יַבִּישׁ דִי לָא תִכּוּל לְאִתַּסָאָה
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will plague you with Egyptian boils and with hemorroids and with running and dry boils; from which you will be unable to be healed.

verses.ar_he: יִמְחִנָךְ יְיָ בְּטַפְשׁוּתָא וּבְסַמְיוּתָא וּבְשַׁעֲמָמוּת לִבָּא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will plague you with insanity and with blindness, and with utter confusion [in your heart].

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי מְמַשֵׁשׁ בְּטִּהֲרָא כְּמָא דִי מַשֵׁשׁ עַוִירָא בְּקַבְלָא וְלָא תַצְלַח יָת אָרְחָתָיךְ וּתְהֵי בְּרַם עָשִׁיק וְאָנִיס כָּל יוֹמַיָא וְלֵית דְפָרִיק
verses.ar_en: You will grope at midday the way a blind man gropes in the darkness, and you will not succeed your ways; you will be only the victim of wrangling and robbed all the days with no savior.

verses.ar_he: אִתְּתָא תֵירוֹס וּגְבַר אָחֳרָן יִשְׁכְּבִנַהּ בֵּיתָא תִבְנֵי וְלָא תֵיתֵב בֵּהּ כַּרְמָא תִצוֹב וְלָא תְחַלִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: A woman will you marry and another man will lie with her; a house will you build and will not live in it; a vineyard will you plant and will not redeem it[s fruit].

verses.ar_he: תּוֹרָךְ יְהֵי נָכֵס לְעֵינָיךְ וְלָא תֵיכוּל מִנֵהּ חֲמָרָךְ יְהֵי אָנֵס מִקֳדָמָךְ וְלָא יְתוּב לָךְ עָנָךְ מְסִירִין לְבַעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ וְלֵית לָךְ פָּרִיק
verses.ar_en: Your ox [will be] butchered before your eyes, and you will not eat of it; your ass [will be] robbed in your presence and will not return to you; your flocks [will be] given to your enemies, and you have no savior.

verses.ar_he: בְּנָיךְ וּבְנָתָיךְ מְסִירִין לְעַמָא אָחָרָן וְעֵינָךְ חֲזָן וִיסוּפָן בִּגְלָלְהֵן כָּל יוֹמָא וְלֵית חֵילָא בִּידָךְ
verses.ar_en: Your sons and your daughters [will be] given to another people while your eyes watch and pine for them [because of them] all day, and your are powerless.

verses.ar_he: אִבָּא דְאַרְעָךְ וְכָל לֵאוּתָךְ יֵכוּל עַמָא דִי לָא יְדַעַתְּ וּתְהֵי בְּרַם עָשִׁיק וּרְעִיעַ כָּל יוֹמַיָא
verses.ar_en: The fruit of your soil and all your toil will be eaten by a people that you do not know; and you will be solely oppressed and crushed all the time.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי מִשְׁתַּטֵה מֵחֵזוּ עֵינָיךְ דִי תֶחֱזֵי
verses.ar_en: And you will become insane [made] from the sights that you see.

verses.ar_he: יִמְחִנָךְ יְיָ בְשִׁחֲנָא בִישָׁא עַל רְכֻבַיָא וְעַל שָׁקַיָא דִי לָא תִכּוּל לְאִתַּסָאָה מִפַּרְסַת רַגְלָךְ וְעַד מוֹחָךְ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will plague you with bad boils on the knees and on the legs from which you will be unable to be healed; from the sole of your foot till your skull [brain].

verses.ar_he: יַגְלֵי יְיָ יָתָךְ וְיָת מַלְכָּךְ דִי תְקִים עֲלָךְ לְעַם דִי לָא יְדַעַתְּ אַתְּ וְאַבָהָתָיךְ וְתִפְלַח תַּמָן לְעַמְמַיָא פָּלְחֵי טַעֲוָתָא אָעָא וְאַבְנָא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will lead [exile] you and your king, whom you will set upon yourself, to a nation that neither you nor your parents knew; and there you will serve other powers [nations worshipping idols] [of] wood and stone.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי לְצָדוּ לִמְתַל וּלְשׁוֹעֵי בְכֹל עַמְמַיָא דִי יִדְבְּרִנָךְ יְיָ לְתַמָן
verses.ar_en: You will become an [object of] stupefaction, be cited as an example and become the subject of gossip among all the peoples to whom Adonoy will lead you.

verses.ar_he: בַּר זְרַע סַגִי תַּפֵּק לְחַקְלָא וּזְעֵר תִּכְנוֹשׁ אֲרֵי יַחְסְלִנֵהּ גוֹבָא
verses.ar_en: Much seed will you take out to the fields, and little will you gather because the locust will demolish it.

verses.ar_he: כַּרְמִין תִּצוּב וְתִפְלַח וְחַמְרָא לָא תִשְׁתֵּי וְלָא תִכְנוֹשׁ אֲרֵי תֵיכְלִנֵהּ תֹּלַעְתָּא
verses.ar_en: Vineyards will you plant and labor in, but wine will you not drink nor will you store because worms will consume it.

verses.ar_he: זֵיתִין יְהוֹן לָךְ בְּכָל תְּחוּמָךְ וּמִשְׁחָא לָא תְסוּךְ אֲרֵי יִתְּרוּן זֵיתָיךְ
verses.ar_en: Olives will you have within your entire boundary, but oil will you not annoint because your olives (trees) will be discarded [wasted].

verses.ar_he: בְּנִין וּבְנָן תּוֹלִיד וְלָא יְהוֹן לָךְ אֲרֵי יְהָכוּן בְּשִׁבְיָא
verses.ar_en: Sons and daughters will you bear, but you will not have them because they will go into captivity.

verses.ar_he: כָּל אִילָנָךְ וְאִבָּא דְאַרְעָךְ יַחְסְנִנֵהּ סַקָאָה
verses.ar_en: All your trees and the fruit of your soil the cicada will impoverish.

verses.ar_he: תּוֹתַב עָרֵל דִי בֵינָךְ יְהֵי סְלִיק עֵיל מִנָךְ לְעֵלָא לְעֵלָא וְאַתְּ תְּהֵי נָחֵת לְתַחְתָּא לְתַחְתָּא
verses.ar_en: The non-Jew [uncircumcized alien] among you will rise above you higher and higher, while you descend lower and lower.

verses.ar_he: הוּא יוֹזְפִנָךְ וְאַתְּ לָא תוֹזְפִנֵהּ הוּא יְהֵי לְתַקִיף וְאַתְּ תְּהֵי לְחַלָשׁ
verses.ar_en: He will lend to you but you will not lend to him; he will be at the head [powerful], and you will be at the tail [weak].

verses.ar_he: וְיֵיתוּן עֲלָךְ כָּל לְוָטַּיָא הָאִלֵין וְיִרְדְפֻנָךְ וְיִדְבְּקֻנָךְ עַד דְתִשְׁתֵּצֵי אֲרֵי לָא קַבֶּלְתָּא לְמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְמִטַר פִּקוּדוֹהִי וּקְיָמוֹהִי דִי פַקְדָךְ
verses.ar_en: All these curses will come upon you and will chase you and reach [adhere to] you until you are destroyed; for you have not obeyed [accepted the word of] Adonoy, your God, to guard His commandments and His statutes that He commanded you.

verses.ar_he: וִיהוֹן בָּךְ לְאָת וּלְמוֹפֵת וּבִבְנָיךְ עַד עֳלָם
verses.ar_en: They will happen to you as a sign and a wonder, and to your descendants forever.

verses.ar_he: חֳלָף דִי לָא פְלַחְתָּא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בְּחֶדְוָא וּבְשַׁפִּירוּת לִבָּא מִסְגֵי כֹּלָא
verses.ar_en: Since you did not serve [before] Adonoy, your God, with joy and goodheartedness, in total affluence.

verses.ar_he: וְתִפְלַח יָת בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ דִי יְגָרִנֵהּ יְיָ בָּךְ בְּכַפְנָא וּבְצַחוּתָא וּבְעַרְטִּלְיָתָא וּבַחֲסִירוּת כֹּלָא וְיִתֵּן נִיר פַּרְזְלָא עַל צַוְארָךְ עַד דִישֵׁיצֵי יָתָךְ
verses.ar_en: You will serve your enemies whom Adonoy sends [will set] against you, in hunger and in thirst and in nakedness and lacking everything; and he will set an iron yoke upon your neck until he destroys you.

verses.ar_he: יַיְתִי יְיָ עֲלָךְ עַם מֵרָחִיק מִסְיָפֵי אַרְעָא כְּמָא דִי מִשְׁתְּדִי נִשְׁרָא עַמָא דִי לָא תִשְׁמַע לִישָׁנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will raise upon you a nation from afar from the end of the earth, as the eagle soars, a nation whose language you will not hear.

verses.ar_he: עַם תַּקִיף אַפִּין דִי לָא יִסַב אַפִּין לְסָבָא וְעַל יָנְקָא לָא מְרַחֵם
verses.ar_en: A hard-faced nation that will not show favor to the old, and will not pity the young.

verses.ar_he: וְיֵיכוּל וַלְדָא דִבְעִירָךְ וְאִבָּא דְאַרְעָךְ עַד דְתִשְׁתֵּצֵי דִי לָא יַשְׁאַר לָךְ עִבוּרָא חַמְרָא וּמִשְׁחָא בַּקְרֵי תוֹרָיךְ וְעֶדְרֵי עָנָךְ עַד דְיוֹבֵד יָתָךְ
verses.ar_en: They will consume the offspring of your animals, and the produce [fruit] of your soil until you are destroyed; that will not leave you grain, wine, or oil, the calves of your cattle, or the flocks of your sheep and goats until they have you removed.

verses.ar_he: וְיָעֵק לָךְ בְּכָל קִרְוָיךְ עַד דְיִכְבַּשׁ שׁוּרָיךְ רָמַיָא וּכְרִיכַיָא דִי אַתְּ רָחֵץ לְאִשְׁתֵּזָבָא בְּהֵן בְּכָל אַרְעָךְ וְיָעֵק לָךְ בְּכָל קִרְוָיךְ בְּכָל אַרְעָךְ דִי יְהַב יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָךְ
verses.ar_en: They will make you suffer in all your cities until mastering [capturing] your ramparts and fortified walls upon which you rely [to be saved] throughout your land; they will make you suffer in all your cities throughout your land that Adonoy, your God, has given you.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵיכוּל וַלְדָא דִמְעָךְ בְּשַׂר בְּנָיךְ וּבְנָתָיךְ דִי יְהַב לָךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ בִּצְיָרָא וּבְעַקְתָא דְיָעֵק לָךְ סַנְאָךְ
verses.ar_en: You will eat the flesh [offspring] of your womb, the flesh of your sons and your daughters that Adonoy, your God, gave you; in the siege and in the distress that your enemy will distress you.

verses.ar_he: גַבְרָא דְרַכִּיךְ בָּךְ וְדִמְפַנַק לַחֲדָא תַּבְאֵשׁ עֵינֵהּ בְּאָחוּהִי וּבְאִתַּת קְיָמֵהּ וּבִשְׁאָר בְּנוֹהִי דִי יַשְׁאַר
verses.ar_en: The delicate among you and the fastidious, [even] he will look askance at his brother and at the wife of his bosom [covenant] and at the rest of his sons whom he will leave over.

verses.ar_he: מִלְמִתַּן לְחַד מִנְהוֹן מִבְּשַׂר בְּנוֹהִי דִי יֵיכוּל מִדְלָא אִשְׁתָּאַר לֵהּ כֹּלָא בִּצְיָרָא וּבְעַקְתָא דִי יָעֵק לָךְ סָנְאָךְ בְכָל קִרְוָיךְ
verses.ar_en: From giving to any of them of the flesh of his sons that he is eating for [fear of] not leaving everything for himself; in siege and in distress that your enemy will distress you in all your cities.
